description:
Steadfast for Palestine, On October 4th, 2025, 11 AM at Pukeahu War Memorial Park we stand united to mark 2 years of Israel’s ongoing genocide against Palestine. A brutal reality that has been enabled, dismissed, and ignored while the New Zealand government continues to remain silent and inactive.

This is a call to all who believe in justice and human rights to join our hīkoi to Odlins Plaza for powerful speakers, solidarity stalls, and meaningful ways to take action. Our strength lies in Sumud [Palestinian steadfastness] and Kia Manawanui [Aotearoa’s perseverance.]

We demand SANCTIONS and an end to this violence. Together, we reaffirm our commitment to justice and to the long fight for Palestinian freedom.

- October 4th, 2025 | 11 AM
- Pukeahu War Memorial Park → Hīkoi to Odlins Plaza

description:
Jenin Jenin Screening, This spring from the 28th of August to the 2nd of October we will be screening a series of excellent Palestinian films, old and new, every week at two/fiftyseven on Willis Street, with ticket sales going to the Gazan mutual aid group The Sameer Project.
The Sameer Project is an on-the-ground aid organisation organised by Palestinians in the diaspora, which crowdfunds in order to provide tents, medical care and direct cash aid to those most affected in Gaza. They can be found on Instagram at @thesameerproject.
More information:
Jenin Jenin includes testimony from Jenin residents after the Israeli army’s Defensive Shield operation, during which the city and camp were the scenes of fierce fighting. The operation ended with Jenin flattened and scores of Palestinians killed. Palestinians as well as numerous human rights groups accused Israel of committing war crimes in the April 2002 attack on the refugee camp. The sad question forces itself on the spectator: What will become of a country, a people when its children are confronted with war and violence from a very early age?
label: Film & Media

description:
All Roads Lead to Kapiti from Comedy on the Coast, All Roads Lead to Kapiti from Comedy on the Coast
Kapiti Coast, NZ – Prepare to swap your Netflix night for something far funnier—All Roads Lead to Kapiti rolls into the Kapiti Playhouse on 20 September. Doors open at 7:30 pm, the laughs land at 8:00 pm.

Line-Up That’ll Make You Snort-Laugh

Richie Faavesi – "The 2024 Raw Comedy Quest finalist (and Whanganui’s chocolate-humour king) brings brutally honest, father-and-husband-life tales with enough grit and heart to dark-horse the dark side of comedy."
NZ Herald

MC Marc Hamilton – The smooth operator keeping the laughs rolling and the mic mayhem in check.

Emma Jean – A raw new voice and one of the Raw Comedy Quest finalists for 2025—expect freshness, edge, and zero filter.

Reon Matterman – Thrives on weaving truth bombs with sharp wit—something you’ll want to laugh and think about.

Advait Kirtikar – "Qualified actuary by day, Billy T-nominated comedian by night. His super-dry delivery and razor timing earned him awards, accolades, and the uncanny ability to make actuarial science sound sexy. He’s also a two-degree black-belt rock-climber-ex-gymnast blend of absurdity."
Scoop

Kyle Southam - All the way from the Wairarapa with jokes from the edge of the world.

Why It Matters

This isn’t just comedy—it’s a cross-section of NZ's freshest and fiercest comedic voices, from local legends to rising stars. Whether you're in for the belly laughs, the smart quips, or just wondering if an actuary can be funny—this is your Saturday night.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
ALTAR: The Drag Rite of Balance and Blasphemy, ALTAR: The Drag Rite of Balance and Blasphemy
Join us at Fringe Bar for ALTAR, a spellbinding drag ritual honouring the turn of the seasons. As day and night stand in perfect balance, witness an evening of witchcraft, blasphemy, mythology, and queer magic brought to life by a fierce coven of drag kings, queens, monsters, and cryptids.

This equinox, we invoke the primal, the divine, and the forbidden. Expect offerings to old gods, sacrificial glamour, and performances steeped in folklore, resistance and radical ritual. ALTAR is a celebration of queer power, transgressive beauty, and the defiance of a world that seeks to burn us at the stake.

With Performances By:
Robin Yablind
Rover Stimulation
Misty Frequency
Darryl Parton
Rocky Rhodes
MANNNTIS
Judas Kiss
Aracella
Cailiah the Banshee

Come ready to worship. Come ready to sin.
Bring your rage, your devotion, your offerings, and lay them down at the ALTAR!

Doors open 7.30pm
Show starts 8pm
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Let's Sketch Newtown's Hertiage Character, In anticipation of the upcoming Heritage Festival, we will be sketching the heritage character of Newtown. Historic shopfronts on Riddiford Street or character cottages in the side streets - Green Street hosts some of the oldest houses in Newtown, built from 1875.
Meet on the corner of Riddiford Street and Green Street at 10am, sketch for a couple of hours in this area, then meet at New Day Café in Constable Street at 12.30pm for a coffee/chat and to look at everyone's drawings.
Urban Sketchers Wellington will display a collection of Newtown sketches in the SubCulture window (the former substation near McDonald’s) during the Heritage Festival (18 October – 9 November). If you would like contributing work to this display talk to Dave or Annette.
All are welcome. Please bring your own art materials.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Anti-Pageant 2025, Anti-Pageant: The Next Drag Monster 2025
Presented by Allikins Productions | Created by The Den of Thurst

It’s time to summon all ghouls, ghosts, goblins, zombaes — and of course, our beloved theys — for the return of the Anti-Pageant this Halloween.

Prepare for a night of twisted glamour and unholy talent as we crown Aotearoa’s next Drag Monster for 2025. This is drag at its filthiest, fiercest, and most fabulously freaky.

Featuring a lineup of handpicked, up-and-coming alternative drag artists from across the motu, expect haunting looks, high drama, and performances that will leave you screaming (in the best way). Come unleash your inner demon, revel in the weird, and celebrate the beauty of being unapologetically other. We invite you to bring your best Halloween costumes and creations to join in the celebration.

Join us in the eerie depths of Ivy Bar and Cabaret this Halloween and witness the ascension of our next Drag Monster. It’s a night you won’t forget — and one you may never recover from.

Show Details

Doors open at 7:30pm.
Show runs from 8:00 pm to 11:30pm, with three short intermissions between sets.

Ticketing

General Admission (Standing): Unallocated standing room.

Sold out - Seated Tickets: Limited availability. If you're attending with a group and want to sit together, contact us ahead of time. Otherwise, please arrive early to secure your preferred spot.

Accessibility
The venue is located downstairs via a set of stairs with a handrail. If you require an alternative access option (is available), please get in touch with Allikins before the event.
Unfortunately, all of our seated options, including those reserved for guests with accessibility needs, are currently sold out. Please feel free to get in touch with us, and we’ll be happy to notify you if additional seating becomes available.

Safety & Content

Trigger warnings will be announced before each performance. We have a strict zero tolerance policy for abusive or discriminatory behavior.

No realistic look weapons (props) will be allowed into the venue.

Contact
Email: allikins.arts@gmail.com
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Astro Photo Talk with Keith Molloy & JM Beltran, Join Wellington astrophotographers Keith Molloy & JM Beltran as they share tips and tricks on capturing the beauty of Aotearoa’s night skies.
Free to attend with a valid ticket to the World Press Photo Exhibition & Aotearoa Photography Showcase.
──────
About the speakers:
Keith Molloy
Wellington-based photographer passionate about capturing the beauty and diversity of New Zealand’s night skies and landscapes. He specialises in Milky Way scenes and celestial events, blending technical precision with creativity. Keith founded the Wellington Night Shooters Facebook group, has run workshops with the Wellington Photographic Society, and has been recognised through NZIPP NZAPA awards. His work is on display at the Tākina retail store during the World Press Photo Exhibition.
JM Beltran
Wellington-based landscape and nature photographer whose work captures Aotearoa’s wild beauty in colour and detail. His photography has been recognised internationally, including as a finalist in Australian Photographer of the Year 2024 and winning a Silver Award at NZIPP NZAPA 2024. JM volunteers at Zealandia Te Māra a Tāne, and his Wild Pōneke collection is on display at the Tākina retail store during the World Press Photo Exhibition.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Auditions! Superior Donuts by Tracy Letts, Auditions! Superior Donuts by Tracy Letts
Stagecraft presents: “Superior Donuts”
By Tracy Letts
Directed by James Kiesel
26 November – 6 December 2025

“What could be more human, than to be scared, and keep it a secret.”

Arthur Przybyszewski (that's (p)Shub-er-shef-ski), is the proprietor of a modest, behind-the-times donut shop in uptown Chicago. He can't seem to find joy in anything these days, not even the donuts he used to take such pride in making by hand. Vandals armed with spray paint, predatory landlords, and that nefarious Starbucks down the road all threaten to unceremoniously snuff out the only thing he's got left.

That is, until an upstart, ambitious young man shoulders his way into becoming a Superior Donuts employee, and an unlikely friendship (or is it a rivalry?) develops, inspiring both to face the demons they've been hiding from all this time.

This is a sharp-witted, heartfelt comedy by Pulitzer Prize winner Tracy Letts (“August: Osage County”) offering a warm and wry take on depression, diversity, and bravery that will leave you feeling all fluffy and sugary on the inside. Plus, who knows, you might get a donut!

Go to the Stagecraft website to book your spot!

https://www.stagecraft.co.nz/auditions

AUDITIONS:
Auditions will be on Saturday 13th & Sunday 14th September, with callbacks the evening of Monday 15th September.

To book an audition, please fill out the form by 10th September - we'll be in touch to confirm your audition date, time and location. If you have any questions please get in touch at .

Roles (just try your best with accents, coaching available once casting is complete)

Arthur Przybyszewski [Male, Polish, 50s - 60s]
The owner and operator of Superior Donuts. Old, grumpy, and more than a little depressed. Secretly an artisan and a scholar, he’s spent his whole life running from conflict. Until now? [Has a scene involving some violence]

Franco Wicks [Male, African-American, 20s]
Young, idealistic, a little pushy, and full of attitude and energy. Franco believes that good things will happen to him despite all odds, and evidence, to the contrary. A former employee of Luther.

Max [Male, Russian, 40s - 60s]
Owner of the DVD shop next door, Max is interested in buying Superior Donuts to expand his (tiny) capitalist empire. Fancies himself a self-made man. [Speaks in a Russian accent, along with some dialogue in Russian]

Randy [Female, Irish-American, 30s - 40s]
Raised in the middle of 7 brothers and working as a cop in the Chicago Police Department, Randy’s always been ‘one of the boys’. Big hockey fan. Has a soft spot for Arthur.

James [Male, African-American, 30s - 40s]
Another cop with the Chicago Police Department and Randy’s beat partner. Well-respected in the community and [not so] secretly a giant Star Trek nerd. [Will consider any and all BIPOC actors for this role]

Lady [Female, Irish-American, 60s - 70s]
Likely homeless and definitely a little hard-of-hearing, Lady is a well-known as a confusing-but-likeable, perhaps even mascot-like figure in the Uptown community. Well past the point of giving a crap about what other people think.

Luther [Male, Irish-American, 30s - 40s]
Local bookie and crime-syndicate everyman, Luther has scratched out his living taking money from gambling addicts, which he finds troubling because he’d like to consider himself a good, fair man. Has a stomach ulcer which is probably somehow representative of this inner conflict. [Has a scene involving some violence]

Kevin [Male, Irish, 20s]
Another of Luther’s employees, Kevin’s probably fallen into the wrong crowd as a young man, but it doesn’t seem to trouble him that much. Seems to care mostly about getting paid and drinking Coca-Cola.

Kiril [Male, Russian, 20s - 30s]
A shy man of few words (mostly ‘hello’), Kiril is an intimidating figure with a big soft heart beating beneath his tall muscular frame. Brought into the fold to be a construction worker and bodyguard, he’s mostly interested in falling in love with the local bartender. [Most dialogue is in Russian]
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Annual Exhibition 2025, Annual Exhibition 2025
Annual Exhibition 2025
The exhibition is being held this year at the Thistle Hall in Cuba St and will run from 29 September to the 5th of October.

Our annual exhibition is the opportunity to showcase the best work of our members to family, friends and the public and we try to include work from each member.

Current members of WPS are invited to submit up to three images to be considered for selection for the exhibition.

Entry
Each member can submit up to three images.
Entries should be sent to by midnight, 30 August 2025.
File Specs: Full resolution under 12MB
File naming: First name, Last Name, Title (if any)
Colour Mode: RGB colour mode (not Grayscale)
Bit Depth: 8 bits/Channel
Colour Space: SRGB
JPEG Format: Baseline (“Standard”)

File Naming
To avoid mixing up each member’s files, each image should have a clear file naming structure. It just allows us to keep better track of the images.
- Number_FirstName_Surname_Title.jpg

Printing and matting
The exhibition will be shown in the club frames, which are 16 x 20 inches. We will arrange printing and mounting of selected images on your behalf. You may elect to print and matt your own images. If this is the case, Please contact us to discuss.

Exhibition dates and times
Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba Street, Te Aro
29 September – 5th October 2025

Opening night
Monday, 29 September | Time 7pm | Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba St, Te Aro. Please come and join us to celebrate the creative photos of your fellow club members and yourself – family and friends are welcome. Finger food and refreshments will be available.

Gallery roster
We are looking to establish a roster of volunteers to man the gallery during weekday afternoons and during the weekends. Please contact the committee via if you can volunteer.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Book Launch | It's What He Would've Wanted by Nick Ascroft, Join us at Unity Books Wellington on 3 September to celebrate a new book from Nick Ascroft! The book will be launched by Always Becominging.
Wednesday 3 September, 6pm
Unity Books Wellington
All welcome!
What would he have wanted? As little fuss as possible. But, reading between the lines: a little help. All the latest gossip and complaints. An arse that is not wrong. Opulence. One leap from the rope ladder. The final word.
It’s What He Would’ve Wanted is the sixth book of poetry from the author of the acclaimed The Stupefying. In this hilarious and affecting new work, Nick Ascroft writes of lost friends, new frailties, new braveries, and being stuck in an organ pipe during a recital and not wanting to bother anyone about it. Yes, there are poems of cycling into dead-end utility holes but also poems of trembling resolve and arriving at work as aged as the night sky after completing the morning school drop-off. This is the best collection yet by one of the most exciting and mercurial poets writing in Aotearoa today.
About the author:
Nick Ascroft is the author of five previous poetry collections with Te Herenga Waka University Press, most recently The Stupefying (2022) and Moral Sloth (2019). Living in Thorndon, he is a public servant and the president of Scrabble Wellington.
Cover design by Todd Atticus.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Book Launch: Hoods Landing by Laura Vincent, Book Launch: Hoods Landing by Laura Vincent
Join Āporo Press at Unity Books for the mystical book launch of ‘Hoods Landing’ by Laura Vincent.

About this Event

Join Āporo Press at Unity Books Wellington on Halloween, 31 October, to celebrate the debut novel by Laura Vincent.

🎃 Friday 31 October, 6pm
🎃 Unity Books Wellington
🎃 All welcome!

Rita considered the dead. Shut her eyes. Rolled their names around her brain. Stacked each person in order like folded laundry, warm and crisp from the sun. She wondered how her name would sound amongst them.

In the rural reaches of Auckland, the women of the eclectic Gordon family gather for Christmas. They may push each other’s buttons, but know precisely when to offer tea (or a tipple). Rita, the 50-year-old baby of the family, is planning to tell them she has cancer. Drifting between past and present, she considers the lives of women in their community and reckons with what it all means for her future and her family.

Featuring elderly lesbians, twins who aren’t twins, and several dogs named Roger, Hoods Landing is about shoddy pasts, ambiguous futures and the imperfect bonds that tie family together.

About the author:

Laura Vincent (Ngāti Māhanga, Ngāpuhi) is an author whose work spans fiction, poetry and food writing. She has written the food blog hungryandfrozen.com since 2007, and her debut cookbook was published by Penguin Random House in 2013. Laura’s poetry has appeared in anthologies published by Āporo Press, Auckland University Press and Muswell Press, and she completed her Master of Creative Writing at Auckland University of Technology in 2022. Born in Waiuku, Laura currently lives in Tāmaki Makaurau. Hoods Landing is her first novel.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Box of Birds, When: 20th – 26th September 2025
Monday - Saturday 10am
No shows on Sundays
Hailed as "the cutest little show in Aotearoa" (Hamilton Arts Festival 2024), award-winning theatre company Birdlife Productions have created this gorgeous theatre show designed especially for ages 4 to 9 years, Including exquisite puppetry, live interactive songs, projection and the teaching of a waiata, this work reflects our transformative connection to nature. Peter is reluctant to stay with nanna in the school holidays because she lives in the country and doesn't have a TV but Nanna finds ways to engage Peter in her love of the forest, especially the precious manu, when they build a nesting box for Ruru together. Peter is excited to see if Ruru will make her home in the box, waiting patiently while many other birds arrive to check out the box first! And after all that waiting, Nanna takes Peter on an exciting night time forest walk to find Ruru - in the dark! The bird characters are all familiar New Zealand locals, such as piwakawaka, kereru, tui and ruru, and the story highlights the importance of supporting them and the different needs they may have. Teachers and Parents have been ecstatic about this show and hundreds of New Zealand children have been transfixed by it.
As quoted by Theatreview: “This is truly a New Zealand show for New Zealand children and all those young-at-heart”.


Prices are just $15.00 per person
Under 2's are free
Special $7 preview show on Saturday September 20th 2025!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Dead Kennedys in Wellington, Dead Kennedys in Wellington

🎶 Don't Miss Dead Kennedys Live in Wellington on Wednesday, September 17, 2025! 🎶
Are you ready to experience Dead Kennedys like never before? With chart-topping hits like Police Truck, Holiday in Cambodia and California u00dcber Alles and 835.4K+ devoted fans, Dead Kennedys is taking over Meow Nui this Wednesday, September 17, 2025, and trust us, you don't want to miss this.

With multiple shows lined up, this one ensures to be the ultimate musical experience, where the energy of Dead Kennedys will make you dance, sing, and maybe even cry (in a good way).

Event Details:

📅 Date: Wednesday, September 17, 2025
⏰ Time: 8:00 PM
📍 Venue: Meow Nui

Expect an unforgettable performance featuring all your favorite songs and some surprises you've never heard before. So, If you're discovering Dead Kennedys for the first time, this show will blow your mind.

Why This Show is Unmissable
With over 948.9K+ fans streaming their music monthly and viral singles in every playlist, Dead Kennedys is at the peak of their career. If you're a long-time fan or just love the buzz, this show will be one for the books.

P.S. – You don't want to be that person who hears about it later! We will not let you miss this in any way!🎉

Artist's Power Move
Dead Kennedys has been setting the stage on fire with performances that leave fans begging for more. With an incredible setlist and live versions of your favorite songs, you'll leave with stories to tell (and maybe a few epic selfies). Follow Dead Kennedys on AllEvents to get hyped for the event!

🎟️ Book Your Tickets Now! 🎟️
This is your chance to witness Dead Kennedys live and in their element. Grab your tickets now for Dead Kennedys in Wellington at Meow Nui and be part of a night that everyone will be talking about. Don't wait—tickets are selling fast.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Twin Peaks: Find out Who Killed Laura Palmer, UPDATE (24/9/25)-
80% of tickets to the upcoming Big "Reveal" screening have sold out already.
Grab those remaining tickets ASAP!
................................................................................................................................
Twin Peaks is full of mystery and questions, with very few answers, but these next 3 episodes may well be the most "revealing" and arguably momentous episodes of all. You seriously do not want to miss this one! So come along and experience it first hand with your fellow fans!

This is what we will be watching :

Episode 14: "Lonely Souls" (47mins)

Episode 15: "Drive with a Dead Girl" (47mins)

Intermission
Episode 16: "ARBITRARY LAW" (46mins)

With all Log Lady Intros!

WHERE: The mini cinema in Te Auaha. 65 Dixon St. Te Aro.
(Take the lift or stairs to Level 1 and turn left.)

The mini cinema's specs: 4K projection, Screen size 4450mm x 2500mm, Aspect ratio 16:9 with 7.1 surround sound.

WHEN: Meet at 10:30am on Saturday 4th Oct. 2025. in the Bar area. The bar will be closed but you are welcome to bring your own snacks/drink.

Chat with other Twin peakies and the show will start on the dot at 11:00am

Tickets will be capped/limited so that everyone can have a decent seat; so grab those tickets ASAP and don't miss out on experiencing these truly shocking episodes in a room full of your people that love Twin Peaks!

RULES:
1. Tickets are per person. There will be NO door sales, so DO purchase it beforehand please.
2. All attendees MUST be 18yo +
3. This is a safe, friendly, INCLUSIVE place. There is ZERO tolerance for discrimination, disrespect or creepy gross behavior of any kind. By attending you agree to the Code of Conduct.
4. Please clean up after yourself if you are snacking and help keep the mini cinema clean as a whistle.
Thank you! And hope to see you there.
label: Film & Media

description:
Wellington Jazz Festival - Sunday Jazz Club at Parrotdog Bar, This month we welcome the Wellington Jazz Festival back to Lyall Bay
With a live jazz session courtesy of Lockie Bennett and his crew. Come down, tap those toes, and sip on your favourite Parrotdog beer.
Free entry.
Parrotdog Bar.
label: Festivals

description:
Bull Rush, THIS SHOW IS R13.

With a roster of Tāmaki Makaurau's best and brightest performers, expect spit-take-worthy gags, epic stories, heartbreaking tales, and live improvised music at Bull Rush.

So gather your mates for a night of never before seen, totally made up, improvised comedy.

Mess with the bull, feel the rush.

Since 2020, Bull Rush has been making it up as they go. With several seasons (Jingle Bull(Rush), Ghoul Rush, Bull Rush (1822) under their belt, these self-professed improv nerds know how to put on a bloody good show.

Winners of Best Improv Group at the 2024 NZ Comedy Guild Awards, among other accolades (not to brag).

“From start to finish, the show kept me laughing, and by the end, I found myself not only impressed by the performers' quick wit and timing but also rediscovering my appreciation for the art of theatre.”

95bfm.com

R13 - This show may contain potential references to sex, violence as death. As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

Image credit: John Rata

description:
Resonance, Resonance marks the beginning of a new series of piano experiments. James Illingworth and Potamoi perform 30-minute solo sets, back-to-back, exploring neo-classical, abstract jazz, cinematic soundscapes, and improvisation with synth textures woven in. An opening night where nothing is fixed, and the energy of the room shapes what unfolds.

Be a part of an emergent process where two musicians kick off a series of unique live shows in Wellington this summer.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Comedy on The Coast All Roads Lead To Kapiti, Kapiti Coast, NZ – Prepare to swap your Netflix night for something far funnier—All Roads Lead to Kapiti rolls into the Kapiti Playhouse on 20 September.

Line-Up That’ll Make You Snort-Laugh

Richie Faavesi – The 2024 Raw Comedy Quest finalist (and Whanganui’s chocolate-humour king) brings brutally honest, father-and-husband-life tales with enough grit and heart to dark-horse the dark side of comedy.
comedy.co.nz
NZ Herald

MC Marc Hamilton – The smooth operator keeping the laughs rolling and the mic mayhem in check.

Emma Jean – One of the Raw Comedy Quest finalists for 2025—expect freshness, edge, and zero filter.

Reon Matterman – Thrives on weaving truth bombs with sharp wit—something you’ll want to laugh and think about.

Advait Kirtikar – Qualified actuary by day, Billy T-nominated comedian by night. His super-dry delivery and razor timing earned him awards, accolades, and the uncanny ability to make actuarial science sound sexy. He’s also a two-degree black-belt rock-climber-ex-gymnast blend of absurdity.
Scoop
Basement Theatre
Impulse Gamer

This isn’t just comedy—it’s a cross-section of Kapiti’s freshest and fiercest comedic voices, from local legends to rising stars. Whether you're in for the belly laughs, the smart quips, or just wondering if an actuary can be funny - this is your Saturday night.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Christmas in October, Christmas in October
Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival

It's nowhere near beginning to look anything like Christmas, but if October in Wellington is true to form, the weather outside is probably frightful, so we're celebrating anyway. Wear your best ugly sweater for this celebration of the Christmas season, featuring gifts (real), eggnog (imaginary) and warm feelings (both).

Featuring a found family of amazing performers from across the Festival, together on stage for the very first time.

“If you want to laugh till your belly hurts, watch wizards weave worlds out of thin air, and be a part of something special, inimitable, then catch as many NZIF shows as you can.” - Regional News

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Confessions Booth, ✨ Confessions Booth - Hosted by a Fabulous Drag Host ✨
Wellington, it’s time to spill your secrets… or just sip and enjoy everyone else’s! 👀
Step into the Confessions Booth for a cheeky, interactive night of cocktails, laughs, and anonymous confessions, hosted by a fabulous drag MC. Part comedy, part interactive theatre, part party - guaranteed to keep you laughing, sipping, and maybe confessing…
Here’s how it works:
On arrival, grab a drink and submit a confession on a card or via QR code. Totally optional - sipping cocktails is a perfectly valid choice!
Confessions must be about you only - keep other people’s skeletons in their closet.
You can submit anonymously, or add your name for a little extra spice and interaction with the host (and a chance to win a price).
Selected confessions will be read aloud by our drag MC, who will add cheeky commentary, playful roasts, and audience Q&A.
Not every confession will make it to the stage, but every secret counts and contributes to the fun.
Between confession sets, enjoy music, cocktails, and mingling. After the main show, the party continues with a pop, disco, and house playlist.
Ticket Tiers:
GA - $25: Entry only.
Upgraded - $35: Entry + welcome bubbly 🥂
VIP - $55: Entry + welcome drink (cocktail, wine, beer or Pal) + charcuterie cup + priority seating.
📍 Where: Whisky & Wood, Wellington
📅 When: Thursday 23 October, 7:00pm
Sip. Spill. Repeat. Whether you’re confessing your darkest secrets or just watching the chaos unfold, this is a night of laughs, drinks, and drama you won’t forget.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Dutch Language - Introductory 1, For beginners who have no prior knowledge of the Dutch language.

An introductory course for beginners and those wanting to travel, with intensive practise in different scenarios building basic vocabulary.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:
- Feel more comfortable with Dutch pronunciation
- Ask and respond to simple questions in common situations
- Initiate and maintain a simple conversation
- Be familiar with some basic spelling and grammar rules

6 weeks, Thu 5:30 PM - 8:00 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Joy de Geus
$199. incl. GST
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Declarations of Love (And Other Useless Things) - BATS Theatre, Created by Tempest Theatre Co

Back for its five year anniversary, Emma Maguire and Hamish Boyle run the gauntlet of sketch comedy, performing 15+ sketches about love, sex, queerness and rom-coms in 55 minutes.
It's delirious, it'll get your blood pumping (not like that), and maybe we'll all come out of it satisfied.

Think parodies of Fifty Shades of Grey and the manosphere.
Interrogating love languages and horoscopes.
A lot of ~intimate eye contact~.
Maybe some touching.

The works.

“Take your friends. Take your lovers. This show IS a love story. And it’s totally for everyone.”
Theatreview

Created and Performed by Emma Maguire & Hamish Boyle
Facilitation & dramaturgy by Jo Marsh
Lighting design and operation by Ezra Jones-Moki
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years, Ever wondered what became of Darth Vader and Mr Stevens, or the monkey in the tree, and did the pears ever ripen? English comic Eddie Izzard has been spinning wildly funny and surreal tales for 35 years. Her huge and devoted fan base is in for a treat as she embarks on a tour. In Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years, she reimagines some of her favourite comedy highlights. She delves into material from the touring show The Ambassadors (1993) through to Wunderbar (2019). For the audience, it’s a glorious chance to hear a new take on classic material and hear another new mad-capped twist to the story. As always, with Eddie, there will be unexpected tangents and hilarious interludes. No night will be the same. 
This show promises to be a beautiful, hilarious journey spanning a 35-year career. It will be thought-provoking, intelligent and suitably surreal. Who could resist?
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Echoes of the Past, Echoes of the Past
Presented by Best on Tap

In keeping with the theme of the festival, Best on Tap ponders what has led us to 'be here now'?

What people, actions, and objects have combined to shape this place we know as Wellington/Te Whanganui a Tara?

What paths have led us to make this our home?

What decisions, genes, and character traits echo through generations to make us who we are today?

This show will traverse time to explore these rich themes, all with a good helping of Best on Tap truth-based, grounded, spontaneous theatre.

After all, what were our ancestors doing if not improvising?

Inspired by Felipe Ortiz (Colombia)

Best on Tap is a Wellington-based improvisation troupe who use truth-based play to create compelling and satisfying narratives. This is spontaneous theatre that honours and entertains.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Wedding Singer - The Musical, The Wedding Singer - The Musical
💍✨ The Wedding Singer – The Musical ✨💍
📅 1–18 October 2025 | Hutt City Musical Theatre

🎤 It’s 1985. Robbie Hart is New Jersey’s favorite wedding singer — until his fiancée leaves him standing at the altar. Heartbroken (and hilariously bitter), he crashes every wedding he sings at… until he meets Julia, a sweet waitress who might just be the one. Only problem? She’s engaged to the wrong guy.

Packed with outrageous 80s fashion, big dance numbers, and a soundtrack of catchy, over-the-top hits, this feel-good musical comedy will have you laughing, dancing, and rooting for love to win. 💃🎶❤️

⚡ Early Bird Tickets 18–31 August ONLY ⚡
Save money and secure your seats before they’re gone!

👉 Don’t miss the party of the year – book now:
https://www.trybooking.com/nz/events/landing/16892

description:
Formation: A New Performer Show, Are you ready for the hottest new drag queens, drag kings & drag things that Wellington has to offer?

Drag has exploded here in Aotearoa with new performers emerging every week and we're giving them the chance to show us their stuff.
This stunning resurgence of drag has arrived with thanks from powerhouses in the Wellington drag scene, stars of RuPaul's Drag Race, The Boulet Brothers Dragula, and many more!

From kings, queens, and all the beautiful theys in-between, get ready to cheer these newbies on their debut night, scream their name and say SHANTAY, you stay!

Doors open 9:00PM
Shows start at 9:30PM

Alright, Wellington now let's get into FORMATION!

Please contact Olivia Dreams or Ivy Bar and Cabaret if wheelchair access is required.

*On purchasing tickets please contact the Bar if you wish to book a table for your group. Please arrive earlier to get a seat before the show kicks off (very limited seating)
GA tickets are the same for seating and standing. Venue seating is essentially first in, first served.

*The Cloud 9 tickets on offer - These are General Admission tickets with a different cost to help events and productions like this thrive. It is so lovely and humbling to know the cast and crew are recognised for their art. The extra contribution helps to ensure artists get paid and more amazing events can be produced in the future.

description:
Friday Laughs with Kajun Brooking & Patch Lambert, Friday Laughs is Wellington's favourite weekend comedy night, right in the heart of the capital.

With Kajun Brooking
Raised on the gang infested streets of Hastings, Kajun moved to Whanganui in search of a better life. This is where he cultivates cunning comedy and hustles sticky punchlines based on life experiences. Described as slippery, quick witted and punchy, his mission is to make at least one person laugh. If he can do that, his job is done for the night and he can continue to prove to his 17 year old daughter that Dad is actually funny.

Patch Lambert is an award-winning comedian based in Wellington, NZ. A 2017 Billy T Award nominee, he also appears on TV3's 'The Project', has written for TV3's '7 Days' and is a regular fixture throughout the country's pro comedy circuit.
"I honestly consider it one of my highlights of the festival. " - The Speakeasy
"...all the elements of a suburban Kiwi icon" - Theatreview

also featuring
Mamaeroa Munn
Guanny Liu-Prosee
Leo Hollbrook
James Nokise

Book early and often!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
It’s Alive!, Follow two young aspiring scientists as they sneak into their mum's secret lab to conduct their Best Experiment Ever — only for things to go horribly wrong, leading to the accidental creation of a puppet! Will the puppet be a friend? Or will they cause chaos that the kids will need to clean up before mum gets home?

Created by Francesca Browne, It's Alive! is brought to you by Improverished, the improvised theatre company behind family friendly shows like Can I Get an Underground Location and a Mythical Creature? and Random Fairytale Generator. Combining theatre, comedy, science, and improvisation, It's Alive! is full of silliness and joy.

All science experiments have been designed with careful consultation with chemists to ensure the safety of the audience.

Designed especially for tamariki ages 5 to 12 and their whānau. We do not recommend this show for children aged 3 and under.

The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Three Minutes in Hell - Open Topic, Hosts Anna Rzhevitskaya & Daniel John Smith have challenged 15+ comedians to do 3 minutes of new jokes about anything they want! Three minutes to entertain you and make their mark, or only three minutes until the next act comes on!
Come support your local comedy, that's so fckn nice of you.
We won an Award. So...
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Friday Laughs with Itay Dom and El Jaguar, Friday Laughs is a comedy showcase featuring top local and national comedians at the capital's favourite comedy venue

Featuring headline act - El Jaguar
Canadian comedy act El Jaguar is coming to wrestle his way into hilarity. From Canada, to New Zealand, and throughout Australia, El Jaguar is making a name for himself on the comedy scene using only his fast wits and tight lycra.
From the dusty streets of central America, rising triumphant as the luchador everyone wanted to be in the World Wrestling Federation circa 1990, then into obscurity: El Jaguar is making a comeback… and it’s going to be hilarious.

With MC Itay Dom
As seen on Guy Mont-Spelling Bee and The Bachelorette New Zealand, brings his signature mix of laidback crowd work and observational comedy to the stage.
Itay has cemented his reputation as one of New Zealand’s brightest comedic talents. In 2024, he won the Breakthrough Act award at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards, following his 2023 win for Best MC. His sharp humor and quick wit have delighted audiences across the country, from opening for top acts like Joe Daymond and Ray O’Leary to his appearances on Guy Mont-Spelling Bee and writing for 7 Days.
“Feeds off the energy of the crowd with quick wits” - The Post

Support from:
Brent McGuinness
Jenice Goveas
Jundas Capone
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Tawa Residents’ Association bi-monthly meeting, The Tawa Residents’ Association formal bi-monthly meetings are open to the public.
We love to welcome Tawa Residents to join the committee, help out, share ideas or even just come along to hear what's going on in Tawa.
The Association is made up of residents of Tawa, Tawa community board members, Tawa business group members, Northern Ward Councillors and even our local Member of Parliament, its a great chance to find out whats going on and ask those burning questions you have.
We meet upstairs at the Tawa Squash Club on the second Monday of the month, every other month at 7.30pm.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Friday Laughs with Lesa Macleod-Whiting and El Jaguar, Saturday Laughs at the Royal Hotel brings top comedy talent to the heart of Featherston

This month's show features -
El Jaguar
Canadian comedy act El Jaguar is coming to wrestle his way into hilarity. From Canada, to New Zealand, and throughout Australia, El Jaguar is making a name for himself on the comedy scene using only his fast wits and tight lycra.
From the dusty streets of central America, rising triumphant as the luchador everyone wanted to be in the World Wrestling Federation circa 1990, then into obscurity: El Jaguar is making a comeback… and it’s going to be hilarious.

And MC Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee
Lesa is a Wellington-based writer, improviser and comedian. She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest. She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.
Winner – Best Newcomer – 2020 Wellington Comedy Awards Nominated – Best Newcomer (Lower North Island) – 2020 NZ Comedy Guild Awards

More acts to be announced!

This event brought to you with support from TrustHouse Ltd
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Friday Laughs with Booth the Clown and Wilson Dixon, Friday Laughs at Cavern Club brings some of your favourite local and national comedians to the capital's coziest comedy club.

September's show stars headline act Wilson Dixon
Hailing from Cripple Creek Colorado, country music legend, Wilson Dixon’s melodic philosophies on life have seen him become one of the most loved characters on the Aust, UK and NZ circuit.
He has had sold out season’s at The New International Comedy Festival and has won awards for Best Show and in 2010 he won the supreme Festival Award The Fred for outstanding artistic achievement.
Before sweeping the New Zealand International Comedy Festival his show ”Wilson Dixon’s American Dream” played to rave reviews at the Edinburgh Fringe and Melbourne International Comedy Festival. Directly after the Edinburgh Fringe Wilson went on to appear in his own 4 part radio series for the BBC – The Wilson Dixon Line.
An unmissable act!

And feature act Booth the Clown
2025 Billy T Award nominee, Booth has entertained audiences around the country with a mix of storytelling, mime, and general tomfoolery
"delightfully silly" - Regional News

More acts to be announced.

Friday Laughs with Lesa Macleod-Whiting and Kura Forrester, Friday Laughs is a two hour comedy showcase of some top Kiwi talent, right in the heart of Wellington.
With headline act, Kura Forrester
Kura Forrester is an actor, writer and comedian, a face you have definitely seen on the telly including Kiwi shows such as: Golden Boy, Shortland Street, Super City and The Adventures of Suzy Boon.
Winner of the 2019 Billy T Award, Kura is fast becoming one of the standout comedian actors of New Zealand.
And MC Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee
Lesa is a Wellington-based writer, improviser and comedian. She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest. She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.
Winner – Best Newcomer – 2020 Wellington Comedy Awards Nominated – Best Newcomer (Lower North Island) – 2020 NZ Comedy Guild Awards
Along with

Leki Lyons
and Mike Fowler

description: Seed Saving Workshop: Heritage Gardening, A workshop on basic seed saving and heritage gardening. Learn how to save seeds from your own plants, store them properly, and grow a variety of heritage vegetables and herbs to preserve genetic diversity and build a resilient food system.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
George Fenn is: Sexy Ghost Boy (Pōneke), Begin with a circle. Work your way up, slowly. Bravely. The Macarena happens to completion. Scream.

This is how you summon Sexy Ghost Boy, the award winning and hilariously f***able spirit, haunting Pōneke this October.

The show dissects the unspoken rituals and micro neurosis we have around Sex and the presentation of ourselves as sexual agents. Using Clown and Burlesque this wordless performance inspires the audience to heroically rebel against insecurity. Described by witnesses as a hot mess mash up of Mr Bean and Marina Abramović, this show has split the sides of audiences across New Zealand.

-Organised Chaos Award / Auckland Fringe 2024
-Bizarre and Charming Award / Hasting Fringe 2024
-Nominated for Outstanding Performer / Dunedin Fringe 2025

Tickets $30 waged / $20 unwaged.

The show is strictly R18. It contains sexual themes and nudity up to underwear.

Creative team:
George Fenn (he/she/they) is a genre bending comedy theatre maker based in New Zealand who specializes in audience interaction. Their passion is inspired in opposition to the coercive trends of Comedic Interaction, and prioritises negotiating audience’s boundaries and building experiences where power is exchanged and humor is shared.

Anne Cunliffe (she/her) is an emerging producer and comedy nerd who is using the skills learned during her decade long public servant career to excel in Arts Management.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
George Fenn is: Sexy Ghost Boy, Sexy Ghost Boy is a wordless interactive comedy that came from the challenge to make work exploring consent without using words. Thematically this show is a celebration of the micro-neurosis and little rituals we have around sex and appearing sexy. It is an uplifting and exciting show, which is satirical in its burlesque and invigorating through its clown. It is very, very funny.
The performer’s approach to interaction and participation is gentle, with a focus on ensuring the audience is enthusiastic consenting to each action. George Fenn is an interactive theatre comedian with decade of experience. This is not an experimental show. This is a weird show. A very good, weird show.

Official and unofficial praise Sexy Ghost Boy:
Organised Chaos Award at Auckland Fringe / 2024
Bizarre and Charming Award / Hasting Fringe Festival 2024
Nominated for Outstanding Performer / Dunedin Fringe 2025
“A theatrical alchemist, Fenn has the rare talent to create something utterly ridiculous yet very clever…he worms his way into our brains making it crazy, yet safe. There’s an element of consent in the interaction that is miles away from the experience of sitting in the front row of some stand-ups.” - Rosheen Fitzgerald, Theatreview
"but we both feel so… I don’t even know how to describe it. I feel like I’m floating while simultaneously feeling grounded, I’m ecstatic while also very chill. Maybe it’s the full moon, or maybe I’m just a little bit possessed by the Sexy Ghost Boy." - Laura Ferguson, Art Murmurs
"... Like Mr. Bean, but Sexy." - Audience member
"What the **** that was incredible." - Audience member
The show is strictly R18. It contains sexual themes and nudity up to underwear.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Gloria, Witness a show in honour of the renowned choreographer and dancer, Douglas Wright. The New Zealand Dance Company and Co3 Contemporary Dance Australia will restage his masterpiece, ‘Gloria’. Set to Vivaldi's legendary score, performed live by the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra and Voices New Zealand. A celebration of life, dancers will fly, twist, and turn among the grandeur of the historic St James Theatre.
‘Gloria’ was originally performed at the 1992 Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. This contemporary trans-Tasman collaboration honours one of Aotearoa's most prolific dance talents. Producing more than 30 major touring works in his life and dancing across the globe, Douglas Wright was a celebrated performer and creative until his death in 2018.
The evening will also feature two new creations. ‘A Moving Portrait’ by Raewyn Hill is an intimate, meditative reflection on ageing and grace. ‘Lament’ by Moss Te Ururangi Patterson will take audiences on a powerful journey through memory and resilience. The performance honours the whakapapa of contemporary dance in Aotearoa.
‘Gloria’ is exclusive to Wellington. It's presented as part of the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts 2026.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
George Fenn is: Sexy Ghost Boy (Pōneke), Begin with a circle. Work your way up, slowly. Bravely. The Macarena happens to completion. Scream.

This is how you summon Sexy Ghost Boy, the award winning and hilariously f***able spirit, haunting Pōneke this October.

The show dissects the unspoken rituals and micro neurosis we have around Sex and the presentation of ourselves as sexual agents. Using Clown and Burlesque this wordless performance inspires the audience to heroically rebel against insecurity. Described by witnesses as a hot mess mash up of Mr Bean and Marina Abramović, this show has split the sides of audiences across New Zealand.

-Organised Chaos Award / Auckland Fringe 2024
-Bizarre and Charming Award / Hasting Fringe 2024
-Nominated for Outstanding Performer / Dunedin Fringe 2025

Tickets $30 waged / $20 unwaged.

The show is strictly R18. It contains sexual themes and nudity up to underwear.

Creative team:
George Fenn (he/she/they) is a genre bending comedy theatre maker based in New Zealand who specializes in audience interaction. Their passion is inspired in opposition to the coercive trends of Comedic Interaction, and prioritises negotiating audience’s boundaries and building experiences where power is exchanged and humor is shared.

Anne Cunliffe (she/her) is an emerging producer and comedy nerd who is using the skills learned during her decade long public servant career to excel in Arts Management.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Hatch Showcase, Fresh voices, bold stories. HATCH puts emerging talent in the spotlight!

TAHI Festival’s student showcase, HATCH, champions our next generation of solo performers. In partnership with Te Auaha, Toi Whakaari: NZ Drama School, and Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington, HATCH supports students through workshops, mentorship, and creative development, culminating in a high-energy showcase at BATS Theatre. Show info below.

Cursed Child: The return of Mr Haki
Written and performed by Leia Edmonds
Mr Haki is Leia’s childhood imaginary friend. He returns from the grave to confront her about his death. Cursed Child: The return of Mr Haki is a funny, slightly creepy, and nostalgic tale about the mind of a strange little girl. Contains mental health themes, and depictions of injury or medical distress.

HĀNGĪ PANTS
Written and performed by Waikamania Seve
It's 9:04pm, a Saturday like any other. Scandaleyes smeared on, soju burning sweet, cherry pomegranate nicotine clouding the air. K Road’s about to come alive, but Hāngī Pants is already unpacking the mess. Her lovers, her losses, her lust. Contains flashing lights, course language, themes of sexual assault, substance abuse, and eating disorders; and depictions of sex and semi-nudity.

Warm Night At Normal School
Written and performed by Gabriel Murphy
Gabriel missions across the sticky floors and strobe lights of the school disco to ask the girl he likes to dance with him. But it’s not as easy as it sounds. Recommended for audiences aged 13+. Contains flashing lights and some coarse language.

Enter: Child
Written and performed by Aroha Morrison
Wide-eyed, happy to be there, and - well - utterly clueless. Child leads with curiosity - will you follow?

Lost Memory
Written and performed by George Long
A man is trying to tell the story of meeting someone really important. But unfortunately life changes over time.

Show title to come
Written and performed by Charlie Roigard.
Show info to come.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Neurodivergent Speed Dating 20-35, 35-50, Neurodivergent Speed Dating 20-35, 35-50
Looking to meet new friends to hang out with, or maybe find love in a comfortable, respectful environment? Join us for a speed dating event designed specifically for autistic adults in Wellington!

This inclusive and sensory-considerate evening is all about meaningful conversations and low-pressure socializing. Whether you’re looking for friendship, romance, or just a fun evening out, this is your chance to connect in a space designed with your needs in mind.

Price includes a drink and delicious food at the break!

Accessibility and Comfort:
We’re committed to making this event as accessible and welcoming as possible. Sensory-friendly spaces, quiet zones, and fidget-friendly items will be available. There will also be conversation prompts on the table. Let us know any additional accommodations you may need when registering.

Who Can Attend:
All genders and sexualities are welcome to come and mingle and meet others for friendship but the speed dating part of this evening works best for heterosexual people.
label: Community & Culture

description:
He Kura Toi Tangata: Gold Card Tour, Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum invites our golden folk to experience an intimate, guided tour of photography exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975-2025.
The tour will continue throughout the museum, weaving through Wellington stories and taonga currently on display.
After the tour, we’ll sit down for a chat and a warm cuppa in the old Harbour Board room, with a little sweet something to finish off the afternoon.
This tour is part of the Takurua Hauora: Winter Wellness event series developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.
Tickets are limited. Booking is essential.
Note: International visitor admissions are not included.

Sunday 24 August | 10:30am–12pm
$5 for SuperGold Card holders

Book online or over the phone on: 04 472 8904

description:
Heartbreak Hotel, This one's for the young hearts, the old hearts, and the broken hearts.
Direct from a season at London’s Soho Theatre, Circa Theatre and EBKM are delighted to present a limited season of the Heartbreak Hotel. 11 Shows Only.
‘One of the best productions I’ve seen this year.’
★★★★★ Time Out Melbourne
‘It hijacks your nervous system and fast tracks its way into your soul.’
★★★★ Scotsman
“A brilliant production which I loved”
Suzie Miller, writer of Tony award-winning Prima Facie
Story, science and a synth combine in an exhilarating new play that examines what happens in our bodies when we’re bereft.
From acclaimed Wellington-based theatre company EBKM, who brought their ground-breaking Gravity & Grace to Circa Theatre last year (Production of the Year, Wellington Theatre Awards 2024), Heartbreak Hotel tracks a woman’s broken heart in a wrenching and relatable journey that’s studded with classic break-up songs and razor-sharp observations on the physiology of love.
Featuring award-winning performances from Karin McCracken (Gravity & Grace, Yes Yes Yes) and Circa Theatre mainstay Simon Leary (Blithe Spirit, Gravity & Grace, Transmission Beta), as well as exquisite direction from Eleanor Bishop (Gravity & Grace, Girls and Boys), Heartbreak Hotel is a hilarious, honest take on a universal human experience.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
James Nokise: One Night Rant | Wellington, James Nokise: One Night Rant | Wellington
Irreverent, incorrigible, and just ever so outraged, award-winning comedian James Nokise lets loose in Wellington for one night only!

Politicians, policies, preachers, and protests are all in the line of fire as Nokise brings his fast paced, semi-chaotic, always cathartic, blend of humour and hot takes back to NZ for a hilarious hour of big laughs and the occasional frustrated scream.

One Night Rant is political comedy at its sharpest. From parliament scandals to global chaos, Nokise rips into the news cycle, mixing big laughs with bite-sized truths. This is a one-hour comedy special designed for anyone who’s ever shouted at the TV, despaired at the headlines, or secretly enjoyed watching politicians squirm.


About James Nokise

A multi-talented comedian, playwright, columnist, podcaster, theatre maker, and social commentator, James Nokise is known for his fearless approach and his ability to give a voice to underrepresented issues.

Over the course of his illustrious career James has been nominated twice for the Billy T Award (2005, 2006) and the Fred Award for Best New Zealand Show (2013), which he subsequently took out in 2019 for his show God Damn Fancy Man. He won Best Male Comedian at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards (2013), Spirit of the Festival at the 2021 NZ Comedy Fest and the Topp Prize (2024). James was also the winner of best documentary at the 2025 NZ radio awards for his series The Last Voyage of the Rainbow Warrior, and winner of the Best International Podcast at the 2025 Asia Podcast Awards.

James has an extensive touring career, including over a decade of shows in the NZ International Comedy Festival and multiple Comedy Gala performances, as well as years on the international Fringe Festival circuit, performing successful seasons in Edinburgh, Perth, and New York.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Affordable Healthcare for All: Wellington, Luxon’s cuts are making our health system worse. His choices mean it’s getting harder and more expensive to see a doctor or nurse. 
National has found hundreds of millions for tobacco companies while New Zealand’s hospitals go understaffed and nurses are left without jobs. 
It's Luxon's fault GP fees are heading towards $100. Under National, you’re paying more, waiting longer and getting less. 
Labour believes that every New Zealander should be able to access world-class healthcare, no matter where they live. 
We will make it cheaper and easier to get care close to home, and make sure hospitals are there when you need them.  
Join Labour Leader Chris Hipkins and Health Spokesperson Dr Ayesha Verrall for a public meeting on getting the healthcare you deserve.
label: Government & Politics

description:
John Bishop — 25 Years of Stand-up Tour, English comedian, presenter, and actor John Bishop is heading to Wellington with a milestone to shout about. The Liverpool-born comic is celebrating 25 years in the business. His material usually draws from life experiences, and previous stand-up has covered observations about fatherhood, cycling around the world, playing semi-professional football, and his time working as a nightclub doorman. His Michael Fowler Centre show will undoubtedly showcase his famous natural charm and humility while delivering hilarious observations. 
“I can’t believe it will be 25 years since I first performed at the Frog and Bucket in Manchester. It’s been a rollercoaster!” says John. On top of stand-up comedy, he has found fame as a presenter. Among his many television appearances is ‘John Bishop: In Conversation With…’ This series saw him chatting with some of the biggest names in entertainment, music and sport. He has also fronted multiple documentary-style shows.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Is It Off?, Created and performed by Mamaeroa (Mo) Munn

This sold-out Pōneke favourite returns for one night only at Hannah Playhouse!

An oversharer with a splash of OCD, comedian, improviser and playwright Mo Munn was once called “unhinged” by a reviewer - and now she’s made it her whole personality! In her first solo hour, Mo squishes stand up, experimental and improvised comedy together for a rapid-fire whiplash of a show! Think one woman comedy buffet, packed with chaotic jokes, outlandish stories and a touch of spectacle. Fresh from debuting at the NZ International Comedy Fest, and taking home two comedy awards, Is it off? will keep audiences on their toes, delivering a comedy experience more hectic than a high school rave.

“… her show goes off in a very good way. It deserves to travel far and wide, as long as the oven is up for that." - John Smythe, Theatreview

" She jabs and slices at her audience and draws laughs instead of blood.... Thematically it's perfect" - Wellyott

General admission - pay what you can: $8 -$40
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Kiwis Big Hararei, Kiwis Big Hararei
Written by Catriona Tipene & Ryan Cundy
Produced by Horse With No Name with GRIDLEY by Victoria
Directed by Catriona Tipene

From the Land of the Long White Cloud to the Land Down Under!

Kiwi is going on his first big holiday from Aotearoa across to the golden shores of Brisbane. He’s got his backpack, a pocket full of worms, and a head full of dreams. The most exciting thing of all is that he might even get to go on a rollercoaster! With his Mum, Kiwi navigates air travel, hotels and conversations with marsupials as his world stretches from the home he knows, to the world over the horizon.

A tale that celebrates the connection between our two countries, featuring stunning costume designs by GRIDLEY by Victoria and fresh waiata by NZ singer-songwriter Benny Tipene. Brought to the stage by the multi-award winning companies Horse With No Name and GRIDLEY by Victoria, Kiwi’s Big Hararei is a story about spreading your wings and flying into the unknown.


Acclaim for Trees, Bees and Me (2024):

“I don’t even know where to start in telling you how absolutely captivating, magical and real this show is.” Tania Du Toit, Regional News

“every costume adds such a beautiful connection between the characters while the colours each beautifully blend so well together.” Brie Keatley, Art Murmurs

Acclaim for Land of the Long Long Drive (2023):

“Horse With No Name have come up with one of the best children’s theatre shows that Wellington has seen in quite some time.” Deborah Rea, Theatreview


Tuesday 23 September 2025 to Saturday 4 October 2025
Tues – Sat 10.00am and 11.30am
Meet the cast: Wednesday 24th September 11.30am and Wednesday 1st October 11.30am
Circa Two
$20 per person
$70 family pass (4 tickets)

description:
Kotahitanga: Artist Series - Riki Gooch and Bennett Pomana, Join Te Waka Huia for the final Kotahitanga event featuring a collaborative response to He Kura Toi Tangata from Wellington taonga Riki Gooch and Bennett Pomana.

Be prepared for textured sound and thought gymnastics with Riki on the drums and Bennett on the mic, closing out the series with one epic jam from these two legends.

5:30pm Doors open, bar open
6pm Artist response begins
6:30pm Interval
6:45pm Artist Q&A
7pm Closing Karakia and time to explore He Kura Toi Tangata exhibition
8pm Bar closes, event ends

About Riki Gooch

Dr Riki Neihana Gooch lives in Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa. His work spans multiple disciplines, including composition, performance, sound art, production, and academic research. He has led and conducted large-scale ensemble projects, performed in a wide range of collaborative settings, and created work for both recorded and live contexts. His ongoing projects include solo and group performances, conduction ensembles, DJ sets, and sound-based installations. He is also involved in cultural leadership and mentorship roles, holding wānanga and contributing to intergenerational knowledge exchange within the arts.


About Bennett Pomana

Bennett Pomana (Te Aitanga-a-Māhaki, Ngāi Tāmanuhiri) is a musician raised in Upper Hutt, with roots in Tūranganui-a-Kiwa. A longtime contributor to Aotearoa’s hip hop legacy, he has been part of pioneering groups including Upper Hutt Posse and Dam Native. His work is deeply influenced by his Māori identity, drawing inspiration from whakapapa, lived experience, and the ongoing pursuit of justice and expression through sound.


This event has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Kotahitanga: Artist Series - Tusiata Avia, We are honoured to host acclaimed poet; Tusiata Avia who will be opening Kotahitanga with her response to He Kura Toi Tangata.

Expect nothing less than the power of the word steeped in truth and machete-sharpened wit from this New Zealand Samoan poetry pantheon.

5:30pm Doors open, bar open
6pm Artist response begins
6:30pm Interval
6:45pm Artist Q&A
7pm Closing Karakia and time to explore He Kura Toi Tangata exhibition
8pm Bar closes, event ends



About Tusiata Avia

Tusiata Avia MNZM is a poet, writer and performer. She has published 5 books of poetry, children’s books, short film, radio documentary. Her iconic play Wild Dogs Under My Skirt showed Off-Broadway in 2020, where it won the Fringe Encore Outstanding Production of the Year. Her most recent play, The Savage Coloniser Show won Best New Play at Wellington Theatre Awards 2024. Both plays are based on books of poetry of the same name.

Tusiata was awarded a Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit for services to poetry and in 2024, the Prime Ministers Award for Literary Achievement: Poetry.


This event has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.

description:
Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax, Over three sessions create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique. This is an excellent opportunity to treat yourself to some creative fun!

In weeks one and two you'll learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects. Your waxes will be sent away for casting in the metal of your choice.

Then there will be a week's break before the third session, to allow time for everyone's waxes to be cast. The third session covers how to trim, clean and finish your casts, turning them into original jewellery ready to wear!

More advanced students can use these sessions to complete projects in a class setting.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs which vary from student to student depending on what sized ring they want to make and the type of metal you choose. Small castings can cost around $6.65 - $12 and might cost between $7 to $30 in metals depending on if you use red bronze, white bronze or silver.

This class is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
label: Classes & Workshops

Startups die. Founders are forever.
After the Welly Forge event, the night continues with a community party designed for founders, operators, and startup friends.
Costume Party – prizes for the best dressed
Music + Energy – dance, connect, and celebrate

A one-night-only after-party for New Zealand’s startup ecosystem — high-energy, founder-driven, and not to be missed.

description:
Lip Sync Assassins: A Drag Show Smackdown, One Stage. No Mercy. Only Lip-Sync Legends Survive.
Get ready for a drag showdown like no other as Wellingtons Lip Sync Assassins hit the stage with high drama, higher heels, and killer performances that’ll leave you gagging for more! Our fiercest queens and kings are ready to slay the stage in a lip-sync battle to the death (joking of course)!
Over 3 rounds our talented performers will Lip Sync off against a random competitor chosen by the crowd - expect splits, and surprise tricks as each performer fights for the crown with charisma, uniqueness, nerve, and plenty of lip-gloss. Who will bring the passion? Who will bring the fire?
Watch as a lineup of unstoppable talent goes head-to-head in a night of iconic anthems, jaw-dropping moves, and show-stopping stunts. From power ballads to pop bangers, each number is a deadly display of pure performance power.
WHO WILL BE CROWNED WELLINGTONS LIP SYNC ASSASSIN?

Watch as a lineup of unstoppable talent goes head-to-head in a night of iconic anthems, jaw-dropping moves, and show-stopping stunts. From power ballads to pop bangers, each number is a deadly display of pure performance power.
WHO WILL BE CROWNED WELLINGTONS LIP SYNC ASSASSIN?
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Legally Blonde The Musical, Legally Blonde The Musical
Coasters Musical Theatre presents "Legally Blonde the Musical" from October 2-12, 2025 at Southwards Theatre, Paraparaumu. This uplifting musical comedy follows Elle Woods' incredible journey from fashionable sorority queen to Harvard Law student, filled with catchy songs, dazzling choreography, and plenty of pink power.

Based on the beloved hit movie starring Reese Witherspoon, the show delivers an empowering message about believing in yourself, breaking stereotypes, and discovering your own strength and intelligence. Lauren Loghry makes her exciting Kapiti debut as the determined and vivacious Elle Woods in this feel-good production that promises to entertain and inspire audiences of all ages.

Tickets are $35, available at www.coastersmusicaltheatre.com.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Foraged Flavours : From Wild Greens to Plate, Foraged Flavours : From Wild Greens to Plate
~ Foraged Flavours: From Wild Greens to Plate ~

Step into a full-day, hands-on workshop at Mangaroa Farms, just 40 minutes from Wellington with Expert Forager Felicity Joy from Wild Botanica.

You’ll explore seasonal edible wild greens, learning to identify them, discover their properties, and turn your foraged finds into simple, delicious creations. In the farm’s fully equipped kitchen, you’ll make a range of hands-on preparations: fresh wild green spreads, infused butters, vibrant salads, and pickled or preserved treats, all designed to showcase the flavours of the season.

During the day, we’ll enjoy a shared wild feast together, tasting the seasonal dishes you’ve prepared in a relaxed, beautiful farm setting. This workshop is interactive, practical, and sensory, a chance to deepen your foraging skills, connect with nature, and celebrate the flavours of the wild. All ingredients, tools, and guidance are provided, so you can fully immerse yourself in the experience.

Perfect for those who’ve already attended Wild Botanica’s Foraging Workshops, this is the next step: taking your wild plant knowledge into the kitchen. Also suitable for total beginners, no experience needed.

When: Saturday 18th October
Time: 10 am – 3 pm (5-hour immersive experience)
Location: Mangaroa Farms, 40 minutes from Wellington

What’s included:
~ Full-day, hands-on experience: foraging, plant ID, cooking, and tasting
~ Access to a fully equipped kitchen and all tools
~ Guidance from an expert forager and cook
~ A shared wild feast using seasonal foraged ingredients prepared during the workshop
~ Educational insights into the nutritional, medicinal, and culinary properties of wild greens
~ Beautiful farm setting for a relaxed, sensory experience

Don't delay, call your friends and book your tickets now to avoid missing out:

https://www.wildbotanica.co.nz/collections/foraging-workshops/products/foragedflavours

p.s. book your tickets by 20 September to receive $20 off each ticket. Just use the code EARLYBIRD at checkout.

description:
Kōrero Paki, Kōrero Paki
Performed by Kōrero Paki

Crack open a cold one and get set for a night of mean kōrero and wild comedy from this spontaneous tira whakaari. Delight as our performers talk sh*t, share off the cuff stories, and take the show to wild places through improv. Like all good garage parties, this show will be jam-packed with crack up storytelling, cheeky banter, and plenty of laughs.

Kōrero Paki debuted at NZIF 2024 and had a successful run at the 2025 NZ International Comedy Festival.

Featuring:

Mo (Mamaeroa) Munn
Q Potts
Kipling DC
Lachlan Bowker
Viki Moananu

Kōrero Paki is a Māori and Pacifica improv group who have performed in the NZ International Comedy Fest and the NZ Improv Festival. A group of improvisers and stand up comedians, Kōrero Paki is focused on comedic storytelling improv.

The show contains adult themes and strong language. As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

Lower Hutt Art Trail at TLC (Stop #10), Lower Hutt Art Trail at TLC (Stop #10)

Wander through our vibrant art school campus, meet our talented artists, and get a behind-the-scenes look at how creativity comes to life.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁’𝘀 𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗽𝗲𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝘁 𝗧𝗟𝗖:
As part of the Lower Hutt Art Trail, TLC opens its doors to visitors to experience the energy of our working studios. Meet our talented TLC artists and explore a wide range of practices including ceramics, jewellery, painting, dry media and printmaking. Watch creativity in action, chat with our artists about their processes, and be inspired by the vibrant, hands-on atmosphere that makes TLC a cornerstone of the local art community. Visit our on-site Gallery to see our latest exhibition of work by local artist Louis Mikaere.

Whether you're a fellow artist, an art lover, or just curious - everyone is welcome!
