description:
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset, Breathwork: A Gentle Reset
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset

Take a pause from the noise of daily life.

This breathwork journey begins with gentle movement to awaken the body and open the breath. Through slow, mindful stretches, we begin softening tension and grounding into the present.

You’ll then be guided through two styles of breathwork — each offering a unique pathway inward. There’s no pressure or expectation, just the freedom to explore what feels right for you:

A dynamic, connected breath for those who wish to build energy, move emotion, or break through internal blockages

A slow, rhythmic breath for those seeking stillness, calm, and deeper grounding

Both approaches invite a sense of spaciousness — physically, mentally, and emotionally — while supporting nervous system balance and inner clarity.

To gently close the session, we’ll move into a quiet, nurturing meditation to support integration and leave you feeling steady, clear, and connected.

Afterwards, stay and enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, lovingly prepared to complement the experience — because healing is also about how we feed and care for ourselves.

Why Breathwork?

Breathwork has helped so many shift from a state of tension and overwhelm into a place of ease, clarity, and resilience — often after just one session. It’s a simple, powerful practice that reconnects you to your body, your breath, and your inner stillness.

You’ll leave feeling more grounded, more present, and more like yourself again.

Meet Karla, your host
Karla is a breathwork and trauma-somatic facilitator based in Aotearoa (New Zealand), originally from Malta. With over a decade of experience in Reiki and three years facilitating trauma-informed, science-based breathwork, Karla combines holistic tools, meditation, and conscious breathing to support nervous system regulation and deep emotional healing. Her offerings help release stored trauma, reduce stress and anxiety, and activate oxytocin—the “love hormone”—fostering connection, vitality, and a sense of wholeness. She currently holds regular classes, workshops, and transformative retreats that nurture the mind, body, and spirit.

description:
Courageous Communication™ | 1-day Workshop | Wellington | 11 Nov 2025, Courageous Communication™ | 1-day Workshop | Wellington | 11 Nov 2025
Get great at having hard conversations with Kaila Colbin

About this Event

Has this ever happened to you?
You’re sitting in a meeting and there are 50 elephants in the room with you that nobody is mentioning, and you’re doing the strategic plan but everyone knows it’s never going to work because the team don’t have the capability or the capacity and that one person never follows through and that other person thinks her work is better than it is, but nobody says anything and as you leave you think well THAT'S three hours I’m never gonna get back…
It’s hard to say the hard thing.
But saying the hard thing is the only way we can deal with what’s actually going on.
The number one indicator of a lack of courage is an inability to have hard conversations.
Hard conversations are scary. Our hearts start pounding, our tummies clench, our mouths go dry.
Hard conversations feel dangerous. If I say this thing, he’ll be offended! She’ll be angry! I’ll get in trouble!
Hard conversations are tempting to avoid. Nobody else is mentioning these elephants. Why should I?
But what if you were great at them?
What would it mean for your relationships?
What would it mean for your career?
What would it mean for your life?
Kaila Colbin has worked with more than 4,000 people to grow courage as a core competency and a clear framework has emerged from that experience.
In this 1-day workshop, you’ll build the skill and muscle to get great at having hard conversations.
We’ll cover the specific elements of how to communicate and what to communicate.

When: Tuesday, 11 November 2025, 9 am-4:30 pm
Where: Rangimarie Room, Te Papa Museum, 55 Cable Street, Wellington 6011
Lunch, afternoon tea and all-day tea and coffee are included in the registration.



Need help with the cost?
If you are an Educator or at a Not-for-Profit, you can automatically access a special rate of $745 + GST when you register (a $250 discount off our standard General Admission rates).



Our Health and Safety Plan
Boma is committed to delivering safe events. We follow best practices suggested by the New Zealand health authorities and work closely with our suppliers to prioritise health and wellbeing.
Our comprehensive health and safety plans ensure you can book with certainty and attend with confidence.



Our refund policy
For details on event refunds and transfers, please see our refund policy.


About the Kaila Colbin
Kaila Colbin is founder and CEO of Boma, an organisation building a world of intentional, intelligent, courageous leaders.
An award-winning leader renowned for impact, Kaila developed TEDxChristchurch into New Zealand’s flagship TEDx event and brought Singularity University to New Zealand and Australia, supporting thousands of people to engage with exponentially accelerating technologies and their impact on humanity. She trained with Dr Brené Brown as a Certified Dare to Lead™ Facilitator.
As a founder of the non-profit Ministry of Awesome, Kaila played a critical role in developing Christchurch’s startup ecosystem. She has extensive governance experience, and has been involved with mergers, capital raises, and company sales in the US and NZ.
A native New Yorker, Kaila’s work to champion Aotearoa New Zealand on a global stage saw her given the 2022 Kea World Class New Zealand “Friend of New Zealand” award. Her purpose in life is to be an uplifting presence.

If you have any questions about this event, please email us at .

description:
Manu Park Site Viewing, Manu Park Site Viewing
Meet us and find out how you can build your dream home in a new subdivision that combines outstanding natural beauty and a real sense of community.
The agent is on-site at the end of Karuhiruhi Street every Sunday between 10.00am - 11.00am.
Since its establishment in 2018, Manu Park has become a highly sought-after community, with Stages One and Two fully sold out. Don’t miss your chance to secure a piece of this paradise in Stage 3, where only 8 sections remain.
Manu Park isn’t just a place to live—it’s a place to belong. Designed with families in mind, it offers a safe and welcoming environment where kids can ride their bikes down quiet streets, explore nature on their doorstep, and grow up knowing their neighbours. Centrally located near Waikanae township it offers expansive open spaces and a strong sense of community; Manu Park is a neighbourhood where friendships flourish and families thrive.
Nestled within protected native bush, Manu Park offers breathtaking surroundings, generously sized sections, and the opportunity to build a home tailored to your vision and lifestyle. Named after the Māori word for bird, it sits beside the renowned Nga Manu Nature Reserve, close to Waikanae’s excellent schools and amenities, just minutes from the beach, and under an hour from Wellington city.
Teaming up with local building companies, Manu Park offers House and Land packages for a seamless home-building experience. Visit Manu Park to explore Design and Build opportunities to create a home that perfectly fits your lifestyle.
Don’t miss this rare opportunity to be part of a vibrant community where nature and modern living come together. Visit manupark.nz to learn more and secure your section today

Death Cafe Newtown, Death Cafe runs monthly on the 2nd Saturday.
Let's normalise our own demise! We are all going to die, let's talk about it. At a Death Café people - often strangers - gather to eat cake, drink tea and discuss death. Death Café is not a grief support group, or counselling session - instead it is a place to discuss death without expectations. The objective is 'to increase awareness of death with a view to helping people make the most of their (finite) lives'.
For more information about Death Cafes generally, check deathcafe.com

About this Event

Resilient Leadership
Real talk on leading well without losing your spark
Leadership shouldn’t come at the cost of your wellbeing. Yet too often, high performance is confused with running on empty.

Why be part of this session?
We’ll cut through the clichés and have a real conversation about resilience, balance, and what it takes to sustain yourself - and your team - over the long haul. Walk away with practical strategies to embed wellbeing into daily work, recharge team culture, and lead in a way that keeps your spark alive.
Because the best leaders don’t just survive pressure - they model how to thrive through it.

This event is part of a new 3-part series: Future Fluent - Navigate What’s Next.

description:
Draw It Out - Fertility NZ national online workshop, A bespoke Draw It Out workshop for Fertility NZ, open to all genders.
Tickets: $34.50pp
Theme: Strengthen self-care for the holiday season
Strengthen your inner resources to care for yourself over the holiday season, and meet others going through similar experiences through this online national workshop, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.

FertilityNZ exists to support New Zealanders experiencing fertility problems, whether facing challenges becoming or staying pregnant. This bespoke workshop shares drawing for wellness, to tap into your inner guidance for support, within a safe space where others may be experiencing similar journeys.
Included in your workshop
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
What you will need
As this is an online workshop, you will need a computer in a comfortable, quiet setting. A hard surface to draw on (like a desk or a board), three to five pages of A3 paper (you can also tape two A4 printing papers together), and any colouring tools of your choice. Crayons are great as they are more child-like so you don't worry about how it looks. Coloured pastels or pencils are also good, or any coloured markers. The key is a range of colours.

About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz.
Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

description:
Daffodil Express 2025, Daffodil Express 2025
Carterton’s Daffodil Festival in the early Spring creates a great day out for the whole family. Why not travel there in style by a heritage train, let Steam Incorporated take the stress out of travel as you take the train to the Wairarapa. This year, our train has reduced capacity, so be sure to book in quickly!

Hauled by our heritage locomotives, take a glimpse into the bygone era of train travel as we clear the rush of Wellington, racing through the suburbs of Petone, Lower Hutt & Upper Hutt. After picking up the last of our passengers at Upper Hutt, we will race through the 8.8km long Rimutaka tunnel. This tunnel remains the longest in New Zealand with scheduled passenger trains, and has just been subjected to a full track relay for the first time since it was opened in 1955.

Passing through Featherston, we head east and navigate the rolling hills towards Carterton.

Arriving into Carterton, you'll have a few hours to disembark and go and explore Carterton's annual Daffodil Festival , before jumping on the train for the return journey home.

The Daffodil Fields and Festival
Located in the heart of the Wairarapa, Carterton’s popular Daffodil Festival offers an abundance of activities ranging from the famous Daffodil picking at Middlerun Farm, markets along High and Holloway Streets, the Big Wai Art sale in the events Centre, live music, and loads more family fun.

Shuttle buses will run from the town centre to the daffodil fields. There will be a lot of people for these buses, so please be patient. The bus transfer is free.

Here you can pick your own daffodils for $5 (Cash Preferred) that is a fundraiser for Wellington Free Ambulance and Whānau Āwhina Plunket, Wairarapa region. While stocks last!

The fields are not suitable for walkers or wheelchairs due to uneven grounds.

Prior booking is essential, this is an annual sell out event!

Fares
Adult (13+) - $125
Child (2-12yrs) - $90
Infant - Free

For more information & tickets, head to https://steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/daffodil-express/

Amy Richards is a yoga teacher based in Pōneke, with a Certificate in MindBody Therapy. description:
Roll For Romance (AGE 25-39), Single? Fancy a game night with a twist?

 

This event takes the classic board game evening and gives it a speed-dating spin. From 7.00 to 9.00 pm, you’ll have the chance to meet up to 20 singles and bond over a carefully selected set of board games picked to spark conversation and laughter.

 

You’ll play in mixed-gendered groups and rotate around to meet different groups. You’ll stay with your same-gendered group throughout the night, so don’t sweat it if you’re a bit shy—bring a friend along for the ride.

 

First drink’s on us, because let’s face it, gaming is thirsty work!

 

After the games wrap up, feel free to hang out with your new acquaintances till 9.15. Or, if you’ve got to run, be sure to fill out one of our match cards, and we’ll connect you with your matches in the coming days.

 

Perfect for singles looking to mix fun with the chance to meet someone special.

 

Recommended age 25-39.

 

Not your jam? Check out our other upcoming events on our website!
By purchasing a ticket you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms & Conditions.

description:
Elebreath® Somatic Breath + Sound Journey, Elebreath® Somatic Breath + Sound Journey
Join Lynn Tiang for a powerful in-person ceremony blending cacao, breathwork, sound, and intuitive movement. Release emotional tension, reset your nervous system, and reconnect with the wisdom of your body.

Through the Elebreath® five-phase arc — grounding, activation, cathartic release, integration, and soulful reflection — you’ll be guided into a state of deep presence where breath, sound, and movement awaken what’s been waiting to be felt.

What to expect:
* Somatic breathwork to clear stored emotions & reset nervous rhythms
* Live soundscapes & intuitive movement for release and integration
*Ceremonial cacao opening to connect with heart energy
*Oracle card pulling + journaling to anchor insights
*Light kai to ground and nourish after the session

Who this is for:
*Anyone navigating emotional fatigue, life transitions, or inner misalignment
*Those seeking nervous system recalibration and emotional release
*People longing for a safe space to soften, release, and reconnect with their body’s wisdom

What’s Included:
*Elebreath® five-phase somatic breathwork journey
*Trauma-informed, nervous system–aware facilitation
*Live sound journey & curated sonic support
*Cacao opening ritual
*Journaling + oracle reflection
*Closing with kai and community space
*Integration Breathwork practices that you can access anytime at your own timing
*Fatigue-free mini-course integration

description:
Explore Healing For Self - Monthly Event, Explore Healing For Self - Monthly Event
Tania loves creating & holding sacred space for people & in this monthly event she will be creating a space where you can focus on your own healing journey in a group environment. In each session you will be guided through clearing, releasing, healing & remembering processes to help & assist you. We will explore different tools, processes & modalities each time to experience the highest possible energetic shift that is possible at that time.

Each month will have a different focus & flavour with the intention of working on yourself in a safe held space.
Over the next 4 sessions we will explore:

The 12 Chakra system, tools to use to help clear & heal the chakras and then enjoy a beautiful energy healing with the Archangels that are connected to each of the chakras.

Angelic Reiki - Receive an Angelic Cleansing, releasing old karmic connections with Archangel Michael, followed by a group healing with the angels wanting to connect with you.

Full Sensory Perception tools through Pleiadian Lightwork - an explanation on how the tools may feel & work & being in those energies & frequencies to receive the clearing & healing that is possible.

Access Bars - How ‘running the bars’ can help, some key points to use for stress or healing, running clearing statements to release old beliefs & patterns. What else is possible & how does it get any better than this.

There is a lot to explore & embrace and there may be additional processes brought in as Tania is guided or as time allows.

First Tuesday of the month 10am-12pm $30


Tania is a gifted intuitive and holistic practitioner, known for her grounded presence and loving guidance. She is an Angelic Reiki Master Teacher, Pleiadian Lightwork Practitioner & Teacher, conscious channeler, and Access Bars Practitioner. With a rich background in intuitive and energy work, she brings a nurturing and empowering energy to both group workshops and one-on-one sessions.

Bookings are essential. Email Tania:

For more details Text/Phone Tania : 021 030 6507

Venue: the studio @ the art and living space, 17 Bradey Road, Pauatahanui

description:
Exploring our shared humanity, Join experienced psychotherapist Rohit Grover for a six-week course that invites you to look beyond the surface of everyday life. In these two-hour sessions, we will explore the core tenets of existential therapy, moving away from the conventional focus on self and hedonism. Instead, we'll grapple with life's big questions:
What does it truly mean to live a value-driven life?
Do our personal values matter, or is the search for meaning just an illusion?
What is the "being" part of "human being" all about?
Through guided discussions, reflective exercises, and insights from classic existential thinkers, Rohit will help you navigate this profound territory. This isn't about finding easy answers. It's about developing the courage to ask the right questions, to confront the realities of freedom, responsibility, and meaning, and to discover a more authentic way of living.
This course is for anyone ready to step off the treadmill and begin a deeper exploration of what it means to be alive. Come and find out what it means to truly exist
Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to:
Differentiate between a life driven by external pressures or fleeting pleasures and one rooted in personal values and authentic meaning.
Identify and critically examine the core existential givens of human existence, such as freedom, responsibility, isolation, and the search for meaning.
Articulate a personal understanding of what it means to "be" a human being, moving beyond a purely functional or biological definition.
Arrive at sensing rather than thinking. Sensing this existence, this dance of life. Widen your view of existence.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall, $20 -tickets via link: https://events.humanitix.com/gong-bath-at.../tickets
*Limited door sales for $25*
*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket - or whatever it is you need to feel most warm and comfortable *
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.

During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.

Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.

Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.

Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground.

**THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 40 PEOPLE ONLY**

Disclaimer
Gong baths are safe and supportive for most people. However, please consult your doctor or mental health professional before attending if you:
-have a pacemaker or other implanted medical device
-live with epilepsy or a sound-sensitive condition
-are in the first trimester of pregnancy
-are experiencing severe or unmanaged mental health challenges (such as psychosis, schizophrenia, or PTSD)
If you have recent injuries, surgeries, or other health concerns, let me know so we can make sure you’re comfortable.
Everyone responds differently to sound. If at any point during the session you feel overwhelmed or uncomfortable, you are welcome to sit up, move gently, or step outside. Your wellbeing always comes first.

description:
Healthy Hospo The Stress Reset: Breathwork and Breakfast. Wellington, The Stress Reset: Breathework and Breakfast for Hospo
November is one of the busiest times of year in hospitality.
And while you’re looking after everyone else, we want to make sure someone is looking after you!
Join us for a morning, hosted at Awhi Studio, to give you a chance to de-stress and set yourself up before the peak season.
What to expect:
10.00am: A chilled out yoga session with Julie Sayasane, local Wellinton hospo legend and yoga teacher.
10.45am: A workshop and breathwork session with resident Healthy Hospo Presenter Josh Fankhauser where you’ll learn more about stress and experience the physiological effects of working with the breathe.
11.30am: Relax, and connect with other hospo over Havana Coffee and The Oatery Breakfast Bowls.
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $40 per person is fully sponsored.
Yoga Mats are provided but please bring a notebook and pen.
Spaces are limited to 30, and as these are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!

description:
Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Wellington, We're pleased to invite you to join us for this workshop on Building resilience and unlocking the power of the mind.
Why this matters:
In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill. It's not just about bouncing back from adversity but confidently navigating change. Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability. This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind. By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
What to expect:
During this interactive workshop, participants will explore the core concepts of resilience and the mind-body connection through engaging discussions, experiential exercises, and practical demonstrations. They will learn evidence-based techniques to enhance their resilience, manage stress effectively, and cultivate a positive mindset amidst adversity. By the end of the session, attendees will emerge with a comprehensive toolkit to fortify their mental resilience and embrace change with confidence.
Who this is for:
This workshop caters to individuals across all organisational levels who are eager to enhance their resilience and cultivate a resilient mindset. Whether you're an owner, manager, chef, senior staff member, or junior employee, this workshop offers invaluable insights and practical strategies to bolster resilience and thrive in today's fast-paced world.
About the presenter, Sarah Robb
Sarah is a certified coach, counselor, and Master Practitioner of NLP (neuro-linguistic programming) holding a Bachelor's degree in Psychology.
With a passion for transformation, she guides individuals through retraining their brains and breaking free from limiting beliefs and patterns. Drawing on her extensive lived experience, Sarah has collaborated with over 200 clients and organisations, empowering them to apply practical tools and strategies for significant improvements in their mental health.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

description:
HineHau Breathwork for Women, Join Shannon Rose for this unique three-hour breathwork workshop for all wāhine.

Through story, breath, and reflection, you’ll learn and experience the power of your breath as a wāhine: to cleanse, to create, and to consciously live in alignment with who you are.

Shannon has been immersed in the practice of breath since 2017 and is recognised as one of the pioneers of breathwork in Aotearoa. She is the founder of HineHau, a breathwork training kaupapa supporting wāhine to step into leadership and facilitation through the breath.

In this workshop, you’ll be safely guided on a journey of remembrance, reconnection, and reclamation. Expect to come away feeling grounded, rejuvenated, and more at home in your body.

What’s Included
*Karakia to open and close our space
*Purākau — Māori creation stories on the whakapapa of the breath
*Kōrero — how intentional breathing helps to align your mauri, wairua and mana
*Working with the nervous system to support manifestation and creativity
*BreathWav™ Journey — a 70-minute circular connected breath practice for release, alignment, and deep connection
*Journaling & Reflection to integrate what arises.

What to Bring
Water bottle, a journal + pen and an eye mask. Mats, blankets & supportive props provided.

Who This is For
This workshop is open to wāhine of all cultures who are ready to experience the healing power of Te Hā — the sacred breath.
label: Health & Wellness

Think of it as a meditation, similar to Yoga Nidra, but with our unique touch.

description:
Elvis An American Trilogy, ELVIS AN AMERICAN TRILOGY
Presents
ALOHA FROM HAWAII”

Starring 3 best Elvis tribute artists in the world: Steve Michaels, Louis Brown and Arron Walker

Due to overwhelming demand, Elvis: An American Trilogy, the show that embodies the essence of ‘The King’, is coming to NZ. The show that takes the audience on a spellbinding journey through the many eras of the legendary Elvis Presley.

The show begins with Louis Brown who captures the audience with his raw rockabilly sound and signature dance moves.

Arron Walker takes the role of Elvis in his movie years and the ‘68 Comeback Special as he effortlessly recreates the straight-out-of-the-army look and into the black leather, personifying this period with all the songs and sex appeal that was Elvis.

Steve Michaels is also arguably the greatest exponent of Elvis ‘Aloha from Hawaii’-era in the world, the look, the sound, and the moves, combined with the shy and charming Elvis’s disposition will make ‘Elvis and American Trilogy’ THE Elvis show to see in 2025

If you only see one Elvis show in 2025 make it …Elvis: An American Trilogy

description:
Inner infrastructure for Outer Resilience, In times of polycrisis and uncertainty, more people are coming around to the need not for more information, but for integration and presence.
This 90-minute session offers a safe, grounded space to slow down, reconnect with ourselves, and explore the inner terrain of change-making, and of our relational space.
As Rumi reminds us: “Yesterday I was clever and tried to change the world; today I am wise and am changing myself.”
Building our inner infrastructure - our relationship with self, with our feelings, with others and with nature - is foundational to how we show up in the world.
We will begin by discussing research into how distraction or numbing our discomfort is an intelligent and common short-term survival strategy, but in fact is one which limits our long-term capacity to connect, lead and evolve. We will then guide participants in somatic practices to offer accessible ways to reconnect with your agency.
During this session, you will gain tools to increase your inner awareness, expand your bandwidth of awareness, and integrate emotion, sensation, and story. Together we’ll explore the role of perception in our orientation to life and the choices we make, how our narratives can connect us with our agency, the power of curiosity, and dive into how our relational presence can often have more impact than our opinions.
This session is an invitation to restore connection, calm, and courage, to become more whole, more fully human, and more ready for what this moment is asking of us.
About your host
Freda is a curator, engagement practitioner, and connector, who works at the intersection of social change, community-building, and inner development. She is the Founder of the Goodlife Collective, which curates spaces that build connection, wellbeing and collective wisdom.
Drawing on yoga teaching, somatic practices and adult development, Freda is interested in how we build our inner infrastructure - the capacity to work through discomfort, reconnect with our agency, and bring greater presence to relationships. Her background is in psychology, environmental-science and design, and she loves nerding out on ideas and conversations about unlocking our collective potential.

description:
Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – Vogelmorn, Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – big hearts, remarkable songs – on stage, with a collection of brand new tunes.
Doors at 7
Music at 7.30
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com
-----------------
Tom Cunliffe writes folk songs like short films; vivid, offbeat, and full of heart. Based in Tamaki Makaurau, Auckland, he crafts lyrical worlds, with a guitar tuned sideways and a voice that balances gravity with joy.
Cunliffe has supported a number of internationally renowned artists including M. Ward, Grace Cummings, and Reb Fountain, bringing his mix of warmth, wit, and slow-burning intensity to stages near and far.
-----------------
"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”
“The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com”
Ali Whitton is an Aotearoa-born, Yorkshire-raised and now Wellington based singer-songwriter who is stepping into his own as an artist. Ali is an artist who refuses to let go, blending raw storytelling with a sound shaped by decades of experience and dedication to his craft.
Performing for years under the name Lost Bird, Ali built a reputation for writing heartfelt, melancholic folk-pop, playing everywhere from Wellington bars to stadium stages — including opening for Ed Sheeran in Auckland in 2018.
Now, after years of performing behind an alias, Ali is stepping forward under his own name, embracing his identity as an artist with an invigorated sense of purpose, and tackling his artistry with newfound confidence and clarity.
-----------------
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours.

description:
Master Your Mornings: A Routine That Works, Master Your Mornings: a Routine That Works
Take charge of your mornings and set yourself up for a productive, goal-driven day. A well-designed morning routine can give you focus, fuel your ambition, and create momentum that carries through everything you do. In this workshop, you’ll learn how to build a routine that fits your life and drives your success.

Dive into the science behind effective morning habits, pick up practical strategies for building routines that stick, and explore proven techniques to stay motivated and on track. Whether your goal is to enhance productivity, improve wellbeing, or cultivate mindfulness, this workshop gives you the tools to turn your mornings into a launchpad for long-term achievements.

What you’ll gain:

Understand the psychology behind morning habits and why they matter

Discover how to design a morning routine tailored to your personal and professional aspirations

Learn time-tested strategies for consistency and maintaining motivation

Build a morning routine that sets you up for success, every single day

Leave this workshop with a clear, actionable morning routine that empowers you to take control of your day, and more importantly, your future.

Start each day with intention, clarity, and the momentum to reach your goals

Meet Nava, your host

Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After eight exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!

Meet Chaitanya Charan, your host

A monk for over 25 years, he has dedicated his life to exploring how we think, decide, and live — and how to do it with more clarity and purpose. He has spoken in more than 30 countries, from Ivy League universities to grassroots gatherings, engaging audiences with his clear thinking, relatable stories, and practical strategies. An accomplished author and speaker, Chaitanya Charan offers insights that challenge perspectives, spark reflection, and inspire real change.

Mainline Steam’s popular Tui Brewery trip returns with Steam locomotive Jb1236 (Joanne) and the fleet of Ao carriages featuring large panoramic windows, air conditioning and heating.

Travel from Plimmerton through Pukerua Bay overlooking the stunning coast line with views of Kapiti Island as we proceed north through Kapiti into the country side of the Manawatu. We pass through the Manawatu Gorge with spectacular views of the river and the remnants of the old highway now bypassed by the new The Te Ahu a Turanga highway over the Tararua ranges.

Our buffet carriage will have food and drinks available for purchase during the trip.

Upon arrival at Mangatainoka, a bus will transfer you to the Tui Brewery or feel free to take the 10-minute walk to the Brewery.

Our hosts at the Tui Brewery will serve a gourmet BBQ lunch in the original Flagon room with a complimentary drink (beer, cider, Sav) and you will receive the Mangatainoka Passport full of vouchers to redeem at the Brewery. Please purchase the lunch option when booking your train tickets.

description:
Men’s Circle: Real Conversations, Men’s Circle: Real Conversations
In a world where men are often expected to have everything figured out, this gathering offers a space to be genuine, not perfect.

About this Event

Men’s Circle: Real Conversations
In a society where men are expected to always have it together, this space is for being honest, not perfect.
This is a free offering but there’s the option to stay for an amazing plant-based dinner ($15). There’s no pressure to join, but sitting down to eat together is a simple, powerful way to deepen the sense of connection. Andre & Sri Jiva aren’t running this circle for profit and they are genuinely invested in creating real, meaningful spaces for men to connect.
The Men’s Circle is a gathering where men are able to connect in a safe, supportive space to share experiences, express emotions, and foster personal growth. Free from societal expectations of stoicism or self-sufficiency. Through open sharing and mutual support, participants are empowered to build resilience, self-reflection, and a stronger sense of identity and purpose.
Structure of the Circle
Gathering in a Circle: Participants sit in a circle to symbolize equality and unity.A short meditation or moment of silence may be included to help everyone arrive and connect.
Talking Object: A sharing stick or object is placed in the center. Only the personholding the object may speak, ensuring uninterrupted sharing.
Open Sharing: Anyone may choose to share while holding the object. Sharing is op-tional, and passing is always respected.
Active Listening: While one person shares, others listen attentively without speaking,interrupting, or offering advice. The focus is on witnessing and being present.
No Judgments or Advice: Participants refrain from judging or offering unsolicitedadvice, creating a safe space for authentic expression.
Closing: The circle may conclude with a group reflection, a moment of gratitude, or a simple acknowledgment of the shared experience.
Circle Agreements
Supportive Environment: We are here to uplift and support one another, fosteringtrust and brotherhood.
Focus on the Present: Share whats alive for you now, focusing on your emotions and experiences to deepen emotional awareness.
Use "I" Statements: Speak from your personal perspective using "I" statements topromote authenticity and responsibility. Avoid generalizations like "we" or "us."
No Judgment or fixing: Refrain from judging others sharing or offering unsolicitedadvice, ensuring a safe and non-critical space.
Confidentiality: What is shared in the circle stays in the circle. You may discuss your own experience outside the group, but keep others details private.




Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!

What’s on the menu?
Creamy Farfalle Pasta with Plant-Based Bacon
Toasted Bruschetta with “Cheese”, Tomato and Parsley
Fresh Salad with Balsamic Vinegar
Berry Vanilla Muffins with Whipped Cream




Meet Your Hosts: Andre and Sri Jiva
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.
Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.




Agenda


🕑: 05:30 PM - 05:45 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 05:45 PM - 07:15 PM
Men's Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection
Host: Andre

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:15 PM
Plant-based dinner and dessert!

description:
Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection, Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection
The Men’s Circle is a free, supportive gathering for men to connect, share openly, and grow together. Whether you're navigating life changes, seeking community, or simply wanting a space to be heard, you're welcome here.
Expect honest conversations and the kind of connection that’s rare but necessary. No pressure to speak—just your presence is enough. We follow a respectful, non-judgmental format that prioritizes safety, confidentiality, and authenticity.
Optional Plant-Based Dinner
Stay afterwards for a nourishing, plant-based dinner and dessert ($15). Sharing a meal is a powerful way to extend the connection beyond the circle. This gathering is not run for profit—Andre is simply passionate about creating spaces for genuine connection.
What to Expect in the Circle:
Gathering in Circle: We sit in a circle to foster a sense of unity and equality.
Centering In: A short meditation or silence helps us arrive and ground.
Talking Object: A shared object moves around—only the person holding it speaks.
Optional Sharing: Speak if you feel moved. You’re always welcome to pass.
Active Listening: No interruptions, advice, or feedback—just presence.
Confidentiality: What's shared in the circle, stays in the circle.
Our Shared Agreements:
Speak from the “I”: Share from your own experience, not on behalf of others.
No fixing or judging: This is not a space to solve, but to witness.
Be present: Share what’s alive for you right now.
Respect and trust: We uphold a culture of care, confidentiality, and non-judgment.
Meet Andre, your host
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. Over the years, Andre has come to value the power of sitting in circle—of men coming together in honesty, vulnerability, and presence to witness and support one another. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.

Te Kāhui Tika Tangata Human Rights Commission is proud to host this discussion for International Day of Older Persons in partnership with Kawe Mahara Queer Archives Aotearoa (formerly LAGANZ).

Panelists from the Wellington rainbow community - 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗶 𝗠𝗶𝘁𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗹, 𝗞𝗲𝘃𝗶𝗻 𝗛𝗮𝘂𝗻𝘂𝗶 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗟𝗮𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘆 𝗖𝗼𝘄𝗮𝗻 - will join Chief Commissioner Dr Stephen Rainbow for the discussion and a brief Q and A session. 🌈🎙️💫

description:
Nutrition - Masterton Cancer Support Group, Nutrition - Masterton Cancer Support Group
The Cancer support groups offered by Wairarapa Cancer Society are a great place for people navigating cancer to connect with others who have gone through similar experiences.

These groups provide a safe and supportive environment where individuals can share their emotions, experiences, and knowledge.

Not only do these support groups offer a sense of belonging and understanding, but they also provide practical advice, encouragement, and hope during what can be a difficult and challenging time.

This group provides an inclusive and open environment for individuals to attend and participate in the discussion topic. There is no pressure or expectation for attendees to stay for the entire open floor support session.

Structure of group meetings as follows.

- Welcome
- Topic presented and discussed.
- Open floor support
- Closing

This month our focus is on nutrition to support cancer prevention and recovery during treatment. We’ll look at how food choices can help maintain energy, support overall wellbeing, and aid the body through treatment and beyond.

All are welcome. If you would like particular questions covered in the session, please let me know ahead of time.

The support group places a strong emphasis on maintaining the confidentiality and ensuring the safety of attendees.

Please RSVP
There is no cost to attend this meeting.

description:
Parent Support Group – Miramar, Parent Support Group – Miramar
care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.

Parent to Parent hosts monthly Parent Support Groups in Miramar to support carers and parents just like you. These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement-free environment. No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’. We get it, and we are here to help.

So if you’d like to share a struggle, celebrate a success, raise a concern, or simply have a cuppa and chat with other parents and carers in your area, you are always welcome at our Parent Support Group. Children are welcome too! Drop in for as long or as short a time as you want. And did we mention there’s free coffee??

No need to RSVP, feel free to just show up on the day!

Or contact Meredith Dyer for more info:
| 027 808 3947

description:
Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind, Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point? This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction. Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.


Meet your host, Sivananda
Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.
6.15pm Tuesday 19th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Posture Perfection Is Possible, Are you a computer slouch, feeling stiff and tense at work? Do you find it difficult to maintain a good posture? Does your posture cause back, neck or shoulder tension? Would you like to enjoy more freedom in everyday activities?

Under the guidance of an experienced teacher, we'll explore movement in ways that help you reduce tense unhelpful habits. Movement lessons are done on the floor or sitting on a chair and are based on the pioneering work of Israeli physicist and engineer Dr. Moshe Feldenkrais. This workshop is suitable for all ages (over 16) and fitness levels.

Outcomes
By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to:
- Identify and reduce muscle tension
- Move with more lightness and freedom
- Improve your posture
- Describe some basic anatomy
- Have tools to use at home and at work

Bring two blankets (or a mat and a blanket) and wear loose, warm and comfortable clothing. Tea and coffee provided but bring your lunch.

Please note that instructions are given verbally rather than by demonstration, so good hearing and understanding of English is required.

1 Day
Presented by Sue Field.

description:
Reigniting the spark, Kia Ora lovely teachers!! We're back with a FREE PD Workshop with the talented Kimberley Crisp talking about REIGNITING THE SPARK.
This free PD workshop is free for all ECE teachers, regardless of whether you are a Jitbug reliever or not. This event is our way of giving back to the ECE community
Kimberley has a HeArT for reigniting the spark and supporting teachers to see the light within. Stress is the fastest way to extinguish the "flame".
Being a teacher is not for the faint hearted, its for the FULL hearted.
We are giving from ourselves all day and we are in output mode.
Lets come together and have some nourishing connection - and cross polinate.
As relievers you have a potent position to literally breathe life into teams, sprinkle your spark and cross polinate with so many teams.
Come and hear Kimberley's poignant pondering around the power of the present and prepared teacher. Let's connect... recharge... reignite the flame and create a fire that burns from within.

description:

Our workshops carefully combine yoga, mantra, breath, and creative expression to offer tools you can take into your own life and practice. Guided by experienced, mature facilitators, each session is thoughtfully crafted to engage all your senses, nurturing the body, mind, and spirit. Suitable for all levels, the experience is holistic, embodied, and gently transformative. Take a journey, slow down, and allow time and space for insight, creativity, and connection.
This workshop is a women-only space, led by women who know the cost of giving more than you receive.
In this self-empowering process, you will be supported to let go as much as you can, so you have a sense of spaciousness and can then bring in what it is you are currently seeking.

description:
Return to Love - Healing the Divine Masculine & Feminine (Group Shamanic Journeying), Return to Love - Healing the Divine Masculine & Feminine (Group Shamanic Journeying)
✨Return to Love – A Shamanic Journey of Healing the Divine Masculine & Feminine

Relationships are some of our greatest teachers. Whether you are single or partnered, whether your past experiences were harmonious or painful, each relationship reflects the inner dance of the masculine and feminine within us.

Throughout history, these sacred energies—Yin and Yang—were meant to complement and support each other. Yet, distortions, suppression, and separation have created wounds that echo through generations. Many of us carry beliefs such as:

Men cannot be trusted.
Women are not safe.
Love must be earned.
......

Rarely do we pause to sit with these wounds and meet the unhealed parts of our inner feminine and masculine. These energies may hold not only personal pain but also ancestral imprints passed down through time—shaping the way we experience love and connection today.

🌿 In this mini workshop, you will be guided through a shamanic journey to explore and heal your inner archetypes. Together, we will:

✨ Release old wounds and limiting patterns carried by the inner feminine or masculine.
✨ Make peace with the shadow side of our psyche.
✨ Embody the wholeness of the Divine Masculine and Feminine within.

We will close our circle with a sacred forgiveness ritual, bridging the separation and returning to a state of balance, wholeness, and love.

This journey is open to everyone—whether you are new to shamanic work or have walked this path before. All that is required is an open heart and willingness to connect deeply within.

🌸 You’ll leave with:

A renewed sense of love and harmony within yourself.
Greater balance between your inner masculine and feminine.
A deeper connection to spirit, self, and the essence of oneness.

Event Details
📅 Sunday, September 21st
🕒 3:00–6:00 pm
📍 Lotus Yoga Centre – Sanctuary, Paraparaumu
💫 Energy Exchange: $55 per person
🌿 Limited to 12 participants

✨What to bring:
A water bottle, journal, cushion or blanket for comfort.

🚗 Rides from Wellington may be arranged—please contact me if needed.Contact: 0272541272

About Your Guide - Fery Qiu

I am a Shamanic Healer who is committed to the healing path that help people heal from the core of their being. From suicidal depression to shamanic path, my spirituality is not based on how many trainings, meditations, and ceremonies I have done, it’s coming from a deep embodied experience to transform pain into wisdom and empowerment. The shamanic path is a way of being; we allow ourselves to go deeper within to connect all things that come from oneness. I loved my work, which has been proven to help people really change their lives. If you are curious about what this mini workshop could bring, having an open mind and open heart, you will be surprised by how much can be done just in this brief journey within.



With love,
Fery Qiu

description:
SOMATIC Boot Camp with Miri Naad, Get unstuck, release, move, breathe, sweat, dance and shake … FEEL ALIVE AGAIN! We are going deeper starting this EQUINOX. Join my 4 Sundays Somatic Boot Camp!
This particular SOMATIC YOGA program is to assist you in getting unstuck, opening your energetic potential and learn real grounded foundational tools to help you stay Human ;) 
These sessions are designed to work deeply and subtly in decluttering stagnant energy in your nervous system due to adrenal response to life stressors, control programs, and repressed life force. 
Decompress the Vagus Nerve, release trauma (any adaptive response to change, stresses the nervous system) deprogram the PSOA, access your inner fire, creative expression, voice, and power, through holistic movements, breath work, and bioenergetic movement.
 4 Sunday weekly group sessions 1.5 hrs -  Starting Sunday 21st of  September 2025  for 4 Sundays  at 4:30pm-6pm 
Venue Ridgway School, Mornington rd, Brooklyn. 
Price is for x4 sessions at $120  and $80 unwaged /student. 
you can also bring cash on the day but commit to all sessions please. 
We will work together in an unstructured, un-linear way, yet utilizing classic temple practices which include kundalini yoga postures and breath, rebirthing breath technology, mantra, EFT (tapping) TRE (trauma/tension release), and *Divadassi temple holistic dance flow. 
Unlocking inner body technology through breath, trembling, movement, and subtle holistic dance and mudras (activation or access codes within our body organic technology) 
This is a very intuitive and holistic approach, tailored specifically to what your body is asking and needing, initiation or strengthening your relationship with your body at all levels, physical, emotional, mental, and energetic self.

description:
She Rises: Spring Edition, When was the last time you truly paused?
Not just for a moment between tasks, but long enough to breathe and focus on your own wellbeing?

On the eve of Spring, join us for an afternoon, designed to nourish your soul, rejuvenate your energy and awaken the inspiration you need for the season ahead.
As a business owner, Leadership Coach and active mum of four, Sina Mikaio knows the importance of taking the time to escape the hustle and reset each season. That’s why she created She Rises - Spring Edition. An opportunity for you to step away from the noise, let go of the schedules and reconnect with your own inner wisdom.

Who Is This Workshop For?
This intimate gathering is for the women who:
Feels like she is holding it all—career, family and relationships—and is yearning for a space to finally let go.
Knows she wants more from life, but is seeking clarity on what that is and how to get there.
Is ready to release the stories of self doubt and exhaustion that have been holding her back.
Craves connection not only with herself, but with a circle of like-minded women who just "get it."

What To Expect: Your Journey
Your journey through this immersive afternoon will be woven through three powerful pillars:
Movement: Beginning with a nourishing yoga flow designed to release stored energy from the body, clear your mind and open your channels to receive your own guidance. (All levels welcome).
Mindset: A deep dive into your personal energy. You will learn how it impacts your presence, identify where you are leaking energy, release what no longer serves you and get crystal clear on what you want to call in.
Manifestation: A powerful guided visualisation to connect you with your deepest intuition. This practice will help bring your ideas forth, give you clarity on your next steps and provide you with the tools to build a purposeful pathway towards your goals.

You Will Leave With:
Clarity on your path for the season ahead
Unshakeable Confidence in your own wisdom, intelligence and power
The Courage to take aligned action towards a life you truly love
Actionable tools to regulate your nervous system and manage your energy daily.
A profound sense of feeling grounded, inspired and aligned within yourself.

Tickets available to purchase via eventbrite link below:

https://www.eventbrite.co.nz/e/she-rises-spring-edition-tickets-1550395166679?aff=oddtdtcreator
label: Health & Wellness

What is this event?
Rotate through each 20–30 min session (with 5-min breaks between):
1. Mindset & Visualization – Mental prep and visualization with Jordan
2. Injury Prevention - Progressive load and how to avoid injury with Devin Glover
3. Fuel your body right - Talking fueling and supplements thanks to Scorpion Supplements with Rebekah Glover and Liz Monrad
BBQ will be running on the night so be sure to bring your loose coins!!
Proceeds from this event go towards helping the Rocking Robins top team get to national in October!!
Meet your hosts:
Jordan Shearer: Coach. Trainer. Space-holder for rebels, dreamers, and high end performers.
Jordan is the founder of Being You, a coaching practice grounded in authenticity, connection, courage, simplicity, and going rogue. She blends her background in mental health, life coaching, and human behavior with no-fluff, deeply human approach to performance. Having competed herself, Jordan understands the pressure that comes with stepping out, showing up, and giving your best when it counts. Jordan has coached competitive gymnasts, doctors, dancers, and first responders (to name a few) - people who need to stay mentally strong in high-performance spaces.
Devin Glover: Owner and Founder of The Fitness Portal Limited. Devin has been a personal trainer for 10+ years, and has competed either Nationally or Internationally in the following sports: Underwater Hockey, Olympic Weightlifting, Rock N Roll Dancing, CrossFit, Swimming and has dabbled in endurance sports like Ironman and Road cycling.
Rebekah Glover: Rebekah has gone through a huge lifestyle transformation. After losing over 30kgs and keeping it off, she became a Weight Watchers coach, then she started personal training in 2021. Rebekah has learnt through trial and error, about how important it is to fuel correctly to achieve your goals and that it isn't always about weight loss. If you you want to perform you need to fuel correctly. She is now an avid runner and competes Nationally in Rock n Roll Dancing, after only three years of dancing she holds one national title, and two regional titles.

description:
Royal NZ Ballet Presents The Nutcracker, Summer 2025 will be celebrated with an eagerly anticipated new production of the world’s most beloved ballet classic, The Nutcracker. Central to Christmas memories for generations of audiences, The Nutcracker is a timeless celebration of family, fantasy and growing up, where ‘home for Christmas’ is the most powerful magic of all.

A uniquely Kiwi touch transports our audiences to the nostalgia of childhood holidays at the beach in Act I, before being carried in Act II to the snowy Southern Alps, where we encounter a fairytale Kingdom of the Sweets – some of which may look quite familiar…

This new production will be created by RNZB Artistic Director Ty King-Wall, with set and costume designs by Tracy Grant Lord (A Midsummer Night’s Dream, The Firebird), lighting design by Jon Buswell (Swan Lake, The Firebird, Hansel & Gretel) and visual effects by POW Studios (Cinderella, Hansel & Gretel), all driven by the timeless magic of Tchaikovsky’s wonderful music.

Live orchestra, conducted by Hamish McKeich, will accompany performances in Wellington, Christchurch and Auckland.

Pre Performance Talk Friday 31st October 6:30-7:00pm
Post Matinee Q&A Saturday 8th November 1:30pm
Audio Described Performance Saturday 8th November 1:30pm
Warm Up Curtain Up Saturday 8th November

Love. Laughter. Gin. This is Valentine’s Day — the GinFlatables way.

Digital experiences that truly matter, Note: This is a Hybrid Event:

About this event:
About this event:

This highly interactive session will have engaging discussions that will uncover practical insights into creating user – focused, unified digital services that genuinely enhance customer experiences. We will discuss the complexities of web design and development, exploring them from a project delivery perspective, with a focus on building effective and impactful digital solutions.
About the Presenter:
About the Presenters:
 Pikselin: Pikselin is a New Zealand based consultancy and solution provider in the digital engagement and application development space. As a digital agency, they create user-focused digital experiences that are both functional and visually engaging. Pikselin delivers responsive websites, intuitive interfaces, and inclusive digital services for clients across government and private sector. Their expertise lies in simplifying complex information through thoughtful, user – centred design. As an approved supplier on New Zealand’s Government Marketplace, they have led key projects for a range of clients across the public and enterprise sectors. Pikselin is known for its collaborative approach and commitment to elevating digital experiences that truly serve New Zealanders. 

Steve Barnard Managing Director Steve leads client and partner collaborations at Pikselin, overseeing projects from marketing to post-development support with over 30 years of experience in New Zealand's IT industry.

James Guthrie Tech Lead James transforms complex design requirements into maintainable accessible code specializing in real-time data visualization interactive mapping, and fully accessible cross device websites.

Brian Smith Design Director Brian leads Pikselin's creative vision collaborating with clients and the creative team to deliver exceptional products and services.

Botanical Oddities - Guided Walk, In this one-hour walk will we will see a plant that can’t decide whether it’s a lily or an asparagus, tree trunks that are not really tree trunks, plants that photosynthesise only at night, and a deadly poisonous plant that yields potent cancer-fighting drugs. And discover more on this relaxing downhill amble.

Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

description:
The Healthy Hospo Stress Reset: Sauna • Ice Bath • Breathwork • Community - Auckland, Healthy Hospo and Hospitality New Zealand are excited to invite you to…
The Hospo Stress Reset: Sauna • Ice Bath • Breathwork • Community
We’re all told that stress is bad. Chronic stress can lead to burnout and serious health issues. But what if stress itself isn’t the enemy? What if learning how to work with stress could actually make it a powerful tool for resilience, energy, and performance?
With hospitality gearing up for peak season, this is your chance to reset, recharge, and equip yourself with the tools to stay calm and in control when things get busy.
Join Healthy Hospo and Hospitality New Zealand for a unique experiential workshop designed just for hospo. Across this 2-hour session, you’ll experience:
·       Interactive Breathwork, led by our resident Breathwork & Physiology expert, Josh Fankhauser, to help you manage stress and shift your state on demand.
·       Hot/Cold Contrast Therapy, a guided community sauna and ice bath experience with Sauna Collective, to boost recovery, improve focus, and leave you feeling re-energised.
·       Practical Tools for Everyday Life. Strategies you can take back to your workplace (and your own wellbeing) to help you thrive through peak season.

 Times: Three sessions to choose from, each capped at 16 people so spaces will go fast!
·       9:00 – 10:45am
·       11:00 – 12:45pm
·       1:15 – 3:00pm
What to Bring
·       Swim suit
·       2 x Towels (one for sauna, one for shower)
·       Change of clothes
·       Notebook & pen
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $50 per person is fully sponsored.
Spaces are limited and as all spaces are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Tap for Healing Trauma & the Nervous system, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Tap for Healing Trauma & the Nervous system
Our nervous system is shaped by more than just big life events — hidden wounds and micro-traumas from childhood can leave lasting imprints that show up as stress, anxiety, and repeating relationship patterns. When triggered, these unconscious “programs” hijack our reactions, leaving us feeling stuck even when we want to move forward. In this workshop, we’ll explore how trauma influences the nervous system and why awareness alone isn’t enough to create lasting change.
In this 75 minute workshop, you’ll discover how trauma impacts the nervous system and learn FasterEFT tools to release triggers, reframe old memories, and reset your stress response. You’ll walk away with simple, science-backed practices you can use every day to build resilience and emotional freedom.
“This is an interactive workshop where you’ll connect with others. It’s a powerful reminder that, beneath the surface, we generally share the same challenges and struggles—and that healing becomes easier when we explore them together.”
Meet your host, Krishnaloka
Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.


6.15pm Tuesday 7th of October
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz
label: Health & Wellness

description:
The Check-in Men's Group Tuesday 23 Sept, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

description:
The Mind, Body, & Climate Change-FREE EVENT AT VIC, The Mind, Body, & Climate Change-FREE EVENT AT VIC
The Mind, Body, & Climate Change

Explore how young minds can drive change by understanding the links between climate change, well-being, and action.

Free kai. Big ideas. Good vibes.

Ready to connect the dots between your own well-being and the planet’s future? We’re talking real talk, fresh perspectives, and a whole lot of inspiration — without the boring lecture vibe.

Devamrita Swami — world-travelling monk, renowned strategist, social observer, and all-round thought-provoker — is back at Vic Uni for the third time. He’s spoken at universities all over the globe, and now he’s here to flip the way you see climate action and mental health.

And yes… free plant-based dinner is on us:

🌮 Loaded nachos (salsa, taco ‘meat’, sour ‘cream’ & ‘cheese’)
🥤 Strawberry & peanut butter milkshakes
🍩 Caramel & chocolate doughnut


Come for the food, stay for the conversation. Connect with good humans, share some laughs, and leave with fresh ideas you’ll actually want to act on.

When: Tues 16 Sept, 5:45 pm

Where: Vic Uni, Kelburn Parade — MacLaurin Building MCLT103 (up the steps from the Hub). We’ll have people outside pointing you in the right direction. Lost? Text us: +64 20 4191 5046

Click ‘Get Tickets’ to save your seat (and your doughnut).
👉🏽👉🏽 https://tr.ee/TheMindBodyClimateChange 👈🏿👈🏿

Hosted by yoga lounge club.

description:
The Morning Shift - IS THAT US?! World Tour (sort of...) | Wellington, After humble beginnings in a garage, to a record-breaking rise to the top of the podcast charts, Aotearoa’s favourite trio — Jordan Vaha'akolo, Brook Ruscoe, and Marc Peard — are taking The Morning Shift to the people. This August and September, they’ll be bringing eight massive shows across Aotearoa and Australia in their first-ever LIVE tour.
Real people, real talk and now real life. Expect all the stuff you love from the podcast: deep kōrero, big laughs, a few tears, spontaneous/questionable singing, plus whatever Jordan decides to overshare that night. The live show brings the podcast to life, with that signature Morning Shift energy that turns commutes into therapy sessions and takes gym workouts to another level.
Tickets go on sale Friday 4 July at Midday NZST.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Pastor From Gaza, St John’s is collaborating with Central Baptist to host this Pastor from Gaza, as he shares about being the Church amidst conflict.
Born and raised in Gaza, he now ministers across the Gaza and Middle East, providing pastoral support and practical aid to persecuted Christians, refugees, orphans, and widows.
This tour is not political—it is about the Body of Christ. The Pastor will share his own testimony, speak to the ongoing challenges faced by Christians in Gaza, and highlight his wider ministry in the Middle East. It is a message of hope, forgiveness, and perseverance—one that will challenge the Church in Aotearoa.
This event is to raise awareness of the spiritual and practical needs of believers in Gaza and the Middle East, as well as invite us to give in support of his ministry, with funds going directly to help persecuted Christians with food, shelter, and outreach.
label: Religion & Spirituality

Running Into The Sun, Running Into The Sun
After exploding onto the Australian scene, a2 Company bring their euphoric hour of award-winning physical theatre home to Pōneke

About this Event

After winning Best Theatre at the Melbourne Fringe, Running into the Sun comes home to Pōneke for the first time. The 10 creatives in a2 Company create an “exhausting but exhilarating” story of what it means to be alive right now with live music, dance, and theatre.
It’s graduation night. Ash and Mary discover they are pregnant. A flash flood hits their hometown. The war crimes overseas become more horrifying.
Running into the Sun is “messy, joyous, heartfelt and completely off the chain.”

description:
Wairarapa Agritourism - November networking evening, Join us for another Agritourism networking event !

Wairarapa Agritourism – Exploring our opportunities
November networking evening.
This event is part of our agritourism network series, and is for anyone interested in agritourism within the Wairarapa and surrounding regions. This is a great opportunity to connect with like-minded people and become part of the local agritourism community.
We have two fabulous guest speakers at our November event, who will share their agritourism journeys and thoughts on the future.
Sonia Minnaar
Sonia Minnaar is co-founder of Canopy Camping Escapes. Canopy Camping Escapes partners with glamping hosts across New Zealand. Sonia will talk to us about the foundation and growth of Canopy Camping - how they started, what they do and how they work. We are excited to have Sonia Minnaar joining us for this event!
Their unique collection of hosted accommodation ranges from luxury safari tents to quirky off-grid cabins and modern luxe retreats – all immersed in nature and designed to help guests unplug and reconnect.
Sonia will share her insights around:
Industry trends and industry forecasts
Canopy Camping Guests (repeat/international) and Occupancy
Discussion around what make escapes successful
https://canopycamping.co.nz/
Tim Priest - Moonlight Peak
Tim & Summer Priest have owned the property near Carterton since February 2016. Tim is an Agri-Banker for Rabobank and a farmer. Summer manages Moonlight Peak accommodation, while also being a stay-at-home mum and a farmer.
For them, they love that the property is nestled just on the edge of the Tararua Ranges and overlooks the beautiful Wairarapa - from Mount Bruce all the way to the Cook Strait. It's the type of place where you feel like you're on top of the world, described as "somewhere between heaven and earth"!
The idea to set up glamping on their property came about when they came across Canopy Camping Escapes - and were inspired to set up their own retreat. Watching the moon and sunrise from the east above the Wairarapa is magical...and it's a delight for Summer and Tim to share it with their guests.
https://canopycamping.co.nz/moonlight-peak
Run of event:
6:30pm - arrival, drinks, nibbles and networking
6:45pm - talks start
8:00pm - talks finish, networking
8:30pm - Evening close
All welcome, see you there!
We will be hosted at Urla's Cellar Door, 140 Dakins Road, Gladstone. Urla will have drinks for you to purchase, with a selection of nibbles as a part of your ticket. Urla is a beautiful setting, you are welcome to come early to taste the wines and soak up this amazing venue.
https://urlar.co.nz/pages/cellar-door

description:
The Overthinking Mind - Tap to break free from mental loops, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind - Tap to break free from mental loops
This workshop explores why our thoughts get stuck in loops of worry, doubt, and replay. Drawing on the insights of Carl Jung, we’ll uncover how the unconscious mind, shadow, and how unresolved inner conflicts fuel over-thinking. You’ll also learn how the body and nervous system become conditioned to repeat these mental patterns, creating the familiar cycle of racing thoughts and restless emotions.
Through a guided exercise, you’ll experience practical tools from FasterEFT and the science of neuroplasticity—methods that help rewire the brain and bring the mind back to calm clarity.
By the end of the workshop, you’ll not only understand the deeper roots of over-thinking, but you’ll also walk away with simple, repeatable techniques to interrupt mental loops, ease the nervous system, and create a lasting sense of inner peace.
“This is an interactive workshop where you’ll connect with others and see that many of us face the same challenges beneath the surface—making growth and healing easier when we explore them together
“This is an interactive workshop that offers the chance to connect with others on a similar journey. It’s powerful to know, that beneath the surface, we often share the same challenges and struggles—and that healing becomes easier when we explore them together.”
Meet your host, Krishnaloka
Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.
6.15pm Tuesday 2nd September
