description:
The Overthinking Mind – Making Friends with our Mind, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind- Making friends with our mind
What mood is our mind in today? What does it refuse to do that we want it do, and what does it do that we don’t want it to do? Is there any solution to the unruly nature of the mind? Thankfully yoga wisdom deals head on with the mind - how to manage it, and how to satisfy it and make it peaceful.


Meet your host, Khadiravan
Khadiravan is a seasoned bhakti yoga teacher at Bhakti Lounge and you might have heard her angelic singing, which is like therapy for the ears. Kirtan (mantra music meditation) is Khadiravan's love and she enjoys creating a comfortable and meditative space when she hosts our SoundLabs or at soulFeast. Khadiravan also offers her background of a PhD in Yoga Psychology, to whoever wants to lend an ear and an inquisitive mind to exploring life through the lens of yoga wisdom
6.15pm Tuesday 23rd of September
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

The Overthinking Mind – Making Friends with our Mind, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind- Making friends with our mind
What mood is our mind in today? What does it refuse to do that we want it do, and what does it do that we don’t want it to do? Is there any solution to the unruly nature of the mind? Thankfully yoga wisdom deals head on with the mind - how to manage it, and how to satisfy it and make it peaceful.


Meet your host, Khadiravan
Khadiravan is a seasoned bhakti yoga teacher at Bhakti Lounge and you might have heard her angelic singing, which is like therapy for the ears. Kirtan (mantra music meditation) is Khadiravan's love and she enjoys creating a comfortable and meditative space when she hosts our SoundLabs or at soulFeast. Khadiravan also offers her background of a PhD in Yoga Psychology, to whoever wants to lend an ear and an inquisitive mind to exploring life through the lens of yoga wisdom
6.15pm Tuesday 23rd of September
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

𝗘𝗧𝗛𝗘𝗥 – 𝗧𝗲𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
A Breath, Sound & Silence Journey ✨🌌🌬

Held by the Heavens | Bathed in Stillness | Anchored in Cosmic Light

𝗝𝗢𝗨𝗥𝗡𝗘𝗬 𝗕𝗘𝗬𝗢𝗡𝗗 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗩𝗘𝗜𝗟 — 𝗪𝗛𝗘𝗥𝗘 𝗦𝗢𝗨𝗟 𝗠𝗘𝗘𝗧𝗦 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗥𝗗𝗨𝗦𝗧 🌌🪐✨️🏕🌠

Nestled within a sacred Sanctuary under the starlit skies of Paraparaumu, you are invited to enter the realm of Ether — the invisible thread that weaves all of life. Here, the boundaries between body, breath, and spirit begin to dissolve into the spaciousness of the cosmos.

Cradled by silence, expanded through breath, and elevated by sound, this ceremony is a subtle, sacred transmission — a remembrance of your soul’s celestial origin.

This soulscape will guide you through:

• Gentle Breathwork to still the body and awaken presence
• Blue Lotus Ritual to open the heart and third eye
• Crystal Singing Bowls & Celestial Light Language
• Shamanic Gong encoded with Star Frequencies
• Intuitive Energy Transmissions
• Integration through Sacred Stillness

𝗕𝗟𝗨𝗘 𝗟𝗢𝗧𝗨𝗦 𝗥𝗜𝗧𝗨𝗔𝗟

Blue Lotus, known as the Flower of the Heavens, has been revered in ancient Egyptian and Eastern traditions as a plant of intuition, divination, and deep heart awakening. As you connect with the energy of Blue Lotus you are invited to soften your edges and expand your awareness into dream-like states — where insight, creativity, and emotional release naturally unfold. She is the guardian of the liminal realms, ushering you gently into etheric remembrance.

𝗕𝗘𝗡𝗘𝗙𝗜𝗧𝗦 𝗢𝗙 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗝𝗢𝗨𝗥𝗡𝗘𝗬:
• Deep Nervous System Regulation
• Heightened Intuition & Expanded Consciousness
• Enhanced Sleep & Dream States
• Emotional Release without Over-Processing
• Alignment with Soul & Cosmic Frequencies
• Gentle Detoxification & Energetic Clearing
• Cellular Recalibration & Vibrational Healing
• Connection to Divine Feminine & Cosmic Womb
• Inner Peace, Stillness & Mental Clarity

𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗦𝗔𝗖𝗥𝗘𝗗 𝗦𝗔𝗡𝗖𝗧𝗨𝗔𝗥𝗬
Nestled in the hills beside the Lotus Yoga Centre rests a sacred Meditation Sanctuary
a place where many come to reconnect, find inner stillness, and bathe in peace.

Built in 1999, this Sanctuary serves as the spiritual heart of the Centre’s activities.
The location itself was chosen with great care, resting at the meeting point of powerful ley lines, its energy deeply aligned with Kapiti Island and the Maungakotukutuku ranges to the east.

The octagon-shaped structure is crafted from natural timbers, crowned with a glass pyramid roof that amplifies and channels healing energies. Around its frame, tinted windows radiate the seven colours of the rainbow—each one carrying a unique healing ray. On a bright day, the play of colours is nothing short of spectacular, filling the space with a living rainbow of light.

𝙒𝙃𝘼𝙏 𝙏𝙊 𝙀𝙓𝙋𝙀𝘾𝙏:
• Doors open at 3.00PM for grounding & Blue Lotus
• Ceremony opens with breath & intention-setting
• 60-minute sound and silence journey in the sacred SANCTUARY.
• Integration circle to gently return and reflect
• Closing around 5:30PM

Your only task is to arrive with presence and openness, ready to receive what is already waiting within you.

𝙒𝙃𝘼𝙏 𝙏𝙊 𝘽𝙍𝙄𝙉𝙂:
• Yoga mat or cushioning
• Blanket & pillow for comfort
• Eye mask
• Water bottle
• Any sacred objects (crystals, journal, totems) that support your journey

description:
Unlock Secrets of Natures Wisdom, Unlock Secrets of Natures Wisdom
Rose McKenzie & Nicole McKinnon - open your world of wellness!

First Light Flower Essences of New Zealand® - Unlock the Secrets of Nature’s Sacred Wisdom with Rose McKenzie

Have you ever wondered what a flower essence truly is? Or how it can support profound transformation at every level of your being?

Join us for an illuminating introduction to First Light Flower Essences of New Zealand®, revered as Sacred Plant Medicines for the soul. More than just remedies, these vibrational essences are potent allies in the journey toward holistic healing and self-realisation.

In this special session, we’ll delve into Nature’s Healing Matrix©, a powerful framework that reveals how these essences work in harmony with the natural world to support balance, healing, and inner evolution.

Discover how these sacred tools can help you to:
🌿 Transform emotional imbalances, outdated mindsets, and deep-seated conditioning
🌿 Clear trauma held in the energy field and cellular memory
🌿 Energise, protect, and harmonise the chakra system
🌿 Release fear, limiting beliefs, and inherited patterns stored in your DNA
🌿 Support your soul’s purpose and evolutionary path

Whether you’re new to vibrational medicine or ready to deepen your journey, this experience offers a beautiful gateway into the healing intelligence of the plant kingdom.

Come with curiosity—leave with insight, inspiration, and a deeper connection to the sacred rhythms of nature.

Each guest will receive a complimentary bottle of an acute flower essence formula.
My talk will be supported by a powerpoint presentation Email

Second part of the evening ✨

Holistic Beauty Therapist & Founder of Phorest Inspired Skincare with Nicole McKinnon

Nicole is a holistic beauty therapist with over 30 years of experience, based in her peaceful home salon in Paremata. With a deep belief in the power of intuitive, supportive skincare, she helps women reconnect with themselves and their skin as they age—focusing not on “fixing” wrinkles, but on nurturing vitality, health, and self-confidence.

Alongside her hands-on expertise, Nicole has completed post-graduate studies in cosmetic chemistry and product development, allowing her to blend science with soul in her practice. Her Phorest Inspired Skincare approach is centered in daily grounding rituals and moments of pause—encouraging women to take time for themselves and honour the natural changes in their skin.

In her upcoming talk, Nicole shares how simple, intentional skincare can become a powerful act of self-care and renewal.

Booking Cost: $30 per person

https://www.artandlivingspace.nz/bookings

For further information contact: Nancy 027 276 2786

description:
The Rhythm of Wellbeing ~ Simple Ayurvedic Rituals to Support Your Day, The Rhythm of Wellbeing ~ Simple Ayurvedic Rituals to Support Your Day
We’re super excited to be collaborating with the lovely Radha Iveta from Heart Awakening. Plus - there will be an amazing plant based dinner included in your ticket!
This will be insightful, down-to-earth and inspiring.
It’s the art of aligning with the natural rhythms. And see how your wellness takes shape with just a few simple adjustments. It’s the small things that compound to develop your wellbeing!
This workshop is an introduction to Dinacharya, the Ayurvedic practice of daily self-care routines that harmonise mind, body, and spirit.
In the workshop, we will cover:
Understanding Dinacharya: What it is and its importance in Ayurveda.
Morning Routine: Simple, effective practices to start your day with balance.
Evening Routine: Techniques to wind down and promote restful sleep.
Eating & Digestion: Ayurvedic recommendations for meal timing and digestion.
Self-Care Practices: How to incorporate oil pulling, tongue scraping, and more into your day.
Seasonal Adjustments: How to tweak your routine according to the seasons.


Meet Radha, your host
Radha Iveta is a meditation and yoga practitioner, certified teacher, Ayurveda practitioner and therapist, cacao lover, and the founder of Heart Awakening and True Nature Ayurveda. Her work was born out of a profound love for these teachings and her desire to invite others on a journey toward more meaning and fulfilment, guided by the direct experience and knowledge that Love is our true nature.
Her heart is invested in helping people reconnect to their hearts and reveal their true nature by bringing sacredness and simplicity into all aspects of life.

description:
Poetry Slam: Regional Heat #1, This PIM event is a Poetry Slam! The first of three regional heats leading to the regional finals at the National Library on October 11th.
This Poetry In Motion Slam is the first heat for the 2025 Wellington Poetry Slam Champs. The top three scoring poets from this event will gain a spot in the regional finals!
Poets who want to sign up for the slam, please drop an email to:
travis.cottreau@gmail.com
subject: slam heat #1
What is a slam?
A Poetry Slam is a competitive poetry event where poets compete for points. Five random audience members are tasked with being the judges and they score each poem out of 10 to one decimal place.
The number of poets involved and number of rounds can change event-to-event, but there are some universal rules – no props, no costumes, poems must be three minutes or less, poets must read original work, and no punching down or hate speech.
Price on the door is $5
The top four poets from each heat will go through to the Wellington Poetry Slam Champs at the National Library of New Zealand on October 11th.
Other heats:
Sunday the 21st Sept
Thursday the 2nd October
Finals: Saturday, 11th October.

Bringing together hundreds of consumers, whānau and health providers, this event is not to be missed.

On the day we will:

- Highlight best practice and the Consumer Code of Expectations.

Registration info will be released soon, for now: please save 30 October in your calendar!

1/2 Price Winter Wednesdays at Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo!, Wrap up warm and enjoy a mid-winter treat with Winter Wednesdays at Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo! Visit the Zoo any Wednesday in August and get 1/2 price standard adult and child entry. You can purchase a ticket at the Zoo or pre-book online for any Wednesday in August and go in the draw to win a Tiger Close Encounter for two!
Come to our winter animal talks to learn how animals adapt over the colder months, and how we help to keep them warm. Many of the animals at the Zoo love the winter season, including Snow Leopard, the Red Pandas, and the Kororā - Little Blue Penguins. You are even more likely to spot these amazing animals during this time, so rug up and explore Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo this winter.
Head to our website for more details!
https://wellingtonzoo.com/winter-wednesdays

description:
AGM - Annual General Meeting, This is to formally advise all members of the upcoming Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the Kapiti Softball Club.
Details of the AGM are as follows:
Date: Sunday 24 August
Time: 4.00pm
Venue: Te-Atiawa park, Clubrooms
In line with our Club’s constitution, this notice is being provided at least three weeks in advance of the meeting. A formal agenda, the Annual Report, and Financial Statements will be available on the day, and will be made available on our website after the AGM.
If you wish to submit any remits or notices of motion, these must be received in writing by the Secretary no later than Sunday 17 August 2025.You can send these to info@kapitisoftball.co.nz
Committee Vacancies
This year, several current committee members have indicated they will not be standing again. While all roles are open to nominations and elected at the AGM, we especially want to highlight the following upcoming vacancies:
• Treasurer
• Club Captain
• Junior Convenor
This is a big change for our club, and we encourage any members who are interested in helping shape the future of our club to consider putting their name forward. If you'd like to learn more about what's involved in any of the roles, feel free to reach out for a chat.
Quorum Reminder: As per our constitution, at least 10 members must be present for the AGM to proceed, so we would greatly appreciate your attendance and support.

description:
5 And Still Live ! - The Fifth Anniversary of Mouthfull Radio, Five years ago we were in the midst of a global pandemic, visiting digital rooms with friends around the corner, making sourdough, and sort of watching the daily news. We were also making experimental attempts into the world of radio, with the birth of Mouthfull’s first international streaming server, playing music 24/7 (also live events a few times a week).
If we travel even further back in time, 2017 was the debut of the “Mouthfull Radio” episodic series (~20eps) - but we consider the ongoingness the real thing to celebrate.
Moving towards present day ~ through a vast richness of hosts, events, music, shows, zines, selectors, connections, pop ups, and story-times. It is a real joy to help community contemporary radio ripple out from this Pacific Island nation to the world wide web.

5 Years goes so fast, and so we shall honour this time with a great celebration in the capital city of Aotearoa! We will bring together all of the elements of Mouthfull you have known to love; make some books, make up some new dance moves with friends, and make our ears glisten in the sounds of live and selected music.
Whiro // New Moon. The last dark night of winter. A time for reflection; an invitation to come together as friends and whānau and plant intentional seeds for future flowers to bloom, as well as rest in deep listening and shared beingness.

Lineup:
*ºJuniper May
*ºStar Time
*ºajhoneysuckle (tāmaki)
*ºMystery Waitress (duo)
*ºDJ B.Lo (whākatu)
*°Benny Salvador


We are also releasing our first ever compilation. This special event will be opened with a premiere listening session of the full CD, playing the album all the way through. You can purchase a physical copy at the show, or on bandcamp (preorders open September 1st).
5PM sharp CD push play. Some divine collaborators with unique new releases on offer.

This is a fundraiser to support the sustainability of Mouthfull. We are only able to pay the bills due to events like this, and are fundraising to support a long awaited update of our digital infrastructure to enable future support. THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT - you can support us by purchasing a ticket (extra donation if you are balling), a tshirt, a raffle ticket, or a zine - it all goes to the same goal of enabling & uplifting one another.

description:
Rā Tūwhera ki Ōtari | Ōtari Open Day, Rā Tūwhera ki Ōtari | Ōtari Open Day
Once a year, we throw open the gates and invite you behind the scenes at Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush. It’s your chance to explore the only public botanic garden in Aotearoa dedicated solely to native plants. Discover the people, plants, and projects that make it special.

Meet our team, chat with partner organisations, join an activity, and find out how we’re working together to protect and restore our natural environment. Whether you’ve never been to Ōtari before or it’s been a while, come along, get curious, and reconnect with nature!

On the day:

10 am-2 pm: Tū Mātau Ora – Taonga Tākaro (Traditional Māori games) on the lawn

10 am-2 pm: Conservation community partner stalls

10 am-2 pm: Plant sale – native plants grown right here in the Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush Trust Nursery

10:30 am, 11:30 am, 12:30 pm, 1:30 pm: Behind-the-scenes tours with Ōtari staff (sign up on the day)

10 am -12:30 pm: Rongoā pani (balm) making workshop – learn about traditional Māori plant uses and make a balm to take home. Tickets $10 which goes directly to the Ōtari-Wilton's Bush Trust. Available soon!

10:30 am, 11:45 am, 12:30 pm, 1:30 pm: Author talks – Ruth Paul, Phil Sirvid, Leon Perrie, and Michael Szabo discuss their recent books

11 am: Lions Ōtari Plant Conservation Laboratory staff show and tell – see our orchid conservation work up close

11 am & 1 pm: String Bean Puppets – two shows: Once in a Full Moon (Kiwi adventures) and Tree Friends (W**d-busting fun)

1 pm-2 pm: Learn to weave putiputi (flowers) out of Harakeke (flax) with the Ōtari Raranga Weavers. This is a drop in session, but it's best to drop by before 1:30 to give you enough time to create your putiputi.


This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.
label: Conservation & Environment

How Big Should My Entry Be?
This is Armies on Parade, so go big!

Armies on Parade is your opportunity to show off what inspires you in the Warhammer hobby. Your project could be anything from a K*ll Team squad or a Warcry warband to a massive galaxy-conquering battleforce or a realm-shaking army.

For Warhammer Age of Sigmar, Warhammer 40,000, Legions Imperialis, Middle-earth™ Strategy Battle Game, Warhammer: The Old World, and Warhammer: The Horus Heresy, the minimum number of units per entry is two complete units. This can be any combination of unit types, including, but not limited to, a character model and a squad, two tanks, a tank and squad, and more.

For skirmish-style games including Necromunda, K*ll Team, Warcry, Warhammer Underworlds, and Blood Bowl, the minimum entry is one complete warband, K*ll team, gang, Blood Bowl team, or other equivalent.

Jack Hooker - Live Music Wednesdays, Jack Hooker is an acoustic guitarist and electronic musician, known for his immersive electronic music and intricate fingerstyle guitar. His output spans solo guitar, the groups The Shocking and Stunning and Ambient Ousìa, and many international collaborations across Indonesia, the Philippines, Greece and beyond. He will be performing a set of original acoustic guitar works. Expect expansive steel-string soundscapes with intricate fingerpicking, tapping techniques, and open tunings.

As always, entry is free and $15 pizza specials will be available!

description:
Bar Crossing Seminar - Manawatū (Foxton bar), Crossing A Bar? We Can Help
Bar crossings can be one of the trickiest, and riskiest parts of boating in Aotearoa. They change fast, they don’t always play nice, and they’ve caught out even the most experienced skippers. Each year, we see serious incidents and tragedies happening on our bars, so it’s super important to know your stuff before you head out.
That’s where we come in. Join us at Manawatu Marine Boating Club for a free and relaxed seminar. You’ll hear straight from local Coastguard skippers and boating legends who’ll share their real-world tips, local knowledge, and a few stories from the water.

Here’s what we’ll cover (and chat about):

Understanding the local features of your bar
Reading and interpreting the conditions when planning a trip
Getting your boat and your crew bar crossing ready
How to handle your boat while crossing
How to do a bar crossing report (and why it’s worth it)
What to do if things go pear-shaped
It’s interactive – so bring your questions, share your own experiences, and have a yarn with others in the boating community.
Bring your mates too – whether they’re brand new to boating or have been around since the days of paper charts and handheld compasses, there’s something in here that could save a trip… or a life.
 Why it matters:
In 2024, 23% of craft-related drownings happened during bar crossings.
5 lives were lost due to capsizing while crossing a bar.
Older blokes are still the most at-risk – but everyone can make safer choices with the right knowledge (and a lifejacket on).
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
DRY POINT ETCHING with Kirsty White, DRYPOINT ETCHING AND RELIEF PRINTMAKING WITH KIRSTY WHITE
UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY—EVERY MARK TELLS A STORY.
When: 30 August 9.30-3.00
$70 for members, $90 for non members. There is also a materials fee of $10.
Discover Printmaking with Kirsty
From coastal textures to native bush, Kirsty’s art blends design, craft, and nature. With 7+ years exhibiting across NZ, she brings her passion to a hands-on Drypoint Etching & Relief Printmaking Workshop.
Learn to:
• Etch from your own drawings
• Ink & print with an etching press
• Add colour & texture using natural materials
One-day workshop | All levels welcome
Enrol Today: workshopsmanaarts@gmail.com

description:
Book Club: Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, Join us in person to discuss Emiko, a contemporary version of Jane Austen's Emma set in Canada.
(Order your copy through us by 20 March 2026 for delivery at the 23 May meeting or couriered in NZ)
About Emiko:
A busybody foodie avoids questions of her own future as she meddles in the love lives of those around her. Has this matcha-maker met her match?

Self-declared matchmaking GENIUS (a la Beyonce) Emiko Kimori has already found success by helping her aunt find true love, so when the new girl in town becomes her new BFF, it's only natural for Emiko to help set her up for social success with a suitable love match.

Emiko lives with her Ojiichan in a small town on BC's West Coast surrounded by friends and neighbors, including her childhood friend Kenzo Sanada, who wishes she'd spend less time playing matchmaker. But Emiko can so clearly see who belongs together, even when her targets don't know it themselves. She simply has to meddle - for the sake of true love!

As for her own romantic life though . . . who has time for that? Emiko is far too busy with her matchmaking schemes, her brunch recipes, volunteering, her bustling social life, keeping up her grades, eating said brunch recipes and making plans for after graduation. Plans she will absolutely decide on soon. Definitely. Maybe? But when Emiko ends up falling for the last person she expects, she finds herself caught in the tangled web of her own love matches. For the first time, instead of arranging from afar, Emiko has to figure out what it means to be in love herself, and that friendship and romance are more complicated than she ever imagined . . .
About the Author:
Chieri Uegaki is a second generation Japanese-Canadian and award-winning children’s author living and writing on Vancouver Island, in the traditional and unceded territory of the lək̓ʷəŋən speaking peoples, today known as the Esquimalt and Songhees Nations.
She graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of British Columbia’s Creative Writing Department and has written a number of stories for children, including the picture books Suki’s Kimono and Rosie and Buttercup (both illustrated by Stéphane Jorisch); Hana Hashimoto, Sixth Violin (illustrated by Qin Leng); and Ojiichan’s Gift (illustrated by Genevieve Simms).
When not reading or writing, Chieri consumes rom-coms and mysteries in any form, chooses appetizers over dessert most of the time, and tries to stay on top of her collecting problem. She is currently working on a number of projects.
Rachel Pilois (Book Buyer) on this selection:
There have been many retellings of Austen’s novels in the last 200 years. Pride and Prejudice easily wins the prize of Austen’s most adapted novel in both film and literature. In the last 20 years there’s been a noticeable growth in culturally (and gender) diverse takes on Austen’s work, with the most popular retellings being of Indian (i.e Bride and Prejudice) or African-American (i.e. Ibi Zoboi’s Pride) heritage. Sadly, some of her less popular novels (Mansfield Park and Northanger Abbey) have few adaptations in both film and literature, faithful or modern retelling.
With the 2026 theme of the JASNZ being diversity it made sense to choose a slightly less popular novel (only in terms of how many adaptations) and a slightly less common culture used in Austen retellings. Thus I settled on the upcoming YA novel Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, a Japanese-Canadian retelling of Emma.
Emma is a much beloved story and a much beloved character, who’s thoughts, actions and motivations are very recognisable in a modern teenager. Adding in the deep cultural etiquette of Japan as a likeness to the rules of regency society, makes Uegaki’s Emiko a brilliant and well thought out modern retelling of the Emma.
As it publishes on 9 September 2025, we can discover and discuss this new and exciting adaptation for the first time together! 
NB: Ticket numbers are limited to ensure ease of discussion. Afternoon tea is provided
FRIEND: bring a friend, get 10% off! Discount automatically applied
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Book Group: Uncle Tom's Cabin by Harriet Beecher Stowe, Do you keep meaning to read more of the great classics of literature? At Wellington Classic Literature Group we read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. The group has been running for more than a decade and we have a great bunch of regulars as well as readers that come along for particular books or simply when it suits. We meet on the first Tuesday of the month.

Our October book is Harriet Beecher Stowe's 1852 abolitionist novel Uncle Tom's Cabin; or, Life Among the Lowly. The work changed American hearts and minds about slavery.

The influence of Uncle Tom's Cabin was so immense that the story arose that when Abraham Lincoln welcomed Stowe to the White House during the American Civil War he reportedly declared, "So this is the little lady who started this great war."

In the US, it was the best-selling novel of the 19th century and the second best-selling book of all after the Bible.

Project Gutenberg link for those e-reading:
https://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/203

VENUE
We meet in the ‘Games Room’, The Library bar's private area overlooking Courtenay Place. After you enter the bar, head to your right (up the step) and through a smaller space with booths to the large carpeted space beyond.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Wellington Foraging for Wild Edible Weeds Workshop, Join Felicity of Wild Botanica for a wander around the edges of the Innermost Community gardens to learn about commonly found, wild, edible weeds. Build a relationship with a natural world that is overflowing with abundant, wild, edible, nutritious, medicinal plants. Learn their names & get to know them, along with folklore & stories from the past.

By the end of the workshop you will:
- understand the basic principles of foraging, including sustainable harvesting
- feel confident in identifying 10-15 wild edible plants
- know about their nutritional & medicinal benefits
- know about common toxic/dangerous plants to avoid when foraging
- know about the best ways to prepare your foraged greens for maximum nutritional benefit & flavor
- feel empowered to include foraged greens in your everyday diet

Walk away with hands on, practical skills & knowledge that you can use in your own life.

Investment includes hands on wild weed walk & discussion, cup of foraged herbal tea & wildly delicious foraged snack.

To learn more about Felicity and her offerings,
visit @wildbotanica.nz on social media
or www.wildbotanica.co.nz.
For any queries, please email felicity@wildbotanica.co.nz.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Crochet - Christmas Special!, In this half day crochet special, you will get the patterns to make stars, and icicles, mini wreaths, a mini Christmas jumper, Christmas tree and gifts bunting and a cute mini Christmas hat. Please bring some 4 or 8 ply smooth yarn and a crochet hook - see full description for suitable types of yarn.

Description

Join Monique in this half-day crochet workshop where you will learn how to crochet a range of little projects suitable for the holiday season. Choose from stars, icicles, mini wreaths and Christmas jumpers, Christmas trees and a mini Santa hat! There will be a booklet of patterns for you to take home, to enable you to complete in your own time the projects that you didn’t have time to make during the workshop.

You will also learn how to crochet and decorate Christmas baubles! While you might not finish all the patterns this day, the aim is to have a go at making as many as possible!

You will need to know some basic crochet stitches such as single and double crochet. You’ll also need to have some understanding of how to read a pattern and work with diagrams, as taught in the beginners’ crochet course.

Please bring yarn that you enjoy working with (cotton, acrylic or wool, 4ply or 8 ply) in a variety of colours (red, white and green, a neutral colour for the mouse, and glittery yarns are all good options for the Christmas projects) and a matching crochet hook. You’ll also need a pair of scissors and a darning needle.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Beginner's Weekend - October - Wellington, A fabulous and fun introduction to jewellery making over two afternoons, this is our most popular short workshop!
The students start with basic ring-making in copper or brass. We begin with ring making as this process teaches students many fundamental techniques in one project, measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting, soldering and finishing are all included in this one ring.
Students will learn how to measure their fingers to get an accurately sized ring, later they will also learn how to take sizing from existing rings. They are shown how to use a jeweller’s saw to cut their metal to the correct length, how to form it up and how to solder.
Then they learn how to shape their rings and finish them up into a wearable piece of jewellery, all in the first class!
In the first morning they are also shown how to texture metals, cut and layer shapes, melt balls of silver and other techniques to create decorative elements.
Students can spend their afternoon and evening thinking about and planning their design in silver for the next day. We encourage them to carefully plan this project and think about how they might make their piece before they begin, including creating drawings and notes. (We always say drawings don’t need to be “good”, they just need to make sense to the student and their tutor!). This project can be another ring, or earrings or pendants. We have a great selection of example pieces in the workshop so they can see what’s achievable in the 3-hour time frame. Sometimes students can make more than one silver piece if they have enough time.
Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a selection of sterling silver packs to choose from (depending on your project) and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and chains are available for purchase in the studio.
Kids 12 and up are welcome in this class, any person under 16 years old must be accompanied by an enrolled caregiver.
Workshops' fee $248, early bird fee $225 till 28 September.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Original Sin (UK) | Wellington, FULL TIME SENDERS & JUICED UP PRESENT: ORIGINAL SIN - SATURDAY 20 SEPTEMBER | EVA, WELLINGTON

The jump-up king himself touches down in Wellington for the very first time. From tearing up the UK underground as one half of G Dub alongside Sub Zero, to unleashing solo anthems like Don’t Be Silly, Haunted and DNB Forever (Soz Nan), Original Sin has carved his name into the core of drum & bass.

With releases on RAM, Playaz, Souped Up, Crucast and Elevate, his sound is heavy, high-energy, and built for chaos. Having torn through festivals like Let It Roll and Boomtown, it’s finally Wellington’s turn to feel the full force of his basslines.

This one’s gonna be nasty. Backing him up is a stacked local roster, keeping the energy high from doors to close:

Molly (AKL) & Gusty
Procy (TIU) & Nos (TGA) + HP
Storm & Scholten
Freeman x Chano
Dkav
Stems

––––––––––––––––––

Welly… brace yourself.

description:
EVolocity Pre-Scrutineering Day - Marlborough 2025, VEHICLE PRE-SCRUTINEERING
Students bring their vehicles and scrutineers assess them as fit-for-purpose for race day. It's important that all teams participate in pre-scrutineering to ensure you are on track for your vehicle to meet the technical specifications and safety requirements necessary for race day.
Many vehicles will not be complete and that is okay – students will be given feedback with time to make modifications or corrections before the regional final.
We strongly encourage all teams to attend pre-scrutineering, this is the second most important event of the year and all about making sure your vehicle is safe and that you get to race your vehicle at regional finals!
BRING ALONG WITH YOU
Your Vehicle - or start of it, whatever stage you are at
Any components and materials
Drink bottle, lunch and a snack
Venue
Marlborough Boys College, 
5 Stephenson Street,
Blenheim Central,
Marlborough 7201
Contact
Regional Co-ordinator // Annabelle Batchelor // 027 4100 633 // annabelle@evolocity.co.nz

description:
FULLY BOOKED - Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #6, F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #6
🎟️ Sign up here: https://lu.ma/ftstwellington6 🎟️

F*ck the Small Talk has traveled the world from Berlin, Melbourne, London, Lisbon, and Mexico City, to Lisbon and is now coming to Wellington! 🇳🇿


📦 WHAT'S THIS ABOUT?

FTST is a one-of-a-kind social experience where strangers come together for an afternoon of meaningful, fun, and deep conversation. It’s also just a different & cool way of meeting new people by getting a bit out of your comfort zone and skipping the small talk!

Join us for games, talks, and connections with friends you haven’t met yet. Join if you get annoyed after being asked what you do, where you are from, and how long you have been in Wellington every single time you meet someone. If you feel that there are better questions in life then this is the place for you. 🙌


🎈 HOW DOES IT WORK?

We start with a short & sweet intro talk followed by a few light-hearted group games to warm up. Don't worry, nothing too awkward! After that, we split you up into small groups and start with the conversation rounds (with 3-4 people). We'll have awesome question cards that will guide the flow of the conversation. You’ll never have to speak in public if you don’t want to!


🕹 HOW TO JOIN?

Take 2 minutes to fill out our form 👇🏼
https://lu.ma/ftstwellington6

Our events are limited to 30 handpicked guests to ensure a cozy atmosphere. We prioritize a balance in gender and cultural diversity, making each gathering a unique blend of perspectives! If you're invited you'll receive an invite with a special link via our ticketing platform Luma :)


🧧 HOW MUCH IS IT?

The cost to attend is NZD 23 (early llama) - NZD 25 (general llama) and includes the following:

⏰ 3 hours of facilitated and curated activities
🥪 Light snacks to keep the energy going (only if outdoors)
👥 A space to meet new people in the least boring way possible
💛 Supporting our mission to slowly eliminate small talk around the world
🎫 Also includes those pesky ticket fees!


🌳 WHERE IS IT?

We host our events in awesome cafes, rooftops, and bars across the city. We only reveal the location to ticket holders 24 hours before the event.


💛 WHAT THEY SAY

🗣 “Great way to connect with people in a more meaningful way. Get to the heart of the matter, dive straight into what really counts!” - Matthias


🗣 “This is the kind of activity humanity needs every weekend. Thank you for all.” - Sonya


🗣 “F*ck the Small Talk changes the narrative from "Where are you from?" to "When was the last time you laughed uncontrollably?" and I think that's beautiful.” - Monika


🗣 “I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda


🗣 "it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara


🗣 “Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz


Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7 🫶


🤓 FAQ

• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.


• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings 💛


• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences. ♥️ This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us :)


• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!


• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.


• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form :)

--


𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙪𝙨, 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙. ✨

* Only 30 spots available
* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!
* Age guide, 22-40 years old (only a reference, never a limit 💃)


🙅‍♀️📱This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket 🙅‍♀️📱


We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver. 🌍


--

Stay in touch 👇

Website: https://www.epicllama.com/fuckthesmalltalk
Instagram: www.instagram.com/epic.llama/
Join the club (newsletter): epicllama.myflodesk.com/wellington

description:
‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW, ‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW
‘Where there’s smoke’ is a powerful new theatre production grounded in 10 years of creative wānanga with rangatahi across Aotearoa. The script is backed by evidence and forms parts of Charlizza Matehe’s doctoral research on rangatahi suicide and mental health. It pays tribute to our very first suicide prevention show, Smoke & Mirrors, which toured Aotearoa in 2015 and ignited a kaupapa that has stood the test of time, while suitable for whānau audience, parental guidance is advised due to sensitive themes around suicide and grief. This show was created to open honest, hopeful conversations around mental health and to remind our young people they are not alone. We warmly encourage people working with youth, youth groups and community rōpū to attend together. Email for more information and group bookings

description:
HEXAFLEXAGON, Directed by Jim Fishwick
A hexaflexagon is a brightly-coloured six-sided shape that folds in on and out of itself to reveal face upon face upon face.
This show is also a hexaflexagon.
Six brightly-coloured shape-shifting actors fold scenes in on and out of themselves to reveal face upon face upon face. We wear lip gloss and carry a sword and play Super Mario and explore the forest and cry wet tears and eat giant pink-frosted donuts and party until dawn. We’re hexaflexagons. And so are you.
HEXAFLEXAGON is a high-art, high-energy improv show drenched in neon colours and backed by a hyperpop soundtrack. Six actors improvise scenes that are simultaneously very silly and very earnest, angular and amorphous, which weave together and snap apart.
As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
Image credit: Kirsty McGuire

description:
Fright Night Halloween Bar Crawl Wellington, Fright Night Halloween Bar Crawl Wellington
Dance, drink & crawl through Wellington this Halloween! 4+ venues, DJs, spooky vibes & no cover charges. Oct 31, 18+ only.

About this Event


🦇 Fright Night Crawl 2025 – Wellington🌙
When Halloween Friday rolls in, Wellington belongs to the night owls. The Fright Night Crawl isn’t just a bar hop — it’s a moving costume party across the city’s nightlife. On October 31st, 2025, expect packed dance floors, creative costumes, and drinks that only appear once a year.




Ticket Perks
✔️ Admission to 4+ participating venues
✔️ Wristband for access and drink deals
✔️ Zero cover charges at crawl stops
✔️ Digital crawl map to guide your route
✔️ DJs and entertainment throughout the night


What to Expect
From vampires to movie icons, everyone shows up ready to make a scene. Grab friends or roll solo — either way, you’ll be part of a city-wide takeover with:
🍹 Crawl-only cocktails and shots
🎶 High-energy sets from DJs spinning Halloween remixes and party favorites
👻 Venues transformed with spooky themes and live entertainment




Bar Hop Schedule
Check-In | 7:30–10:30 PM: Pick up your wristband at the opening venue.
Main Crawl | 8:30–11:30 PM: Explore middle stops at your own pace.
Finale | 11:30 PM–2 AM: Everyone comes together for the closing party.



Venues
The official list drops closer to the event. Each location will feature its own atmosphere, music, and specials. On event day, open the Digital Crawl Map for the full schedule and details.


Extra Tips
Be early: no wristband pickup after 10:30 PM.
Can’t make check-in? A friend can pick yours up.
Costumes encouraged — just leave the props that could be mistaken for weapons at home.
Check the Digital Map morning-of for any last-minute changes.


Tickets
🎟 Early Bird from $15 (limited supply). Prices increase as Halloween nears.
🔒 Capacity capped at 500 people — once sold out, that’s it.




Important Disclaimers
Age & Entry
18+ only. Valid government-issued ID required at every stop.
Wristbands
Your wristband is mandatory for venue entry. Pick up during the check-in window (7:30–10:30 PM). No late pickups.
Tickets & Refunds
All sales are final. Non-refundable, non-transferable. If the event is canceled, refunds will be issued automatically (excluding processing fees).
Venue Rights
Venues may refuse entry for intoxication, capacity, dress code violations, or inappropriate behavior. No refunds if refused.
Capacity
Entry is first-come, first-served at each stop. Wristband does not guarantee instant access if a venue is full.
Self-Guided
This is a self-paced crawl. Use the digital map to move between venues. Not all venue staff may be aware of crawl details — use the event contact info if needed.
Drink Specials
Offered by venues; may change without notice.
Conduct & Costumes
Offensive or dangerous costumes may lead to denial of entry without refund. Disorderly conduct can result in removal.
Liability Notice
By purchasing a ticket, you agree to participate at your own risk, including but not limited to alcohol-related incidents, injury, illness, property loss, or actions of other guests. Organizers and venues are not liable for damages before, during, or after the event. By attending, you waive any claims against the organizers, partners, and venues.
Event Changes
Venues and times may shift. Crawl runs rain or shine. Always check your email and the digital map for updates on event day.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
Double the nights, double the chaos. Dance, crawl & party across Wellington Halloween weekend. DJs, shots & finales ‘til 2AM!

About this Event


Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025 👻🎧
Halloween weekend is built for the bold — and this pass is your all-access ticket.
The Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass gets you into both nights of the city’s most electrifying Halloween parties. Friday kicks off with Fright Night, a citywide takeover where DJs, costumes, and neon lights set the stage. Saturday keeps the momentum alive with Screams & Shots, a high-voltage crawl of bars and clubs serving Halloween-themed shooters and nonstop beats.
This isn’t just a bar crawl — it’s a two-night music-fueled Halloween marathon. Think of it as your festival pass to the city’s nightlife: two different lineups, two massive finales, one unforgettable weekend.




WHY GRAB THE WEEKEND PASS?
⚡ Two Nights, One Wristband – Access to both Friday & Saturday events.
🎶 Festival-Level Energy – Back-to-back parties with DJs mixing EDM, hip hop, and Halloween remixes.
🍹 Exclusive Drink Deals – Spooky cocktails, shot specials, and themed drinks both nights.
🎭 Costumes Required – From glow-in-the-dark ghouls to full-on festival fits, the dance floor is your stage.
📍 Multiple Venues – 4+ stops each night, all within walking distance, ending in a huge late-night finale.


HALLOWEEN CRAWL INSTRUCTIONS
Check-In: Get your weekend wristband at the starting venue (7:30–10:30 PM each night).
Crawl the Clubs: Move between participating venues at your own pace from 8:30–11:30 PM.
Finale Blowout: Meet the full crowd at the closing party from 11:30 PM–2 AM.


YOUR WEEKEND PASS INCLUDES
🎟️ Entry to both crawls (Friday + Saturday)
🚫 No cover charges at any participating venue
📱 Access to the official crawl maps for both nights
🎶 DJs & live entertainment at every stop
🍸 Drink + shot specials exclusive to crawl attendees
🕺 Two grand finale parties — one each night




PARTICIPATING VENUES
The full lineup of bars and clubs will be released closer to the event. Expect high-energy DJs, themed rooms, and Halloween drink specials at every stop.

👻 Whether you’re chasing bass drops, showing off your costume on packed dance floors, or rallying your crew for back-to-back nights out, the Weekend Pass is your way to experience Halloween without limits.
🚨 Early bird passes start at just $25. Grab yours now before they sell out.



18 + EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so you don’t miss out.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Bar List. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. We will write, sign, speak, sing, and chant within this intimate group.
Receive channeled transmissions and packages of light information that will be a catalyst for deep change.

This day is experiential and supportive. You will receive, then practice, wherever you are at on your Light Language journey.
This will be a safe, light-hearted, fun experience for all attending, with opportunities for transformation whilst being gently supported.

With Susan Crystal Diamond 💎
I am a certified Light Language Practitioner , channel , multidimensional practitioner, 30 years in the healing arts
With over a decade of experience channeling many dialects of LL, to individuals privately and through weekly in person group sessions plus larger events.

Express your True Nature, in this day of intentions, play, and more.

I will gently support your process ✨️

description:
Halloween Nightlife Crawl Wellington 2025, Halloween Nightlife Crawl Wellington 2025
Unleash your inner ghoul! Join the Halloween Nightlife Crawl in Wellington on Oct. 31, 2025. 4+ venues, specials & costumes!

About this Event


Halloween Nightlife Crawl – Wellington 2025 🎭

On Friday, October 31st, 2025, the Halloween Nightlife Crawl brings you through a curated mix of Wellington’s top bars, lounges, and clubs. One ticket gives you access to 4+ venues, exclusive Halloween drink specials, and a night full of music and costumes across the city.




What’s Included
Entry to multiple nightlife venues
Crawl wristband for access and specials
Digital crawl map for easy navigation
No cover charges
DJs and entertainment at every stop


Event Schedule
🔑 Check-In | 7:30–10:30 PM – Pick up your wristband at the first stop.
🍹 Crawl Time | 8:30–11:30 PM – Move between bars and lounges at your own pace.
🎉 Final Party | 11:30 PM–2 AM – Everyone meets at the closing venue for the big finish.



Quick Details
🎟 Tickets start at $15 (Early Bird). Prices rise as the event approaches.
👻 Costumes encouraged — from glam to scary, the night is yours.
📍 Venues announced soon. Full lineup will be available on the Digital Crawl Map.
🔞 18+ only. Government-issued ID required.



18+ Event / Valid ID Required


Helpful Tips
Arrive on Time: Wristbands must be collected at the designated check-in venue by 10:30 PM. Late arrivals cannot be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Send a Friend: If you can’t make check-in, you may authorize a friend to pick up your wristband so you don’t miss out.
Know the Schedule: Each venue’s times are listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Drink specials and crawl access are only valid during the hours posted.
Stay Informed: Always review the Digital Crawl Map link on the morning of the event for the latest updates and any last-minute changes.
_______________________________________


Important Terms & Disclaimers
Age Requirement
All participants must be 18+ with a valid government-issued photo ID. Entry will not be granted without ID.
Wristbands
A wristband is required for entry at all participating venues. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive it. Wristbands must remain visible throughout the night. If you fail to pick up your wristband during the scheduled window, no replacement will be provided.
Tickets & Refund Policy
All ticket sales are final — no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. If the event is canceled in full, your ticket (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Venues, times, and drink specials may be modified without notice.
Venue Rules
Each venue reserves the right to deny entry or remove guests for intoxication, capacity limits, inappropriate dress, or disruptive conduct. No refunds will be issued if entry is refused for these reasons.
Capacity & Timing
Some stops may reach capacity during the event. Admission is first-come, first-served, and your ticket does not guarantee immediate access to any specific location. Late arrivals may face delays in entry.
Self-Guided Experience
This is a self-led crawl — no host will escort groups between venues. Use the Digital Crawl Map to navigate. If staff at a venue are not aware of the crawl, contact the rep listed on the map and proceed to another participating venue if needed.
Drink Specials
Promotions are determined by each venue and may change or end without advance notice.
Security & Dress Code
All venues conduct their own security screening. Wristbands do not bypass these checks. Costumes must not include weapons (real or replica) or offensive themes. Violations may result in denied entry without refund.
Behavior Expectations
Respect venue staff, security, and fellow attendees. Aggressive or damaging behavior may result in removal without a refund.
Liability Notice
By purchasing a ticket and attending, you voluntarily accept all risks related to participation, including alcohol consumption, injury, illness, property loss, or incidents caused by other attendees. You waive any claims against the organizers, affiliates, staff, and participating venues. You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless these parties from any expenses or claims resulting from your actions.
Event Continuity
This event will run rain or shine. Venues and schedules may change. Check the Digital Crawl Map and your email on event day for the latest information.
Acknowledgment
By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to these terms and accept full responsibility for your participation.

description:
Haunted Halloween Weekend Pass 2025 – Wellington, Haunted Halloween Weekend Pass 2025 – Wellington
Two nights, one ticket, endless Halloween chaos in Wellington. Join both crawls with drinks, music, and costume madness.

About this Event


🎃🍺 Halloween Madness Weekend Pass 2025 – Wellington 🎃🍺

Two nights of crawls. One ticket. Zero excuses.
Halloween in Wellington isn’t just one party — it’s a whole weekend. With the Halloween Madness Weekend Pass, you’ll unlock access to two epic bar crawls:
Friday, October 31st → Haunted Halloween Bar Crawl
Saturday, November 1st → Beer & Spirits: Halloween Booze Crawl

Double the venues, double the specials, double the fun. Whether you’re into pumpkin brews, tequila shots, or just want an excuse to rock your scariest (or funniest) costume twice, this pass is your best deal for Halloween weekend.




WHAT’S INCLUDED
✔️ Entry to both Friday & Saturday night crawls
✔️ No cover charges at participating bars & clubs
✔️ Crawl-only drink deals at every stop
✔️ Digital crawl map to guide your night
✔️ DJs, themed parties, and Halloween vibes until 2 AM
✔️ Two big finale parties — one each night


HOW THE WEEKEND FLOWS
👉 Wristband Pickup: Check in between 7:30–10:30 PM each night at the opening venue to collect your pass.
👉 Bar Hopping: From 8:30–11:30 PM, explore multiple walkable venues — pubs, clubs, and breweries — all offering specials.
👉 The Last Stop: Each crawl closes at a featured nightclub from 11:30 PM–2:00 AM with DJs and dance floors packed.




WEEKEND VIBE
👻 Costumes aren’t required but highly encouraged — expect the streets to be packed with zombies, witches, superheroes, and some of the funniest DIY outfits you’ll see all year.
⚡ Early bird tickets start at just $25 for the full weekend. Prices rise as Halloween gets closer — secure your spot now.


PARTICIPATING VENUES
The full lineup of bars and clubs will be released closer to the event. Expect high-energy DJs, themed rooms, and Halloween drink specials at every stop.




⚠️ EVENT RULES & DISCLAIMER

ENTRY REQUIREMENTS
18+ Only: All guests must be 18 years or older with a valid government-issued photo ID. No exceptions.
Wristbands Required: Your wristband is your ticket. Present your Eventbrite ticket/QR code at check-in to claim it. Wristbands must be worn the entire night for access to crawl venues. If you miss the pickup window (before 10:30 PM at the listed check-in), you forfeit entry.


CRAWL GUIDELINES
On-Time Check-In: Arrive during designated hours (7:30–10:30 PM). Late arrivals cannot be accommodated.
Proxy Pickup: If you can’t make it, you may authorize a friend to collect your wristband.
Venue Timing: Specials and entry are only valid during the timeframes listed on the Digital Bar List.
Day-Of Updates: Always check the Digital Crawl Map on event day for the latest venue info, changes, or closures.
Self-Guided Crawl: No hosts will lead groups. Use the crawl map to navigate between bars.
Venue Capacity: If a location is full, you may have to wait. Access is not guaranteed at every bar.


VENUE POLICIES
Right to Refuse: Venues may deny entry or remove anyone due to intoxication, dress code violations, offensive costumes, or inappropriate behavior.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not exempt you from ID or bag checks. Standard venue security applies.
Drink Specials: Offered at the discretion of participating bars; they may change or end without notice.
Venue Awareness: If staff aren’t aware of the crawl, contact the rep listed on the crawl map. If unavailable, proceed to another participating venue.


TICKET & EVENT TERMS
All Sales Final: No refunds, exchanges, or transfers. If the event is canceled outright (without reschedule), refunds excluding fees will be processed automatically.
Rain or Shine: Crawl will proceed regardless of weather. Venues and lineup are subject to change.
Late / Wrong Venue: Tickets are valid only during scheduled crawl hours. No refunds for late arrivals or showing up at the wrong check-in.
Costume Policy: No weapons or weapon-like props. Offensive costumes are prohibited and may result in denied entry.


LIABILITY WAIVER
By purchasing a ticket, you acknowledge that participation is at your own risk. Risks include but are not limited to: injury, illness, property damage, theft, accidents, alcohol-related incidents, or death.
You hereby release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, staff, contractors, sponsors, affiliates, and participating venues from all claims or liability, whether caused by negligence or otherwise, for any injury, loss, illness, or death occurring before, during, or after the event.
You further agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any expenses, claims, or legal costs arising from your actions during the crawl.
By attending, you confirm you’ve read, understood, and agreed to these terms in full.

description:
Crazy Ladies, Pamela Browne has organised a 25 year reunion for her four best friends from High School. From the moment Kay, now a chocoholic gun-toting funeral director arrives, the wheels begin falling off Pamela’s meticulously planned weekend.
Added to the mix is Sandy, who is now a Nun, Dianne, married the school nerd and is a mother of eight sons, Rachel, a runaway teenager on a mission to dig up some dirt on her mother, and Shaun, the greasy motel janitor, who ends up in a compromising position in the ladies’ wardrobe.
Guns, gags, cuffs, crucifixes, sleaze-balls , slander, pizza and pinot – everything you need for a great weekend reunion!

description:
Beehive to Business with Hon. Simon Watts, Join us on Thursday 18 September for our next Beehive to Business event with Hon Simon Watts, Minister of Climate Change, Minister for Energy, Minister for Local Government and Minister of Revenue.
With local Government decision making in the spotlight as we head into local body elections, there is no better Minister in the Government to hear from than Minister Watts.
Minister Watts is at the forefront of some of New Zealand’s most pressing issues – be it the energy market, water service delivery, or taxation, the decisions Minister Watts heads up are pivotal to New Zealand – and your business.
A recent Cabinet promotion, Minister Watts is seen as a critical cog in the executive Government – a chance to engage with the Minister on the issues that matter to you most is not to be missed.
This event is part of an ongoing series made possible by our partnership with premier consulting firm Allen + Clarke. Proudly based in Wellington, Allen + Clarke is equally at home advising the Beehive or business alike.
Agenda:
7:15am- Standing breakfast, networking
7:45am- Address
8:10am- Q&A
8:30am- Event concludes
Can't make it? Click here to register for the free livestream. Sign up and watch at a time convenient to you.

description:
Lucid Dreamin', Lucid Dreamin’ with Camp Low Expectations 🌜
Step beyond the veil and into the realm of lucid dreaming, where sound becomes sensation, and movement becomes vibration  🌪️
Camp Low Expectations invites you to drift through an immersive night of sonic exploration, guiding dreamers and dancers alike with deep grooves, hypnotic rhythms, and bass-heavy journeys.
⚡ Set Times ⚡
8:00pm - Bababear (House)
9:00pm - ZipZap (Tribal Progressive)
10:00pm - Queenie (Tribal Techno & Psy)
11:00pm - 93silva (Experimental Techno)
12:00am - Dexi (Primal Bass)
Dress to theme and step into the dreamscape. Think otherworldly, strange, or surreal. Express your dream-self and let your outfit become part of the collective vision.
Special thanks to ZipZap for lighting, Gold for Gold (Blair & Fortuna) for the sound system, Chelsea for her graphic design, and Ruby speciosa var. Photography, who will be capturing the night through her lens 📷
Camp Low Expectation values enthusiastic consent. We have zero tolerance for anti-social behaviour, if you or someone else needs support, please reach out to the nearest camp member.
Photos and videos will be taken through the night, please let us know if you prefer not to be involved.
As always, resect each other, the venue, and most of all.. have fun! 💞
All proceeds help bring Camp Low Expectation’s vision to life at Kiwiburn 2026 🌞

Lindsay Keats is a very experienced commercial and editorial photographer based in Wellington, working on assignments as varied as food, product, aerial, editorial, corporate, and industrial. Check out more of Lindsay's work here: https://www.lindsaykeats.com/index
August 28, Tararua Tramping Club (4 Moncrieff St, Mt Victoria), Doors Open at 7pm

description:
Queer Horizons presents Hot Mooch, Hot Mooch is a queer club night. Come to shake up koanga with a night of hot dance music. 
Spawned from the legendary Queer Horizons in Ōtautahi Christchurch, Hot Mooch is happening in te Upoko o te Ika Wellington - Valhalla to be exact - on 11 October. 
!!! THIS LINEUP !!!
🎶 DJ Thank U So Much (Te Whanganui-a-Tara)
🎶 Mr Meaty Boy (Ōtautahi)
🎶 AAKI (Ōtautahi)
🎶 Oil Grace (Tāmaki Makaurau)
Come to kanikani. Toi tū te Tiriti and free Palestine.
About Hot Mooch
Hot Mooch is for the bipoc and queer communities of Te Whanganui-a-Tara and their allies. It is intended as a night to dance and listen to loud music: in safety, as yourself, and with abandon. 
BIPOC and LGBTQIA+ front and centre: always.
Tino rangatiratanga: mō āke tonu atu.
FREE PALESTINE. 10% of sales go to Team Assal for their work supporting people in Gaza.
The night is dedicated to respectful, inclusive, and joyful space: we have no tolerance for any unsafe behaviour including racism, ableism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, fatphobia, or unwanted attention. 
Show lots of love and respect to our amazing performers and DJs and give them space to do their thing.
Take care of those around you, be aware of the space you inhabit and respect the needs of others. Ear plugs are available at the bar, and we encourage you to take time out, and check in with your friends. If you need help please ask the bar staff or organisers. 
  Accessibility details
Valhalla is wheelchair accessible with accessible toilets. If you have other accessibility needs, DM Abby on Insta @emmanuelcunnane

description:
Magic: Commander Party Edge of Eternities @ Ceberus Games, Join us for Commander Party! Purchase a booster for entry.
Commander Party is a story-inspired Commander event that immerses players in the setting of the latest set release. The vibe is fun and casual, and the events are outstanding opportunities to welcome in broad groups from your community, from new players to lore enthusiasts to Commander fans.
The event features special rules designed specifically for Edge of Eternities and includes play aids and party cards to support play.
Set up and play follows the regular Commander format rules but players all have these additional abilities:
Special Rules:
Alternate win condition: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control all five worlds, you win the game.
At the beginning of your end step, if one or more opponents lost 3 or more life this turn, gain control of an unclaimed world or a world controlled by one of those opponents.
Whenever you cast your commander, you get an orbit counter.
, pay an orbit counter: choose left or right. Each player passes control of a world they control to the next player in the chosen direction. Activate only as a sorcery.
Each world card also grants a triggered ability whenever a player gains control of it and at the beginning of their upkeep while it is in their control in their command zone.

description:
Marlborough Sports Awards 2025, Marlborough Sports Awards 2025
Join us for Marlborough's premier sports awards function. The 2025 live awards dinner, recognising all our nominees and winners.

About this Event



2025 Sport Tasman Marlborough Sports Awards
Saturday 22nd November. Marlborough Events Centre
6 pm meet and mingle, to be seated by 6.30pm.
The Marlborough Sports Awards is an opportunity to acknowledge some of our top sportspeople amongst family, friends and the wider community. The 58th annual Awards will take place at the Marlborough Events Centre at 6.00pm on Saturday 22nd November 2025.

Dress Code: Formal Dress Attire (no jeans please)
Join us in celebrating the success of Marlborough's leading athletes through to our grassroots heroes, and to recognise one person's lifetime contribution to sport when they are awarded the prestigious 'Marlborough Medal'.
MC: Our 2025 Masters of Ceremony will be returning back to his home stomping ground to provide some vibrant entertainment.Tony Lyall is one of Aotearoa's leading MC's with a background working in 7 Days, The Project, Radio Hauraki alongside his sporting success leading the Match Days for Black Caps, NZ Cricket and the Blues Rugby.
We have some exciting new categories for 2025!

Premier / National / International Awards
Emerging Young Talent of the Year (Under 19yrs) x 2
Sportswoman of the Year
Sportsman of the Year
Supreme Team of the Year
Overall Sportsperson of the Year

Aspiring / Regional / Awards
Community Team of the Year

Contribution / Recognition Awards
Marlborough Medal (Lifetime Contribution)
Community Heroes (5 winners)
Includes: A glass of wine or a beer on arrival, a family style dinner, two bottles of wine per table, non-alcoholic beverages and a fantastic evening of awards presentations and entertainment.
Doors open for pre-dinner function at 6.00pm Official start time: 6.30pm

description:
Monthly Life Drawing, Come along and have a go at portraiture with our koha life drawing sessions, hosted monthly at the Gallery.

With a mix of timed short and long poses, you are invited to bring your own materials or use the basic supplies we provide.

The sessions run from 2 pm to 4 pm—please arrive early to set up. We'll take a short kaputī break halfway through. This is a koha event, with all contributions going directly to our models. Friends and whānau are welcome!

Interested in modeling? Contact us—we're always looking for sitters. Everyone is welcome to join!

Accessibility Information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.

description:
Cheesemaking - Brie And Queso Fresco, During this intensely practical, hands-on workshop, you will be guided through each step of the cheesemaking process while making your very own round of Double Cream ‘NZ style’ Brie. You will also be shown how to make Queso Fresco cheese which you will get to sample afterwards. All ingredients included in course fee.

The ultimate class in practical cheese making! Learn all you need to know to replicate making NZ style Brie and Queso Fresco at home. You will be guided through each step of the cheesemaking process while making your very own round of Brie. Then, while the Brie is ripening and setting (don't worry, all terminology will be explained!), we will make Queso Fresco together.

All ingredients are provided as are recipes and detailed handouts to take away with you. Bring an apron, a dishcloth, 3 or 4 tea towels, a pen to take notes and a 2 litre container and plastic re-sealable food bags to take your cheese home.

During the workshop, the following topics will also be covered: Milk and where to source it, hygiene and sanitation, equipment required and the origins of the cheeses you are about to make. You will also receive comprehensive instruction on how to mature your Brie cheese over the next few weeks.

A small break will be provided and you will have the opportunity to purchase equipment and cheesemaking ingredients after the workshop should you wish to replicate the experience at home.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Make Brie and Queso Fresco
- Recall the best milk to use and where to source it from
- Name and identify what equipment and ingredients you need to make Brie and Queso Fresco

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

1 Day
Presented by Alexis Murti.

description:
Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025, Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025
🐹 New Zealand Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025 – Upper Hutt

Get ready for the cutest competition in New Zealand – the Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025 happening in Upper Hutt on Saturday 11th October 2025. This one-of-a-kind event brings together pet lovers breeders and guinea pig enthusiasts from across the country for a full day celebrating our much-loved cavies.
Hosted by North Canterbury Guinea Pigs in collaboration with the Capital Cavy Club the show features two major events in one day:
🏆 Pedigree Guinea Pig Show – showcasing the very best cavies bred to national standards.
🐾 Pet Guinea Pig Show – where family pets take the spotlight for their charm personality and cuteness.
Whether you’re a seasoned exhibitor a first-time participant or simply a guinea pig fan this is the perfect opportunity to:
✅ Meet and connect with other guinea pig owners and breeders.
✅ Learn more about cavy care breeds and showing standards.
✅ Enjoy a fun family-friendly day out in the heart of Upper Hutt.
✅ See some of New Zealand’s most beautiful and beloved guinea pigs.

📍 Event Details:
Date: Saturday 11th October 2025
Venue: Upper Hutt Uniting Parish 1 Benzie Avenue Upper Hutt
Time: 9:30am arrival for the main show | Pet Show starts at 2:00pm

Exhibitors from all cavy clubs across New Zealand are welcome with special sections for junior members and pet owners.
With support from Topflite and hosted by North Canterbury Guinea Pigs the Nationwide Cavy Show is one of the biggest guinea pig events in New Zealand – and one you won’t want to miss!

description:
Ziggy Alberts tickets, Presented by: Commonfolk
ARIA-accredited and APRA Award-winning artist Ziggy Alberts will return to New Zealand this November as part of his New Love World Tour, following three years of extensive touring across Europe, the UK, North and South America, Asia, and regional Australia. Celebrating the release of his seventh studio album, New Love, Ziggy will return to New Zealand for the first time since 2023, with three special shows in Christchurch, Wellington, and Auckland.
From his early days busking the streets of Byron Bay to selling out venues like London’s Royal Albert Hall, Ziggy’s journey has been defined by grassroots touring, heartfelt songwriting, and an unwavering independent spirit.
The New Zealand leg of the tour kicks off on Thursday 13 November at Christchurch Town Hall, followed by Meow Nui in Wellington on Friday 14 November, and concludes at Auckland’s Powerstation on Saturday 15 November. This tour will showcase Ziggy’s signature solo style - spirited, raw, and deeply authentic - the kind of direct connection that has earned him over one billion streams, multiple awards, and a loyal global fanbase.
Fans can look forward to favourites like ‘Days in the Sun’ and ‘Runaway’, which recently surpassed 100 million streams, alongside new tracks from New Love - an album crafted for live performance. Featuring hit singles 'New Love’, 'Where Does the Love Go?' and latest single, ‘I’m With You’ the record marks a return to simplicity and authenticity, blending folk, rock, and country influences to create a cohesive yet dynamic listening experience.
Alberts’ year of New Love is not one to miss. This leg of the world tour will celebrate connection, authenticity, and music’s ability to bring people together. Don’t miss the chance to see Ziggy Alberts live on the New Love World Tour 2025
