description:
Greg Crayford's Jazz Night for 20th August - Erna Ferry, Kia ora jazz lover,
This coming week at Wellington’s longest-running jazz residency Greg is thrilled to bring one of Aotearoa’s top vocalists to the stage – the one and only Erna Ferry.
About Erna
Erna, associated primarily with the mighty Rodger Fox Big Band, is a Jazz’n’Blues afficionado from Manawatū.
Erna started her career in amateur musical theatre, discovering, alas, that a thespian she was not - but that she loved to sing! She has performed at all the leading NZ jazz clubs and festivals throughout the country and includes as highlights her ‘tribute to Peggy Lee’ show that toured throughout NZ, and playing support for Al Jarreau and George Benson – not to mention performing at the Monterey Jazz Festival in California with the RFBB.
Erna loves to sing the blues and works regularly with a Whanganui blues band called “Blues Buffet” – and now and then teams up with Wellington vocalist Julie Lamb under the moniker of “Two Bluesy Blondes”.
On a good day she also plays a mean harmonica.
We are SOOOO looking forward to her engagement at The Realm with her ‘A’ team of musicians:
• Oscar Laven (saxophones)
• Duncan Haynes (piano)
• Rory McCartney (bass)
• Greg Crayford (drums and host)
Join us!
Table bookings 04 974 2207 or info.therealm@nzvenueco.nz or therealm.co.nz and click on ‘book a table’
Great ambience, good company, superb kai and stellar music. What more could a jazz fan want?
Jamming and sit-ins more than welcome. Bring your horn/axe/favourite toy.
Hope to see you there
Mark your diary!
Twenty Years of Realm Jazz Variety Concert/Gig – Many Acts!
30th August 2025 from 2pm-10pm

description:
Comfy Concert at The Long Hall - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble performance for Arohanui Strings+, � Join us for an afternoon of beautiful music and community spirit! �
Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View! Relax with a cuppa while listening to expertly curated chamber music featuring Helene, Rolf, and top musicians at an intimate venue in one of Wellington’s most stunning locations.
Helen Pohl (violin) and Rolf Gjelsten (cello), as the Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, are getting together with friends to play a series of intimate concerts that support some of their favourite causes – Arohanui Strings+ included (www.arohanuistrings.org).
Comfy Concert No.7 with Simeon Broom (violin) and Nicholas Hancox (viola) on 18 October, 2025, playing:
JS Bach - Suite No. 3 in C Major for cello solo
Dmitri Shostakovich – Quartet No. 5
Dmitri Shostakovich – Quartet No. 2
(programmes and artists may change - but hopefully not!)
The Comfy Concert series
The Comfy Concerts is a series of four beautiful concert experiences with two dates to benefit Kaibosh (20 September and 16 November) and two dates to benefit Arohanui Strings+ (Saturday 30 August and 18 October).
Thank you to Helene, Rolf and musicians of The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, for generously donating time and talent in support Arohanui Strings+ and Kaibosh!
Learn more about these charities: arohanuistrings.org and kaibosh.org.nz
Location
The Long Hall overlooks Point Jerningham with views of Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington Harbour. See the Google map location.
You can park on Maida Vale Rd or on Roseneath School tennis court and follow the signs. Or on foot or bike, use the footpath up from Carlton Gore Road or from Maida Vale Road near Roseneath School.
Dress warmly, and maybe bring a cushion and some slippers, as it's shoes off to protect the new floor.
It's going to be a wonderful afternoon of fabulous music, while supporting the next generation of musicians through raising funds for two fabulous charities.

description:
Nightlife & Horde Halloween Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Nightlife & Horde Halloween Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
From rooftop beats to undead streets, the weekend is yours. DJs, shots & finales light up Wellington Oct 31 & Nov 1. One wristband.

About this Event

One weekend. Two worlds. Your Halloween story starts here.
The Nightlife & Horde Weekend Pass unlocks entry to both of Wellington’s wildest Halloween crawls:
Halloween Nightlife Crawl – Friday, October 31st
Zombie Horde Pub Crawl – Saturday, November 1st
Friday night is for the glam. Step into cocktail lounges, rooftop bars, and dance clubs with DJs spinning Halloween remixes and exclusive themed menus. Saturday night is for the horde. Join the undead as the city’s pubs transform into survival zones filled with zombie shots, blood-red cocktails, and a closing party where the living and the undead collide.
Two nights, two vibes — one wristband.





WHY BUY A WEEKEND PASS?
✨ Double the Halloween – Party both Friday & Saturday with one ticket.
🍸 Curated Drink Specials – Classy cocktails Friday, blood-soaked shots Saturday.
🎶 Non-Stop DJs – Hip hop, EDM, party anthems, and spooky remixes across both nights.
🎭 Two Themes, One Crowd – Dress to impress on Friday, then unleash your inner monster on Saturday.
📍 4+ Venues Each Night – From stylish nightlife venues to pub-packed streets, all within walking distance.


HOW THE WEEKEND WORKS
Check-In: Pick up your weekend wristband at the designated start venue (7:30–10:30 PM both nights).
Choose Your Path: Explore any participating bars, pubs, or clubs between 8:30–11:30 PM.
Final Party: Each night ends at a huge closing venue from 11:30 PM–2 AM.


WHAT YOUR PASS INCLUDES
🎟️ Admission to both Halloween Nightlife Crawl (Friday) + Zombie Horde Crawl (Saturday)
🚫 Skip the cover charges at all participating venues
📱 Digital crawl maps for both nights 🎶 DJs + live music at every stop
🍹 Exclusive Halloween drinks and specials each night
🕺 Two grand finale parties to close out the weekend


PARTICIPATING VENUES
Venue lists will be announced closer to Halloween. Expect a curated mix of upscale bars and clubs on Friday, and themed pubs and high-energy party spots on Saturday.
This pass is built for the ones who want it all: Friday for style, Saturday for chaos. Get your crew together, plan your costumes, and claim your spot for back-to-back Halloween madness in Wellington.
🚨 Early bird passes start at $25. Space is limited — secure yours before they’re gone.





EVENT TERMS & CONDITIONS
AGE & ID POLICY
Entry is strictly 18+. You must show a valid government-issued photo ID to join.
No ID = no entry, regardless of ticket purchase.
WRISTBANDS & CHECK-IN
Mandatory Wristbands: A wristband is required for venue access. You’ll receive it at the official check-in by presenting your Eventbrite ticket or QR code.
Check-In Deadline: Wristbands must be collected during the posted hours (before 10:30 PM). If you fail to check in on time, you lose access—no refunds.
Proxy Option: If you can’t arrive in time, you may send someone else to pick up your wristband.
VENUE ACCESS & CONDUCT
Schedule Restrictions: Wristbands and drink deals are valid only during the times listed on the Digital Bar List.
Use the Crawl Map: Always review the Digital Crawl Map Link on event day for updates, venue changes, or closures.
Capacity Limits: Some locations may reach max capacity. You may be required to wait or choose an alternate venue.
Venue Rights: Bars reserve the right to refuse entry based on intoxication, dress code, behavior, or safety concerns. Security screening still applies even with a wristband.
TICKETS & REFUNDS
Final Sale: All tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable. If the event is canceled with no new date, a refund (minus fees) will be issued automatically.
Rain or Shine: The crawl happens regardless of weather. Venue participation and specials are subject to change without notice.
Arrival Issues: Late check-ins or showing up at the wrong venue are not grounds for refunds.
COSTUMES & BEHAVIOR
Costume Guidelines: No items resembling weapons. Offensive or unsafe costumes may lead to denied entry without refund.
Respect the Crawl: Disorderly conduct, damage to venues, or harassment of staff or other guests will result in removal with no refund.
LIABILITY WAIVER
By purchasing a ticket and participating, you voluntarily assume all risks associated with the event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, property loss, theft, accidents, alcohol-related harm, and even death.
You fully and forever release and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, partners, contractors, sponsors, employees, volunteers, and all participating venues from any claims, liabilities, or demands connected to your participation—whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, or any other reason.
You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless all released parties from any expenses, damages, or legal costs arising from your actions or involvement.
By attending, you confirm you have read and accepted these terms and conditions. Your participation is voluntary, and this waiver is intended to be as broad and enforceable as the law allows.

description:
Reimagining Construction: Participatory, Circular, and Open by Design, This presentation examines how the principles of participatory, circular, and open design can transform construction by bringing human and ecological values into the heart of how we build.
Drawing from both ancient timber framing traditions and modern innovations, it demonstrates how modularity and standardisation unlock flexibility, efficiency, and customisation while supporting sustainable, locally-rooted solutions.
A key focus is placed on design for disassembly and reassembly, enabling buildings and their components to be reused and adapted over time—reducing waste, lowering environmental impact, and fostering resilience for current and future communities.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Oriental Bay, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
Freak Slug - Wellington, Manchester based musician Freak Slug - the project of Xenya Genovese - will be welcoming audiences in Pōneke Wellington and Tāmaki Makaurau Auckland into her dreamy indie-pop world this October.

Hugely influenced by ‘90s cult heroes including Ride, Mazzy Star and Stephen Malkmus, Freak Slug is all about hitting a mood. Everything that fuels her creative output is raw, authentic, sometimes weird, but always totally true self-expression. I Blow Out Big Candles is a strong statement of all of this and more. Down there, picking through the curious mix of sounds and feelings, from nostalgic, ‘90s-influenced and dreamy as well as eccentric and experimental, lives Freak Slug.

The 10-track project gives listeners a taste of what they will be in for at her Aotearoa shows, a journey of both soft soulfulness and sonic songwriting, all laid out on the table.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Multifest 2025, Multifest 2025
Bring your friends and whānau along to Multifest 2025, a free family-friendly festival celebrating the many cultures that call Lower Hutt home. You'll discover:
• Live music and dance performances representing various cultural traditions
• A wide range of cultural food stalls offering global flavours
• Arts, crafts, and cultural displays
• Interactive activities for children and families
label: Festivals

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Your Friendly Cow, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Spy in the Wild, Step into a world of mystery, flavour, and espionage at The Green Man Pub on Wednesday, 23rd October.
Doors open at 6:00pm, with the main event kicking off at 6:30pm. You’ll be welcomed with a sealed mission envelope containing your assignment for the evening. In teams, you’ll work to crack codes, decipher tasting notes, and unravel clues inspired by Spy Valley’s wines and the stories behind them.
Along the way, enjoy five chef-crafted canapés, each perfectly matched with a hand-picked Spy Valley wine. Expect a captivating atmosphere enhanced by lasers and special effects, transforming the pub into a true espionage experience.
🎟️ Tickets from $50 – includes six canapés with wine pairings and your mission dossier. Places are limited, so secure your spot before this top-secret evening sells out.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Planetary Parade - Free event, Six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
Please note we will postpone the event to if the weather is uncooperative.
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Pokemon: Gym Leader Challenge @ Cerberus Games, Choose Your Pokémon Type and Get Started!
Harness the power of Single-Prize Pokémon with a Gym Leader Challenge Deck! No Rule Box Pokémon are allowed in Gym Leader Challenge, making for a fun, challenging and diverse format!
Here are the details:
Start Time: 6:00pm
Entry Fee: $10
Format: Gym Leader Challenge (3-4 Rounds)
Decks must be build using the following deck building restrictions:
- Your deck can only contain one type (color) of Pokémon.
- Only one of each card with the same name allowed in a deck, except for Basic Energy.
- Cards with a Rule Box are not allowed.
- ACE SPEC cards are not allowed.
- Legal Cards: Black & White – onwards, and a short ban list
- 60 card decks are built & 6 Prize Card games are played with the most current Pokemon TCG rules.
Prizes:
Prizing includes promotional packs and booster packs for top placers and attendance.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Around the World In Fifteen Plants - Guided Walk, Around the World In Fifteen Plants - Guided Walk
Join us for an easy 60-minute guided walk to enjoy the stories of 15 plants significant to the countries in which they are found.

Meet at the Founders’ Entrance, Glenmore Street.
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.

Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Pokemon: Mega Evolution Prerelease @ Cerberus Games, MEGA EVOLVE YOUR STRENGTH TO THE NEXT STAGE!
Striving to become stronger, Pokémon of all types are putting everything on the line to become Mega Evolution Pokémon ex! Harness the strong aura of Mega Lucario ex, embrace the overflowing power of Mega Gardevoir ex, and team up with more of these powerful Pokémon that boast devastating attacks and massive HP. But consider your strategy carefully - extra power brings extra risks! Choose your Pokémon partners and prepare for the biggest battles you've ever seen in the Pokémon TCG: Mega Evolution expansion!
Cerberus Games is hosting a prerelease for the upcoming Pokemon set Mega Evolution! Here are the details:
Entry Fee: $60
Format: Sealed (3-4 Rounds Swiss)
Players will receive one Build & Battle Kit to play with and 3 additional booster packs will be awarded at the end for attendance.
Preregister here: https://cgstore.co.nz/preorder-mega-evolution-prerelease.../

description:
Powell Hut Slow Overnight Stay, This is a mid week tramp to beat any rush.
This event is aimed for people wanting to get up to this hut and stay the night as a group but NOT have the stress or pressure to break any speed limits.
The start time is set early to give the maximum amount of walking time to reach the hut destination. Typically it is a 3-4hr walk but even with a huge amount of breaks we will be arriving just in time to have lunch at the top.
There will be regular posted stopping points along the way at Rocky Mt Lookout and again at Mt House Shelter.
You will be in charge of yourself through the trip but we will be there to answer questions and provide the entertainment like always

This is a fully serviced hut with water, gas cooking and a lovely wood burner to heat the hut during our stay.
The walking distance is 7.3km on a well formed track in most parts and formed stairs.
The elevation gain is approximately 500m which brings you to the hut which sits at 1200m above sea level.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington, Escape to the Dramatic Coast: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
Are you looking for a unique and unforgettable day trip from Wellington?
Imagine yourself surrounded by breathtaking coastal scenery, watching playful seals in their natural habitat, and standing in the shadow of a historic lighthouse with panoramic ocean views.
As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.
What's in store for you:
Personalized Pick-up & Drop-off: Enjoy the convenience of being picked up and dropped off directly from your Wellington accommodation.
Scenic Coastal Drive: Relax in comfort as we journey through picturesque landscapes, including the stunning Remutaka Hill Road and the rugged Wairarapa coastline.
Marvel at the Putangirua Pinnacles: Explore the otherworldly rock formations made famous by "Lord of the Rings."
Encounter the Cape Palliser Seal Colony: Witness a thriving colony of New Zealand fur seals up close (from a safe and respectful distance).
Discover the Iconic Cape Palliser Lighthouse: Climb (or admire from below) the iconic red and white striped lighthouse and soak in the incredible views.
Flexible & Relaxed Pace: This is your private tour, so we'll move at a comfortable pace and can tailor the day to your interests.
Gourmet Options Available (upon request & additional cost): Elevate your experience with a pre-arranged gourmet picnic lunch or inquire about other bespoke dining options featuring local flavors.
Expert Guidance: Benefit from my local knowledge, insights into the region's history, geology, and wildlife, ensuring a truly engaging experience.
Perfect for Photography Enthusiasts: Capture stunning photos of dramatic landscapes and unique wildlife.
Who is this tour for?
This private Cape Palliser day trip is ideal for:
Individuals seeking a solo adventure.
Couples looking for a romantic and scenic escape.
Families wanting a memorable and educational day out.
Anyone who appreciates beautiful scenery, wildlife encounters, and a relaxed, personalized travel experience.
Those who value quality and are happy to invest in a private tour.
Date & Time: Flexible - Contact me to discuss your preferred dates and times.
Duration: Approximately 8-9 hours (can be adjusted slightly based on your preferences).
Price: Pricing is tailored to the number of people in your group and any additional requests (e.g., gourmet lunch). Please message me for a personalized quote.
Booking:
Send me a direct message to discuss your preferred dates, group size, and any specific interests you may have. I'm happy to answer any questions and create a bespoke itinerary for you.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to experience the magic of Cape Palliser on your own terms!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Pōneke Pinballers - Tournament & Free Play, - FREE TO PLAY PINBALL
- TOURNAMENTS
- PRIZES
- ON-SITE BAR
What more you could ask for?
Kicking off at 6pm, Thursday the 3rd of April. We open to you the entire arcade set to “free play”. This is the one time a month when you won’t need any tokens to play pinball, just push the start button and you’re on your way.
You might be wondering how much this incredible night will cost? We present to you a bargain of a life time. $20 at the door gets you night of dirt cheap pinball.
BUT WAIT THERE’S MORE…
For only an extra $5 get your self entered in the NZ's largest monthly tournament, Pōneke Pinballers. Put your skills to the test and play with the best players in the country.
Tournament details:
Qualifying:
- From 6:30 - 8:30pm.
- Group match play 7/5/3/1 scoring.
- 1 game per round
- no new rounds after 8:30pm
Finals:
- Top 12 players.
- Amazing race format

Bring your mates along for a night of ALL YOU CAN PLAY PINBALL!

description: Inaugural Professorial Lecture - Professor Angela Ballantyne, Inaugural Professorial Lecture "Making things right". What does it mean to make things right? Medicine and science often turn to bioethics for concrete solutions to ethical challenges. But in reality, there is rarely a single, obvious ‘right’ answer. Human systems are inherently messy, and challenged by a legacy of injustice, unequal distributions of power, and declining social trust. This talk will describe the potential for bioethics to help clarify and navigate ethics dilemmas; pragmatically inching us closer to making things – if not right, then at least – better.

description:
Jewellery-making in 4 weeks on Sundays, Mixed levels - Wellington, This Sunday afternoon block is a short course on jewellery-making. It starts on Sun 24 August and runs for 4 weeks until Sun 14 September, 2pm - 5pm.
Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on to working in silver. An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items. Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.
These blocks are also a nice way for existing students or more advanced makers to work on more challenging projects and join friendly classes in our well-equipped warm studio!
Basic materials are supplied and there are extra materials available to purchase as you need in class.
This block is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. NOTE: Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
Our booking system asks for full payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this
Course fee $280, Early bird pricing $252 till 27 July.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
SPANK, SPANK
SPANK is happening — and it’s going to be something special!

This isn’t your average dance party — it’s a kinky night with dancing, a dark room, the St. Andrew’s Cross, and more. We’ll have kinky costumes, a spectacular VJ, and a great DJ setting the mood all night long. And this time, we’re making it even better by opening up opportunities for the community to be part of the action.

We’re inviting members of the kink community to submit their own acts, scenes, or performances — whether it’s an amateur kinky act, exhibitionism, or something they’re excited to share in a safe, supportive environment. No professional acts — just real community energy and creativity.

Want to get involved? Send your ideas and scene proposals to by 31 July. This is your chance to be part of something exciting and make SPANK a night to remember!

Ticket link (Only people with the ticket link can find this event)
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
September Shuffleboard Pairs Tournament, Come along to our monthly shuffleboard league!
Register here: https://www.meandoses.co.nz/shuffleboard
Shuffleboard pairs tournaments are 6pm to 9.30pm at the latest (usually earlier), the last Wednesday of each month.
Check out the league over at Challonge.com
https://challonge.com/communities/meanshuffle
Tournament Rules:
This is a double elimination format tournament. Teams must lose twice to be eliminated. Matches are played according to standard shuffleboard rules as can be read here:
https://www.theshufflehouse.com/.../how-to-play...
EXCEPT:
- There is a 10 MINUTE time limit each match.
- Matches are played FIRST TO TEN.
- In the event of a draw after the 10 minute time limit, a "Golden End" will be played. The winner of the Golden End wins the match.
- Pucks that do not pass the foul line are removed from play.
- The shuffleboard will be reset and resanded after each match.
- No sand will be added during a match.
- The final match is played first to 15 with no time limit - if time allows.
- Every "Hanger" is rewarded with a sweet treat!
PRIZES
1st place: $60 of Taproom Vouchers + 1st place ribbon + Your team name immortalised on the honours board
2nd place: $40 of Taproom Vouchers + 2nd place ribbon
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Social Sewing Saturday - September, Social Sewing Saturday - September
Join us for a fun day of sewing and socializing this September at Social Sewing Saturday - make new friends and create something amazing tog

About this Event

Social Sewing Saturday - September
Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts! Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew. Bring your latest project or start something new - either way, you'll have a blast chatting with fellow sewing enthusiasts. Bring your current project or get inspired by others' creations at our friendly gathering. Share tips, tricks, and stories while working on our projects together.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. Please bring an extension lead and multipoint box if you have one. (Don't worry, though—we have some in the centre, too!) We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. You are welcome to come along and work on hand-sewing projects.
A kitchen is available on site and supermarkets as well as cafes are very close by.
Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC. (Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups)
Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Sir Arthur Guinness Birthday, As the founder of our beloved Guinness, we feel his birthday should be celebrated every year, and what better way to do this than to raise a pint in his name.
Join us at one or all of the bars hosting this event to honour Sir Arthur Guinness this 28th September!
label: Hobbies & Interests

Bring your current project or get inspired by others' creations at our friendly gathering. Share tips, tricks, and stories while working on our projects together.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. Please bring an extension lead and multipoint box if you have one. (Don't worry, though—we have some in the centre, too!) We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. You are welcome to come along and work on hand-sewing projects.
A kitchen is available on site and supermarkets as well as cafes are very close by.Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC. (Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups)
Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)

description:
NZIFF: Twinless, A grieving brother finds an unlikely connection at a support group for siblings who have lost a twin, but his burgeoning bromance threatens to turn into something darker in this uncomfortably sharp-witted comedy.

When his brother is suddenly killed in a car accident, estranged sibling Roman (Dylan O’Brien) suffers the unique pain of being permanently severed from his twin. Inseparable in childhood, the brothers drifted apart as adults, brother Rocky (also O’Brien) living out and proud in Portland while Roman lived a (decidedly hetero) tradie life in hometown Idaho. It seems he’ll never have the chance to work through his complicated feelings towards his twin until stumbling upon a bereavement group for just such a purpose.

There he meets Dennis (James Sweeney). Neurotic, sarcastic, gay, he’s the opposite that attracts as the pair bond over trauma and a deep need for attachment. They quickly become each other’s emotional support twin-surrogate, on call for late night grocery trips, afterwork bitch sessions, and road trip singalongs. But odd couple bliss can’t last, as Dennis has more than friendship in mind, Roman grapples with explosive anger issues, and dark secrets inevitably come to light.

Sweeny’s sophomore effort as writer, director, and co-star walks an entertaining balance between discomfort and hilarity. With finely calibrated performances from both leads, Twinless is witty, warped, and surprisingly warm hearted. — Adrian Hatwell

description:
The Coven Ball: Leather & Lace, The Coven Ball is Back – And Naughtier Than Ever!

Get ready to unleash your inner vixen at Coven: Leather & Lace – our most seductive event of the year returns for its second spellbinding edition!

Expect a night full of provocative delights: dazzling burlesque performances, flash tattoos, a spanking booth (yes, really!), and tantalizing treats lurking around every dark corner. And don’t forget – there are spot prizes for the fiercest looks, so bring your best Leather or Lace fantasy.

Who’s it for?
Coven is a celebration crafted exclusively for queer women and gender minorities. Whether you’re sapphic, trans, nonbinary, genderqueer – this is your night to shine.

Evening Highlights:
- 7pm Cocktail Hour: Fabulous arrival photos, sip on our sexy drink specials and soak in the vibes with live sapphic music.
- An evening of entertainment from burlesque, to the kinkier kind, and flash tattoos by an incredible local artist
- Our infamous dessert grazing table

Tickets are strictly limited – and they WILL sell out. Secure yours now and don’t miss the queer event everyone will be talking about.

Coming Solo? You’re Not Alone.
Don’t be nervous if you’re planning to come on your own – Coven is built for connection. Whether it’s your first queer event or your hundredth, you’ll be surrounded by a community that gets it. From the moment you arrive, there’ll be friendly faces, welcoming vibes, and plenty of chances to mingle, and connect. Coven is about belonging – and there’s a place here for you.

Coven Kaupapa
For queer women and gender minorities, spaces like this are rare, vital, and sometimes, life-changing. In a world that constantly centers cishet norms, Coven offers a space where we are the default – where you can fully show up as yourself, be seen, celebrated and surrounded by YOUR community.

For many in our Coven, this is one of the only opportunities we feel comfortable enough to experience nightlife free from the male gaze, tokenism, fear, or the need to shrink ourselves to fit in. It’s a space where sapphic, trans, nonbinary, and gender-diverse people aren’t just welcomed – we are centered. It’s for those who are often pushed to the margins, who rarely feel represented in “inclusive” spaces that still cater to the mainstream.

This night exists because we need it – and because we create it, together.

Accessibility
The event is held upstairs at Whisky & Wood, a stunning venue with gender-neutral bathrooms and lift access (note there is a small bump as you enter). Staff will be ready to help if needed. Have specific accessibility needs? Reach out directly at hello@whiskyandwood.co.nz.

Community Tickets
We want Coven to be for everyone. At checkout, consider donating toward our community ticket fund. Can’t afford a ticket? Email willysmackntush@gmail.com with the subject “Free for Me” and your preferred name. We’ll be gifting free tickets on Friday 18 October.

If you made it this far... Good girl / Good they / Good boy / Good YOU!
Get ready for a night of queer joy, sexy surprises, and community magic.

description:
The Napier Escape, Saturday 23rd August 2025 – Learn, Indulge or Explore in Napier
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.
A Deco Deep Dive
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.

Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options. Choose from the following to enhance your day:
A Deco Deep Dive
The City’s Art Deco heritage is a defining feature of the city, shaped by a remarkable chapter in its history. After a devastating earthquake in 1931 levelled much of the city, Napier was rebuilt in the architectural style of the time—Art Deco.
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
Sip, Savour, and Soak in the Views
Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.
Crab Farm Winery was established in the early 1980’s with the first vintage under the Crab Farm Winery label released in 1987. The land at Crab Farm has been in the Jardine family for over 100 years. Originally purchased without viewing beforehand – Hamish Jardine’s great grandfather was alarmed to find his new land was actually partially underwater. With tidal pools, rushes and hundreds of Crabs, the family jokingly named it ‘Crab Farm’.
Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace. Wander among world-famous Art Deco buildings, stroll the scenic Marine Parade, or relax at a local café with a Hawke’s Bay treat. Visit MTG Hawke’s Bay for a dose of culture, browse boutique shops, or admire the colourful street art. It’s your chance to soak up Napier’s unique charm your way.
For all timetable, pricing & more information - head to www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/

description:
Draw It Out - Adult workshop, A gentle yet powerful tool for wellness (adults 18+) to access inner guidance.

Theme: Welcoming new possibilities
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.

This single workshop focuses on the theme of welcoming new possibilities, great if you are going through change, wanting to transition or entering a new phase.

Date
This is a single workshop
6.15pm-7.30pm
Monday 29 September

Cost
$46 total

Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.

This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.

About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.

“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”

For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.

Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

description:
Unity Book Club September 2025 | Flesh, About the book: 
A propulsive, hypnotic novel about a man who is unravelled by a series of events beyond his grasp.
Fifteen-year-old István lives with his mother in a quiet apartment complex in Hungary. New to the town and shy, he is unfamiliar with the social rituals at school and soon becomes isolated, with his neighbour – a married woman close to his mother’s age – as his only companion. These encounters shift into a clandestine relationship that István himself can barely understand, and his life soon spirals out of control.
As the years pass, he is carried gradually upwards on the twenty-first century’s tides of money and power, moving from the army to the company of London’s super-rich, with his own competing impulses for love, intimacy, status and wealth winning him unimaginable riches, until they threaten to undo him completely.
Spare and penetrating, Flesh is the finest novel yet by a master of realism, asking profound questions about what drives a life: what makes it worth living, and what breaks it.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In September we will be discussing Flesh by David Szalay.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.

description:
Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton in concert, Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton in concert
DATE: Saturday Sept 27
TIME: 7pm
LOCATION: The Offering – 65 Main St, Greytown
AGES:
COST: $25 pp at the door or booking link below

Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton are two of New Zealand’s best-known folk musicians. They bring their deep musical connection to festivals across New Zealand, playing their favourite songs and tunes collected over years of playing together at festivals, stages and late into the night at kitchen tables. Based in Wellington, Bob is one of NZ’s best-known folk songwriters and a favourite with Greytown audiences. His songs have been covered by artists in NZ, Australia, the UK and the USA. New Zealand Musician magazine compared his songwriting to Bruce Springsteen and Mark Knopfler; the Dominion Post likened him to Jackson Brown, James Taylor, Luka Bloom and Dougie Ma¬cLean. A guitarist, he is known for his distinctive open-tuned acoustic fingerstyle and electric guitar playing. He has toured widely in NZ, Australia, Canada, Ireland, the UK and the USA. His latest album, released in June 2024, is Lost Stars, an extended release on CD and download featuring new recordings and rarities, with Emily on violin and piano.

From Whangarei, Emily is a virtuoso violinist inspired by the Scottish tradition and the modern trad movement. Classically trained, she is infinitely adaptable with her gorgeous stylings and fiery tune playing, making her the perfect foil for Bob’s lyrical songs.

Don’t miss a chance to see these two consummate musicians share their foot-stomping collection of banging tunes, favourite songs and stolen moments from the last 20 years.

Book your tickets here:
https://greytownarttown.com/bob-mcneill-and-emily-roughton-in-concert/

description:

You can memorise a textbook, but you can’t memorise a career.

description:
Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st, Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st
Get ready for the biggest Halloween Bar Crawl in Wellington on Saturday, Nov 1st. Hit the city's top bars & clubs!

About this Event


🎃🕸️ WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL 2025 🕸️🎃
Get ready for the wildest Halloween celebration in Wellington. Join the spookiest Halloween Bar Crawl on Saturday, November 1st, 2025, and get access to 4+ of Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs!
🎶 Music: Live DJs playing the hottest hits and Halloween classics.
📍 Crawl Stops: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, El Horno, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3—Wellington's hottest bars and nightclubs for an unforgettable Halloween celebration!
🕙 Kickoff: Doors open at 7:30 PM. Wristbands must be picked up by 10:30 PM!
🎟 Tickets: Starting at just $15. Prices go up soon, so don’t wait!
Throw on your wildest costume and get ready to crawl through the city with hundreds of partygoers. Whether you're spooky, cute, or covered in fake blood—this is the crawl to be at to celebrate Halloween.🧟‍♀️


⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 Halloween Bar Crawl Experience!
Gather your friends and take over the city with the Halloween Bar Crawl this Halloween, hitting Wellington’s top bars.
🚨 This event is limited to 500 attendees, so grab your tickets early before they sell out! Don’t miss your chance to celebrate this big holiday—secure your spot before it’s too late!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎃 Join Hundreds of Halloween Partygoers in Wellington
🚫 No Cover at All Participating Venues
🎟️ Exclusive Halloween Bar Crawl Wristband for Entry
📱 Bar Crawl Map to Navigate Each Spooky Stop 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Halloween Hits and Party Anthems
🕺 End the Night in Style at the Final Haunted Venue
👻 Costume up and crawl your way through Wellington’s hottest bars. Enjoy eerie drink specials, electric energy, and unforgettable Halloween experience!


🚨 Get Your 2025 Halloween Bar Crawl Tickets Before We Sell Out! 🚨
🦇Wellington’s biggest Halloween bash is just around the corner. Costumes, cocktails, and chaos await across the city's top nightlife spots.
It’s time to show off your best look and turn heads all night long. Whether you're spooky, sexy, or just straight-up wild, this year's Halloween Bar Crawl is your chance to shine. Hit the city’s most popular bars, enjoy themed drinks, and party with hundreds of fellow Halloween lovers. Your costume deserves a crowd, and this is where to find it.
🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a Halloween to remember!
💀 Let the WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money straight back to the bank!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
WRISTBAND VENUE:
Lulu Bar & Restaurant
🕒 7:30 PM – 10:30 PM
📍 31 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:30 -10:30 to arrive and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:30PM or explore the other venues.
MIDDLE STOPS:
El Horno
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 34 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
The Rogue & Vagabond
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
FINAL VENUE:
BL3
🕒 11:30 PM – 2:00 AM
📍8 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet at this final venue at 11:30PM for a massive final Halloween party!


Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Middle Stops” at your convenience between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM or stay at the wristband venue until 10:30pm. After 11:30 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate at the final party location!
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop (wristband venue), as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Please also note that wristbands are no longer available after 10:30PM at the first venue. No refunds will be given if you show up late and miss the wristband pick-up window!
This club crawl is a walking bar crawl—all venues are within walking distance of each other. Please plan accordingly for transportation and your walking schedule.
Wristbands for entry will be provided by event staff only. To pick up your wristband, please check in with the event staff at the front reception or host stand.


2025 CRAWL MAP:




🎟️ General Admission – $20
Includes access to all official crawl stops. No frills — just the fun.
───────────────────────────────────────

👑 VIP Ticket – $25
Includes everything in GA plus:
🔥 Access to the VIP-only crawl challenge for free tickets
🚀 First dibs on future crawl drops & pre-sales
───────────────────────────────────────

🤯 Ultra VIP – $35
For the dangerously curious. Includes everything in VIP plus:
🏆 Name on our “Crawl Wall of Fame”
📜 Official “Certified Crawl Legend” digital certificate
🚪 Access to a future exclusive pre-sale drop
❓ A mystery bonus item we legally can’t describe 👀



A SPOOKTACULAR HALLOWEEN PARTY YOU WON'T WANT TO MISS
Skip the overpriced cover charge and long lines at a single bar. With one ticket, you’ll unlock access to multiple Halloween hotspots across Wellington, each with its own theme, music, and party energy. Whether you're rocking a full costume or just out for the night, this is your chance to experience the city’s top nightlife all in one thrilling Halloween themed experience.
THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE HALLOWEEN NIGHT OUT
One bar? One vibe? That’s not how Wellington does Halloween. Grab your crew and bounce between the city’s best bars and clubs, each bringing something different to the table. From spooky cocktails to wild dance floors, the night builds up to one massive end-of-night party you won’t want to miss. 🧛‍♀️
THE BIGGEST HALLOWEEN PARTY NIGHT IN WELLINGTON
This crazy Halloween experience crawl will take you through the city’s top bars and clubs with a line-up built for non-stop fun. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks, and a crowd ready to party in full costume.
GET YOUR TICKETS BEFORE THEY VANISH!
Spots are filling fast, so now’s the time to lock in your plans. Round up your friends, pick your costume, and get ready to sip, dance, and crawl your way through one of the most exciting nights Wellington has to offer. Halloween only comes once a year... so grab your tickets today! 🎟️



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so they don’t miss out.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

description:
XTrail Spring - Rangituhi Rumble, XTrail Spring - Rangituhi Rumble
Rangituhi serves up a lush and leg-burning journey through one of Porirua’s most scenic spots. Starting from Spicers Botanical Park, all three courses wind their way up through the peaceful, green trails of Spicers Forest before breaking into the rugged beauty of the Colonial Knob Reserve. The short course offers a more forgiving climb with playful zig zags and a fun descent, while the long course takes you all the way to the summit of Rangituhi, a proper challenge rewarded with stunning views over Porirua Harbour and beyond. With a mix of forest trails, farm tracks, and fast-flowing descents, this one’s a true highlight of the region.

https://barefootxtrail.co.nz/

Clean and Care: Green Cleaning Workshop, Ready to clean your home without harsh chemicals - and without falling for “green” marketing that isn’t so green?
Join eco-lifestylist Stella Carruthers for a fun, hands-on workshop where you’ll discover how to take control of what’s in your cleaning products and why that matters for your health, your wallet, and the planet.
What you’ll learn:
- How to spot real eco-friendly products (and avoid greenwashing)
- Simple, natural ingredients you can use from your own kitchen
- How to make effective, affordable cleaning solutions that actually work
During the workshop, you’ll help make a variety of natural cleaning products - and take home samples to try for yourself.

Nutcracker High Tea, QTea twirls into a sun-drenched daydream with a high tea inspired by The Nutcracker. In partnership with the Royal New Zealand Ballet, we’re serving a festive fairytale where Christmas meets choreography – with a Kiwiana twist.

Perched above the harbour, QTea High Tea reimagines its plated treats into a sugar plum dreamland. Think raspberry-layered delights, golden pistachio choux, smoked salmon cups and piroshki that dance on the palate.

Sip in style and cheers to the season with The Mouse King’s Toast, Prosecco and Guignolet fizzing with festive sparkle. Craving something a little nuttier? Try The Storm Master’s Tipple. For pure summer magic in a glass, reach for the Sugar Plum Fairy Fizz.

description:
Blenheim Gypsy Fair, Blenheim Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

description:
Book Launch - South by South by Charles Ferrall, Join us to celebrate the publication of Charles Ferrall's South by South: New Zealand and the Heroic Age of Antarctic Exploration. The book will be launched by Harry Ricketts.

- Thursday 18 September, 6pm
- Unity Books Wellington
- Free event – all welcome!

Joseph Kinsey is not a name many of us know – or not as well as we know the name Robert Falcon Scott. But from his base in Christchurch, Kinsey – book and art collector, philanthropist, science enthusiast, businessman – forged deep connections with the Antarctic expeditions and the explorers themselves through his tireless work as the agent for various expeditions. Two other New Zealanders also formed close friendships: Charles Bowen, a former politician, and Wellington lawyer Leonard Tripp, to whom Shackleton declared: ‘I love you as David and Jonathan loved.’

South by South tells the story of New Zealand’s role in ‘the Heroic Age’, that wave of exploration beginning at the end of the nineteenth century in which men set out to traverse the continent of Antarctica and, if they survived, to bring home their findings. The members of this New Zealander triumvirate were all believers in the British Empire, but the southern voyages were to an uninhabited land.

South by South brings to light many letters, newspaper articles, and pieces of official correspondence, much of which has not been published before, during the five expeditions of 1901–1916: the Discovery, Nimrod, Terra Nova, Aurora, and Endurance. In particular, Scott’s letters to Kinsey and Shackleton’s to Tripp tell of their hope, despair, exhaustion, and deep gratitude for their friendship. What they and the explorers wrote was influenced by nineteenth-century adventure stories which conveyed the Imperialist ideals of the time. If the impending conflict of 1914–18 was a very ‘literary war’, this was a very literary exploration.

Charles Ferrall is an associate professor at Te Herenga Waka–Victoria University of Wellington. Among his books are Modernist Writing and Reactionary Politics (2001); The Trials of Eric Mareo (2002), co-written with Rebecca Ellis; East by South: China in the Australasian Imagination (2006), co-edited with Paul Millar and Keren Smith; Juvenile Literature and British Society 1850–1950 (2009), co-written with Anna Jackson; Henry Lawson in New Zealand (2012); How We Remember: New Zealanders and the First World War (2014), co-edited with Harry Ricketts; and Remembering Gallipoli: Interviews with New Zealand Gallipoli Veterans (2015), co-edited with Christopher Pugsley.

Cover photograph: The ship Discovery leaving Lyttelton Harbour, 1901. Alexander Turnbull Library, Wellington, New Zealand
Cover design: Spencer Levine

description:
From Europe to the Indo-Pacific: Finnish views on strategic partnerships and security in times of uncertainty, Finland, which shares a 1300km land border with Russia, has had its strategic circumstances dramatically impacted by the war in Ukraine. In this talk, State Secretary Pasi Rajala will discuss Europe’s evolving security landscape and its implications for Finland and NATO. He will share Finnish views on enhancing security and national resilience in response to shifting dynamics across Europe, the Indo-Pacific, and the global stage. He will also speak to the importance of deepening cooperation between Finland and New Zealand, two like-minded partners committed to democratic values, multilateralism, and the rules-based international order.
Mr. Pasi Rajala is State Secretary to Foreign Minister Elina Valtonen and Defence Minister Antti Häkkänen. He has previously served as Special European Affairs Adviser to the Finnish Prime Minister, Special Adviser to the Minister for Trade and Development, and Press Counselor and Spokesperson at the Finnish Embassy in Washington, D.C. Prior to that he held a number of communications positions, including in development finance company Finnfund, PR agency EuroRSCG, and the UN Development Program. Mr. Rajala holds a Master of Social Sciences degree from the University of Helsinki where he majored in International Relations.

✨ Erskine Chapel Open Day & Craft Market ✨
📅 Sunday, 2 November 2025 | 10:00am – 3:00pm
📍 Erskine Chapel, 31 Avon Street, Island Bay, Wellington

Nestled high on the hillside in Island Bay, Erskine Chapel is a breathtaking and iconic landmark, with sweeping views across the hills and ocean, and a gothic charm that has captured hearts for generations.

Now in its third year, this much loved annual event returns as part of Heritage Month, celebrating the beauty, history, and cultural significance of one of Wellington’s most treasured buildings.

Foxtail Events and The Wellington Company are once again partnering to open the chapel’s doors for the community, inviting everyone to experience this remarkable space brought back to life.

Join us for a special Community Open Day and Craft Market, where you can:

* Explore a curated market of local artisans and makers
* Discover the chapel’s rich history and stunning architecture
* Enjoy live music, freshly brewed coffee, and delicious baked goods

Whether you're drawn by the history, the creativity, or the peaceful atmosphere, this is a day to celebrate local talent and honour the legacy of a true Wellington landmark.

🗓️ Mark your calendar and don’t miss this enchanting day at Erskine Chapel. A place of stories, memories, and timeless beauty, reawakened for a new generation to enjoy.

description:
Brant Bjork Trio, Brant Bjork Trio
In 2025, the trio heads to New Zealand for three exclusive shows celebrating their latest album, Once Upon a Time in the Desert. This is a rare chance to catch a true icon of desert rock live—an experience not to be missed.

Brant Bjork has spent over a quarter of a century at the heart of California’s desert rock scene. From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable.

In 2024, Bjork re-formed the Brant Bjork Trio, teaming up with Michael Amster (Nebula, Mondo Generator) on drums and longtime friend—and desert rock pioneer—Mario Lalli on bass.

Joining them on all three dates are Australian rockers Full Tone Generator. Born on the beaches of Australia by Andy Fernando and brought to life in the Californian desert, Full Tone Generator brings the heat with a powerful blend of riff-heavy rock and raw energy.

description:
NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series- 2025 Round 4 - Faultline Wellington, Get your gains in the capital for the NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series grand finale. NiBS at Faultline in 2024 was the biggest climbing event ever in NZ so don’t miss out.
The NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series is all about having fun and giving it a go! Whether it’s your first climbing competition or you're a seasoned pro, you'll find challenges suited to your skill and confidence level, all within a friendly and supportive atmosphere.
Once the self-scored main rounds are done, the top 6 ranked female and male competitors in the open category advance to the finals. This is where the energy and music volume ramp up and we get to witness some incredible climbing from the best in the game.
Summary of Changes in 2025
- New online registration and scoring platform
- Scoring change, points awarded to each boulder divided by the number of successful tops
- Age group changes to reflect IFSC categories
- Finals format updated to 2025 IFSC Boulder rules
- Youth round (U11, U13, and U15 and caregivers) on Sunday morning
Please read the rules and info page below for more details on the changes: https://www.nibs.nz/rules-and-info
Don't forget to unleash your creative genius and set your own route using our amazing new logo! Try it here:
https://www.nibs.nz/routesetter

Hutt City Night Market - Dowse Square - 30 October 2025, Hutt City Night Market - Dowse Square - 30 October 2025
Hutt City Night Market

📍 Location: Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt
📅 Date: Thursday, 30 October 2025
🕓 Time: 4:00 PM – 8:00 PM
💥 Cost: Free Entry

🌙✨ Join us for the Hutt City Night Market – a new weekly night market bringing food, flavour, and fun to the heart of Lower Hutt!

Come down to Dowse Square every Thursday from 4–8PM, rain or shine, and enjoy a handpicked line up of local food trucks serving a delicious range of cuisines. It’s the perfect way to unwind after work, catch up with friends and whānau, and support small local businesses.

Expect:
🍔 Tasty street food from around the world
🎶 Laid-back vibes and community spirit
🛍️ A weekly night out to look forward to

📢 We’ll be announcing weekly vendor line ups and tasty updates on our Wellington Street Eats Hub Facebook page — so be sure to like and follow us to stay in the loop!

This is just the beginning — we’ll be at Dowse Square for the first 4 weeks, before moving to our long-term home on Daly Street by the Riverbank Carpark with even more food trucks!

Bring your appetite, tell your mates, and we’ll see you there!

#HuttCityNightMarket #LowerHuttEats #StreetFoodVibes #SupportLocal #NightMarketNZ

description:
Matiu Te Huki Haka for life workshop - Moera Hall - Lower Hutt, You can pay online via bank deposit (if you don't want to use credit/debit card) using this account. $30
Please email matiuthehook@gmail.com with your details and a screen shot of the payment so I can secure your spot at the event
Matthew Te Huki
38-9003-0669210-00
Workshop starts at 1:30pm please be there by 1:15 ready to start on time
Haka for Life Workshop
🔥 Haka for life – A Transformational Māori Experience with Matiu 🔥
Step into a sacred, immersive journey led by Matiu—a master of Māori language, performance, and storytelling, with over 30 years of experience empowering individuals across the globe.
This dynamic, interactive workshop weaves together ancient Māori wisdom with modern empowerment, unlocking deep connection, strength, and presence like never before.
🌿 What You’ll Experience:
✔ The Warrior’s Energy – Harness the raw power of haka, the traditional Māori dance that awakens your inner fire and unshakable presence. ✔ The Art of Connection – Learn the profound practice of hongi, the sacred sharing of breath, and cultivate deeper relationships. ✔ The Power of Storytelling & Song – Discover the soul-stirring magic of Māori narrative and music. ✔ Sacred Masculine & Feminine Balance – Explore potent, healing practices that honor, empower, and connect on a deep, transformative level. ✔ Embracing Light & Shadow – Find balance between your strength and vulnerability, your power and grace.
⚡ Why This Workshop?
This is for those who are ready to step into their power. Those who want to speak with confidence, move with purpose, and lead with authenticity.
By the end of this experience, you will: ✅ Feel grounded, present, and connected—to yourself, to spirit, to your ancestors. ✅ Command a room with presence and mana (power) when you speak. ✅ Own your voice—so that people truly listen and feel your words. ✅ Stand in your warrior energy—unshakable, confident, and fully embodied. ✅ Walk away with practical, ancient tools to help you move through life with more strength, clarity, and purpose.
🔥 Are You Ready? 🔥
If you’re up for real growth, if you’re ready to step into your power, be seen, be heard, and be fully present—then this workshop is for YOU.
Matiu’s approach is welcoming, inspiring, fun, safe and deeply empowering.
🌿 Join us. Awaken your warrior. Change your life.
Here are testimonials for workshop:
Kia Ora. I felt new strength to be in integrity with myself and power to speak from this place within. The workshop was a beautiful experience of the love and trust that is possible in community - and
that resonated for ages and flowed into all my interactions moving through life. When are you coming back to Hobart, Matiu, to do more workshops?
Here is another testimonial from Bali spirit fest participant:
It's not often in life, that I've met someone so powerfully walking their talk, that by their presence alone they can offer a deep transformational experience. I have felt this on both the occasions I've had the pleasure to cross Matiu's path. He has an ability to hold space and guide an opening and understanding of the moment, and the current times. Of divine male/female divide, and the healing available to individuals and our collective. I would highly recommend engaging with him on any level, it's definitely been a rewarding and growth promoting experience in my journey.

description:
Celebrating Mahuru Māori: He wheako reorua o He Tohu and Pipitea walking tour — Mahuru Māori 2025, This Mahuru Māori, join a reorua (bilingual) He Tohu experience and hīkoi around Pipitea to celebrate te reo Māori and the unique hītori (history) of Pipitea. Deepen your understanding about ingoa tūturu (original place names) and the wāhi where He Tohu currently sits.
A reorua | bilingual tour of He Tohu and Pipitea
Join us and embark on a haerenga (journey) together to connect to the ancestors and our shared past. The tour will begin at He Tohu — a permanent exhibition of three iconic constitutional taonga that shape Aotearoa New Zealand.
* 1835 He Whakaputanga o te Rangatiratanga o Nu Tireni — Declaration of Independence of the United Tribes of New Zealand
* 1840 Te Tiriti o Waitangi — Treaty of Waitangi
* 1893 Women’s Suffrage Petition — Te Petihana Whakamana Pōti Wahine.
These taonga are significant because they shaped who we are as a nation and will shape what we become in the future.
"Ka mua, ka muri | Walking backwards into the future"
A hīkoi around Pipitea
After the He Tohu tour, join us on a half-hour bilingual hīkoi (walk) around key sites in Pipitea of cultural significance.
There are slight inclines in places, but we will be walking on the pavement for the tour. If the huarere (weather) is looking inclement, please bring warm clothing, a raincoat, or an umbrella. If the weather is too bad, we will postpone the event, so please register so that we can notify you about the cancellation.
Shared kai
During the kaupapa, knowledge, pātai (questions), and reflections will flow between us. At the end we’ll have kai timotimo (snacks). You are welcome to bring snacks to share.
This event is suitable for all ages. Please meet at our waka reception desk on the ground floor before the tour starts.
Nau mai, haere mai!
Book your spot
Places are limited so email us to book your spot.
Please include your contact details and the number of people in your party.
Email — events.natlib@dia.govt.nz
Celebrate te reo Māori
Reorua (bilingual) speaking kaimahi will host your taenga mai ki te whare, visit. Some will be kaimahi tangata whenua and some will be kaimahi Pākehā, Tauiwi rānei. Like us all, this mahi (work) is for us and our descendants — mō tātou, me ō tātou uri, haere ake nei.
Toi te kupu, toi te mana, toi te reo Māori! | Hold fast to the word, to the mana and to the Māori language!
Image: Kaiārahi leading the hīkoi through Pipitea. Photo by Mark Beatty

description:
Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026, Climate Action Week 2026 - Agenda
Dates: February 2026 - 23rd - 27th February
Theme: Leading by Doing: Local Businesses, Local Solutions, Collective Action
Each day features:
Morning: Local Business Story Sessions (Curated stories for our business community to get inspired with raw, honest and authentic stories)
Midday: Action Design Workshops (Crafting Plans & Solutions)
Afternoon: Immersion Experiences and Hands-On Field Visits (Applied Learning & Practical Support)
Day 1 - Water, Risk and Resilience 
Morning: Marlborough businesses facing water risks (horticulture, viticulture, manufacturing, nature, tourism) share adaptation stories: irrigation shifts, stormwater projects, water reuse innovations.
Midday: Business-specific water risks and trials of resilience-building solutions.
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to diverse water initiatives across the region
Day 2 - Circular economy & waste
Morning: Circular leaders (including wine, food and beverages, building, construction, fisheries, nature) show how they have reduced waste, repurposed byproducts, or created new revenue streams from "waste."
Midday: Waste Challenge Mapping: Identify business-specific waste streams + select 1 trial action for next 6 months.
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to waste initiatives and innovative approaches across the region
Day 3 - Nature and Biodiversity 
Morning: Farmers, viticulturists & landscapers share regenerative planting, biodiversity corridors, and ecosystem services initiatives.
Midday: Biodiversity on Your Site Toolkit Workshop — Co-design biodiversity plans for business properties (guided by local ecologists & farming leaders)
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to nature, land and biodiversity initiatives across the region.
Day 4 - Energy & Carbon
Morning: Businesses share their real decarbonisation journeys: EV transitions, renewable installations, process efficiencies — including the unexpected savings, costs and impacts.
Midday: Carbon Reduction Sprints — Design quick-win carbon actions + long-term projects with support from energy consultants and local peers.
Afternoon: Site visits to Carbon and Energy initiatives across the region
Day 5 - Taking the courage to act
Morning: Businesses share how they initiated climate actions, including failures, lessons, and unexpected wins.
Midday: Climate Action Map Workshop — Business leaders build their tailored action roadmaps (guided by peers + facilitators).
Afternoon: Immersion to unique businesses focussed on climate resilience
Immersion Experience Hosts Confirmed
Yealands Estate Winery
Carbonscape
Wineworks
Climate Action Marlborough has had the support of Yealands Estate Wines from its inception and we are super grateful to have their support for Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026. They are committed to influencing the Marlborough business community, driving collaboration that impacts climate resilience, education, health and wellbeing of a thriving region and growing our regions expertise.
